b'Save It Print\nProvencal Endive Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWhole salt preserved anchovies are preferred, but you can also use anchovy paste, perhaps a couple teaspoons, or more to taste, mixed in with the dressing.\nINGREDIENTS\n6 heads of Belgian endive\n2-3 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n2 teaspoons sherry vinegar (optional)\n1/4 teaspoon finely minced fresh garlic\n6 to 12 small oil-packed salted anchovy fillets (jarred or canned), to taste\n1/2 teaspoon salt\nPinch of freshly ground black pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Make the dressing: In a large serving bowl, stir the minced garlic into the olive oil. Roughly chop the anchovy fillets and add them to the oil. Add the salt and pepper and the sherry vinegar.\nLet the dressing sit and the oil infuse while you prep the endives (about 5 minutes).\n2 Prep the endives: Strip off and discard any outer tired leaves from the endives. Cut off and discard the hard root end of the endives.\nSlice the endives crosswise into 1-inch wide pieces. Cut the core end, if thick, into halves or quarters.\n3 Toss endive with dressing: Add the chopped endive leaves to the serving bowl with the dressing, and toss gently until all of the endive leaves are lightly coated in the dressing.\nServe immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nChicken Scampi with Angel Hair Pasta Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 2 to 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound angel hair pasta\n2 tablespoons unsalted butter\n2 tablespoons olive oil\n1/2 pound boneless, skinless chicken cutlets\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\n4 cloves garlic, minced\n1/8 teaspoon (a pinch) crushed red pepper flakes\n1/2 cup dry white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc\nZest and juice of 1 lemon, plus more lemon wedges for serving (about 1 tablespoon of zest and 3 tablespoons of juice)\n1/4 cup chopped parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the pasta: Cook the pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water, according to package instructions or until al dente. Scoop out about a cup of the pasta cooking water and set it aside. Drain the pasta.\n2 Cook the chicken:  Meanwhile, melt the butter with the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Pat the chicken dry and season both sides with the salt and a few grinds of fresh black pepper. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook about 2 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through.\nTransfer the chicken to a cutting board to rest, leaving the fat in the pan.\n3 Make the sauce: Add the garlic and red pepper flakes to the skillet and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the wine and lemon juice, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan, and simmer until reduced by about half, 3 to 5 minutes.\n4 Finish the pasta: Add the cooked pasta, lemon zest, parsley, and 1/2 cup of the reserved pasta water to the skillet and toss to combine. If it seems too dry or like the sauce isn't coating the pasta, stir in some more of the reserved pasta cooking water.\nCut the chicken into slices and toss with the pasta. Serve with extra lemon wedges for squeezing over the scampi.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nClassic Pasta Primavera Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound angel hair pasta or spaghetti\n1 small bunch broccoli, about 1 heaping cup of florets\n1 small zucchini, diced\n4 asparagus spears\n1/2 cup peas, fresh or frozen\n1/2 cup snow peas\n3 minced garlic cloves\n3 Roma or other paste tomatoes, seeded and diced\n12 basil leaves, chopped\n4 tablespoons butter\n1/4 cup chicken broth (use vegetable broth for vegetarian option)\n1/2 cup heavy cream\n1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese\nSalt\nMETHOD\n1 Blanch the broccoli, asparagus, snow peas: Get a large pot of water boiling. Salt it well. It should taste like the sea. Fill a large bowl with ice water. Boil the broccoli for 1 minute.\nAdd the asparagus and boil another minute. Add the snow peas and boil for 30 more seconds.\nRemove all the vegetables and plunge them into the ice water. Once they\xe2\x80\x99re cool, drain in a colander.\nIf you want, you can boil your pasta in the same pot you boiled the vegetables in, or you can start over and boil new water; I use the same water.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 zucchini and garlic, then add tomatoes: In a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan, heat the butter over medium-high heat. When the butter is hot, add the garlic and zucchini and saut\xc3\xa9 1 minute.\nAdd the diced tomatoes and saut\xc3\xa9 another 2 minutes, stirring often.\n3 Add broth, cream, blanched vegetables, peas: Pour in the chicken or vegetable broth and turn the heat to high to bring it to a boil.\nAdd the cream and toss in all the vegetables you boiled, plus the peas. Stir to combine.\nTurn the heat down until the cream-chicken broth mixture is just simmering, not boiling.\n4 Add Parmesan: Add the Parmesan cheese and stir to combine. If the sauce seems too thick \xe2\x80\x93 it should be pretty thick, but not gloppy \xe2\x80\x93 add some more chicken broth, cream or water.\n5 Boil the angel hair pasta: If you are using spaghetti, you will want to start cooking it before you begin saut\xc3\xa9ing the garlic and zucchini. Angel hair will only need 1-2 minutes to cook, vermicelli or spaghetti can take 8-12 minutes.\n6 Transfer cooked pasta to sauce and vegetables: As soon as the pasta is done, transfer it with tongs into the sauce and stir to combine.\nAdd the basil now, and taste for salt. Add salt if needed. Grind some black pepper over everything and serve immediately.\nYou will want a dry white wine with this, ideally a dry French white.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nAngel Hair Pasta with Garlic, Herbs, and Parmesan Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4 as a side\nThis recipe can easily be doubled. If you use delicate herbs such as basil or tarragon, toss them in at the end with the Parmesan.\nINGREDIENTS\n8 ounces angel hair pasta\nSalt\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 Tbsp finely chopped fresh herbs such as rosemary, thyme, oregano\n1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley\n3 cloves of garlic, sliced\n1/8 teaspoon chili pepper flakes (or more to taste)\n1/2 to 1 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper (to taste)\n1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese\nMETHOD\n1 Prepare boiling water for pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. (1 tablespoon of salt for every 2 quarts of water).\n2 Cook garlic and herbs: While the water is heating in step 1, heat the olive oil in a small saucepan on medium heat.  Add the sliced garlic, chili pepper flakes, finely chopped herbs, and chopped parsley to the oil.  Cook for one minute or until the parsley has wilted and the garlic is emitting a strong fragrance.  Remove from heat.\n3 Cook the pasta: The angel hair past will cook in about 2 minutes once it starts, so get everything ready. Once the water is at a rolling boil, add the pasta.  Cook at a rolling boil until al dente. Remove 1/2 a cup of the pasta cooking water and set aside. Drain the pasta and rinse briefly with cold water, just enough to stop the cooking, but not so much as to make the pasta cold. The pasta should still be quite warm.\n4 Combine pasta and herbs: Place pasta in a large bowl. Pour herbed garlic sauce over the pasta and gently toss to combine. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese  and freshly ground black pepper over the pasta and gently toss to combine. If the pasta is a little sticky, add back a little of the pasta cooking water to loosen.\nServe immediately as a side dish. Reheats well if you make ahead.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nAngel Hair Pasta with Shrimp and Parmesan Lemon Cream Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWe used medium shrimp (41-50 per pound) for this recipe, but little cocktail shrimp would also work. Use heavy whipping cream to avoid curdling when mixed and heated with the lemon juice.\nINGREDIENTS\n3/4 cup heavy whipping cream\n1/4 cup chicken stock\n3 Tbsp lemon juice\n3/4 pound angel hair pasta (also called capellini)\nSalt and black pepper\n1 pound raw medium shrimp, peeled and deveined*\n1/2 cup (loosely packed) chopped parsley\n1/4 cup (loosely packed) chopped chives\nZest of a lemon\n1/2 cup freshly grated parmesan cheese\n*To defrost frozen shrimp, place them in a bowl of cold water.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Heat salted water for pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. (1 Tbsp salt for every 2 quarts water)\n2 Simmer cream, stock, lemon juice: In a smaller pot, heat the cream, chicken stock and lemon juice to a low simmer. Simmer gently for 3 to 4 minutes.\n3 Add the angel hair pasta to the boiling water.\n4 Add the shrimp to the simmering lemon cream sauce. Stir well and add a pinch of salt and black pepper. The shrimp should cook in about the same time as the angel hair pasta, about 3 to 4 minutes.\nHalfway through the cooking, stir in the parsley and chives.\n5 Drain pasta, combine with shrimp, sauce, zest, Parmesan: When the pasta is done, drain and put it in a large bowl. Stir in the shrimp and lemon cream sauce, the lemon zest, and most of the Parmesan.\nDivide into servings, and top with the remaining parmesan.\nNote, if the resulting mixture seems too dry, just add a little water or cream. If it seems too wet, don't worry, the pasta will absorb the sauce.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Save It Print\nAngel Hair Pasta with Salmon, Arugula, and Creamy Lemon-Parmesan Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: 6 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, separated\n6 salmon fillets (2 1/2 to 3 ounces each, about 1 to 1 1/4 pounds total), preferably wild-caught King or Sockeye salmon\n2 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, divided\n1 teaspoon ground black pepper, divided\n1 pound angel hair pasta\n4 tablespoons unsalted butter, separated\n1 tablespoon minced shallot\n4 garlic cloves, minced\n1 cup dry white wine or seafood stock\nJuice and rinds of 2 lemons (1/3 to 1/2 cup juice)\n2 cups heavy cream\n5 ounces arugula (4 packed cups)\n1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Warm your oven: Set the oven to its lowest setting (mine is 150\xc2\xb0F) to keep the salmon warm once it's cooked.\n2 Start the water for pasta. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil.\n3 Season the salmon fillets: Rub both sides of the fillets with 1 teaspoon of the kosher salt and a 1/2 teaspoon of the black pepper.\n4 Sear the salmon: Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over medium-high heat in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan (preferably nonstick). Once the oil starts to ripple in the pan, place the salmon fillets into the pan, skin-side up.\nPress the fillets down gently to make sure the entire surface makes contact with the pan. Sear the salmon fillets for 3 minutes, or until the flesh turns an opaque pink 1/4 of the way up the sides of the fillets.\n5 Flip the salmon and keep it hot: Use a spatula to flip the salmon and sear it, skin-side down, for an additional 3 minutes.\nTransfer the fillets to a sheet pan and place them in the heated oven while you finish the dish. It\xe2\x80\x99s okay if the salmon is not cooked completely through just yet\xe2\x80\x94it will continue to cook in the oven.\n6 Cook the shallot and deglaze the pan: In the same pan you used to sear the salmon, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and 2 tablespoons of the butter over medium-high heat. Add the shallot and the garlic to the pan and saut\xc3\xa9 for 3 minutes, or until glossy and fragrant.\nPour the white wine and lemon juice into the pan and use a wooden spoon to scrape up any bits of food that have stuck to the bottom of the pan. Add the lemon halves and bring the mixture to a boil.\n7 Reduce the sauce and cook the pasta: Reduce the sauce in the pan by half by maintaining a boil. This should take 3 to 4 minutes.\n8 Cook the pasta: By now, your pasta water should be at a rolling boil. Add generous tablespoon of salt to the boiling water and drop the pasta into the middle of the pot. Stir the pasta immediately to separate the noodles.\nLower the temperature slightly to prevent the water from boiling over and cook the pasta for 4 to 5 minutes, until al dente (or according to package directions). Drain the pasta.\n9 Finish the sauce:  Once the liquid in the pan has reduced by half, reduce the heat to medium-low. Remove the lemon halves. Slowly stir in the heavy cream and the remaining butter.\nAllow the sauce to come to a simmer, then add the arugula. Stir to coat the arugula in the sauce and allow it to wilt slightly\xe2\x80\x94this should only take a minute or so. Add the Parmesan, along with the remaining salt and pepper. Taste and adjust the seasoning, if necessary, by adding a bit more salt or pepper.\n10 Combine the pasta and sauce: Add the pasta to the pan with the sauce. Using tongs, toss in the pasta in the sauce until it is evenly coated.\n11 Serve the pasta with the salmon: Remove the warm salmon fillets from the oven and arrange on top of the pasta. Serve immediately. While this dish is best enjoyed the same day it\xe2\x80\x99s made, we have had success with reheating the leftovers in the microwave the next day.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nPasta Pomodoro with Shrimp Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 3 to 4\nTo safely defrost frozen shrimp, place in a bowl of ice water.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound angel hair pasta\n3/4 pound raw, peeled, deveined shrimp (medium sized)\n4 medium ripe tomatoes\n3 cloves garlic, minced\n1/3 cup torn fresh basil leaves\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil (divided, 1 Tbsp and 2 Tbsp)\nSalt\nPepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Blanch and peel the tomatoes: Fill a large pot with 2 quarts of water. Bring to a boil. (You will be using this water to both blanch the tomatoes and boil the pasta.)\nCore the tomatoes and use a sharp knife to cut a small X into the bottom end of each tomato. When the water is boiling, use a slotted spoon to lower the tomatoes into the water.\nBlanch for no more than one minute, just enough to loosen the skins. Remove tomatoes with a slotted spoon to a bowl of icy water, saving the blanching water.\nPeel off the tomato skins from the tomatoes. Cut the tomatoes crosswise in half, and squeeze out most of the seeds and juices.\nChop the tomatoes into 1-inch pieces.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 the shrimp: Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium high heat. Add the shrimp to the pan and cook for 1 minute. Turn the shrimp over in the pan. Lower the heat to medium.\n3 Add garlic, tomatoes, basil: Add the garlic, cook a minute more. Add the chopped tomatoes and basil. Sprinkle with salt. Cook for a minute more and remove from heat.\n4 Cook the angel hair pasta: Add a tablespoon of salt to the water you used to blanch the tomatoes. Bring to a boil again. Add the angel hair pasta and cook for 3 minutes.\n5 Add cooked pasta to shrimp and tomatoes: Drain the pasta and immediately add to pot with the shrimp and tomatoes. Drizzle the pasta with 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Then stir the pasta in with the shrimp and tomatoes.\nServe immediately or at room temp.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nQuick and Easy Shrimp with Angel Hair Pasta Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nIf you are working with frozen shrimp, to defrost place in a large bowl, cover with an inch or two of cold water, stir a couple teaspoons of salt into the water, add a few ice cubes. Let sit until defrosted.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup extra virgin olive olive\n2 cups finely diced red and green bell peppers (3 to 4 bell peppers)\n2 Tbsp grated fresh ginger root\n2 cloves garlic, minced (about 2 teaspoons)\nSalt\n1 pound peeled and deveined medium sized shrimp (31-40 count)\n4 Tbsp fresh lime juice (can sub lemon juice)\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n3 Tbsp chopped chives (or green onion greens)\n3/4 pound angel hair pasta\nMETHOD\n1 Heat salted water for pasta: Put a large pot of salted water (4 quarts of water, 2 Tbsp salt) on high heat. While the water is heating, continue with the recipe.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 bell peppers, ginger, garlic: Heat 3 Tbsp olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium high heat. Add the diced bell peppers and cook until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add the grated ginger and minced garlic, and cook for 1 to 2 minutes more.\n3 Add shrimp: Add the shrimp and cook until just cooked through and no longer translucent, about 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle with lime juice, the remaining olive oil, and black pepper. Remove from heat.\n4 Cook pasta: When the pasta water is boiling, add the angel hair pasta and cook for 2 minutes or until cooked through, but still slightly al dente. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of the pasta water.\n5 Add pasta to shrimp: Add the drained pasta back to the pan with the shrimp. Add the reserved pasta cooking water to the pot. Stir to combine all of the ingredients. Sprinkle with chopped chives to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Print\nSopa Seca de Fideo (Mexican-style Angel Hair Nests) Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4\nIf you can't find angel hair nests at the market, you can make fideo with straight vermicelli pasta. Just break up the pasta in 3 to 4 inch long segments and cook the same way as you would the nests, browning them first in hot oil.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound angel hair nests or vermicelli (vermicelli usually comes in 1 pound packages, so about 1/2 a package)\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 yellow onion, chopped (about 3/4 cup)\n2 fresh tomatoes, peeled and chopped, or 1/2 cup crushed canned tomatoes\n2 cups chicken broth or stock\nSalt and pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Brown the angle hair nests: Choose a frying pan with a lid in which the angel hair nests will all tightly fit in a single layer (about 9 or 10-inches wide, depending on the brand of angel hair nests you use). In the pan, heat the oil until shimmering hot.\nWorking in batches, fry the vermicelli angel hair nests on both sides in the hot oil until golden brown in color. Remove from pan.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 tomatoes and onion, add broth: Add the chopped onions to the pan and saut\xc3\xa9 until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes. Add the chicken broth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.\n3 Cook angel hair nests in simmering broth: Bring the broth mixture to a simmer. When broth is simmering, place the browned angel hair nests or vermicelli in a single layer in the pan, nestled into the broth. The nests should cover the whole pan. Turn them over in the broth so that they get moistened on all sides.\nCover and cook until the vermicelli has soaked up the liquid, about 5 minutes. If after 5 minutes the top of the vermicelli is dry, flip over the individual angel hair nests and cook a minute longer.\n4 Serve: Remove from heat and let sit for 5 minutes before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Print\nRoast Chicken on Angel Hair Pasta Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: 4 servings\nAt my grocery store, I can buy nests of fresh angel hair pasta, which I love for this dish. If you find something similar at your grocery store, give it a try! The cooking times will be the same.\nAnother name for angel hair pasta is capellini; either is fine in this recipe.\nLook for chicken legs (thigh and drumstick attached) at the meat counter at your grocery store. If you can\'t find them, then buy two bone-in, skin-on thighs and two drumsticks, or buy a whole chicken and spatchcock it before roasting.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound angel hair pasta\n6 tablespoons olive oil, divided\n1 (15-ounce) can diced tomatoes with their juices\n1 teaspoon salt, divided\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh oregano, divided\n2 whole chicken legs (thighs and drumsticks attached), on the bone (1 1/2 pounds total)\n2 large chicken breast halves, on the bone (1 1/2 pounds total)\n1 sprig fresh oregano, leaves removed, for garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the angel hair: Bring a pot of salted water to a rapid boil over high heat and cook the angel hair until al dente, about 4 minutes. Drain the pasta.\n2 Transfer the pasta to the baking dish: Use 1 tablespoon of olive oil to coat the bottom and sides of a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Using tongs, transfer the pasta to the baking dish.\nIf you like, twirl the pasta into several small "nests" within the dish. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil evenly over top of the pasta and set the dish aside.\n3 Heat the oven to 400\xc2\xb0F.\n4 Cook the tomatoes: Warm 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the tomatoes and their juices, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, red pepper, and 1 tablespoon of the oregano.\nCook, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes. Spoon the tomato mixture evenly over the nests; they will not be covered completely.\n5 Add the chicken: Rub the chicken skin with the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper.\nSet the chicken on the nests, skin side up. Sprinkle with the remaining tablespoon of oregano.\n6 Roast the chicken: Transfer the dish to the oven and roast the chicken for 45 to 60 minutes, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a breasts and thighs registers 165\xc2\xb0F. Remove from the oven and rest for 10 minutes.\n7 Cut and serve the chicken: Cut the legs in half to make 2 thighs and 2 drumsticks (you can do this right in the dish). Cut the breasts in half horizontally. Break up the angel hair with a metal spoon or knife. Serve the chicken pieces with some of the pasta from underneath.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nAngel Hair Pasta with Quick Cherry Tomato Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nIf you're good at multitasking, start the sauce as soon as the pasta goes into the pot so everything comes together at about the same time. If this feels stressful, cook the pasta first and then start the sauce. Either way, dinner is ready fast!\nFor a fancier presentation, if serving this at a dinner party, remove half of the tomatoes before tossing with the pasta. Plate the pasta, then top with the reserved tomatoes.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 1/2 teaspoons salt\n1 pounds angel hair pasta (capellini or capelli d\xe2\x80\x99Angelo), or another thin spaghetti\n4 tablespoons olive oil\n2 pints red and yellow cherry tomatoes\n1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\n2 cloves garlic, very thinly sliced\n1 cup fresh basil leaves, removed from the stems\n1 cup grated Parmesan cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the pasta: Bring a large pot of water with 2 teaspoons of salt to a boil. Add the pasta and stir well until the water returns to a boil.\nCook for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until the pasta is tender. With a ladle or a heat-proof liquid measuring cup, remove about 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water and set aside.\nDrain the pasta but do not rinse it; transfer to a bowl. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of the oil and toss well.\n2 Prep the tomatoes: Pierce small whole tomatoes with a skewer or the tip of a paring knife. Halve the tomatoes if they\xe2\x80\x99re large.\n3 Make the sauce: In a deep skillet over medium-high heat, heat the remaining 3 tablespoons of oil. Add the cherry tomatoes \xe2\x80\x93 they will splutter \xe2\x80\x93 along with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, red pepper, and black pepper.\nCook, shaking the pan, for 2 to 3 minutes, or until the tomatoes start to collapse and form juices. Add the garlic and continue cooking for 2 minutes more.\n4 Toss the pasta with the sauce: Add the pasta and 1/4 cup of the pasta water to the skillet with the tomato sauce. Toss well.\nAdd more pasta water if needed, a tablespoon at a time, to thin the mixture so the sauce coats the pasta. Add half the basil leaves and toss again.\n5 Serve: Divide the pasta among 4 to 6 large bowls. Add a few basil leaves on top of the pasta and sprinkle generously with Parmesan.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nAngel Hair Pasta with Clams, Cherry Tomatoes, and Basil Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 2 to 3\nSave time by prepping the shallots, garlic, tomatoes, and basil while the water for the pasta is heating up.\nINGREDIENTS\n30 cherry tomatoes, sliced in half\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n4 Tbsp chopped fresh basil, divided\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 cup sliced shallots\n2 cloves minced garlic\n2 6-ounce cans chopped clams (and their juices)\n8 ounces capellini or angel hair pasta\nSalt for the pasta water\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Toss cherries with salt and basil: Place sliced cherry tomatoes in a bowl. Toss with 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 2 Tbsp of the chopped fresh basil. Set aside.\n2 Boil salted water, prep shallots and garlic: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil (4 quarts of water, 2 Tbsp salt). While the water is coming to a boil, prep the shallots and garlic and start the sauce.\n3 Make tomato clam sauce: Heat the olive oil in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan on medium heat. Add the sliced shallots and cook until translucent, stirring often. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds more.\nAdd the tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add the chopped clams with their juices.\nReduce the heat to low and let simmer at a low temperature while the pasta is cooking in the next step.\n4 Cook the pasta: Once the salted pasta water comes to a rolling boil, add pasta and cook, uncovered at high heat until al dente, no more than 2 minutes.\nDrain the pasta, reserving 1/4 cup of the pasta water. Add the 1/4 cup of pasta water to the sauce in the saut\xc3\xa9 pan.\n5 Combine pasta and sauce: Add the pasta to the cherry tomato mixture and toss to combine. Stir in the remaining 2 Tbsp chopped fresh basil.\nServe immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Print\nSopa Seca de Fideo with Tomatillos Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 4\nIf you want, you can substitute a cup of prepared tomatillo salsa verde for the sauce you make in step one. The original recipe calls for using Hoja Santa cheese, which is goat cheese wrapped in aromatic Hoja Santa leaves. It\'s a lovely cheese to use if you can find it, otherwise regular goat cheese will do.\nINGREDIENTS\n3/4 pound tomatillos (about 6 medium sized), husks removed\n1 to 2 serrano chiles\n1/4 medium onion\n1 clove garlic\n2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, plus extra for garnish\n4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided\n4 ounces fresh Mexican chorizo, casing removed, crumbled\n8 ounces capellini, or angel hair pasta, broken into 1 to 1 1/2-inch pieces\n1 teaspoon sea salt\nFreshly ground black pepper\n2 1/2 cups chicken stock\n4 ounces goat cheese, crumbled\n1 avocado, seeded, peeled, diced\nCrema fresca or sour cream\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Broil tomatillos, chiles, onion: Place the tomatillos, serrano chiles, an quarter onion on a baking sheet lightly greased with olive oil. Broil for about 15 minutes until somewhat charred and blistered. Remove the stems from the serranos.\n2 Make tomatillo sauce: Working in batches if necessary, pur\xc3\xa9e the chiles, tomatillos, onion, a clove of garlic, and 2 tablespoons of the chopped cilantro in a blender, making sure not to fill the blender more than halfway. Once blended you should have about a cup of sauce.\n3 Cook the chorizo: Heat 2 Tbsp of oil in a large saucepan on medium heat. Add the chorizo and cook 3 to 4 minutes until cooked through and crispy. Use a wooden spoon to crumble up the chorizo as it cooks.\nUse a slotted spoon to remove the chorizo to a paper-towel lined plate, keeping the fat and oil in the pan.\n4 Brown the dry noodles: Place the broken up dry pasta into the pan and increase the heat to medium high. Lightly brown the dry noodles in the chorizo oil. Remove the pasta from the pan and set aside.\n5 Cook the tomatillo sauce: Add the remaining 2 Tbsp of oil to the pan and heat on medium high heat. Add the tomatillo sauce and the salt. The sauce should bubble up from the heat of the pan. Cook for about a minute, allowing the sauce to reduce by about a quarter cup. Dragging your spoon through the sauce should leave a trail for a second or two.\n6 Add pasta: Add the pasta back to the pan with the tomatillo sauce and cook it until it has absorbed the liquid.\n7 Add stock, simmer and cook: Add the chicken stock. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Let cook undisturbed for about 15 minutes, or until the pasta is soft and the stock absorbed. The pasta will be past "al dente" but shouldn\'t be cooked to a mush.\n8 Serve: Place in serving bowls and garnish with crumbled chorizo, goat cheese, avocado, cilantro, and crema fresca or sour cream.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nHow to Make Perfect Guacamole Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 2-4\nBe careful handling chiles if using. Wash your hands thoroughly after handling and do not touch your eyes or the area near your eyes with your hands for several hours.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 ripe avocados\n1/4 teaspoon of salt, more to taste\n1 tablespoon fresh lime juice or lemon juice\n2 tablespoons to 1/4 cup of minced red onion or thinly sliced green onion\n1-2 serrano chiles, stems and seeds removed, minced\n2 tablespoons cilantro (leaves and tender stems), finely chopped\nA dash of freshly grated black pepper\n1/2 ripe tomato, seeds and pulp removed, chopped\nRed radishes or jicama, to garnish\nTortilla chips, to serve\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cut the avocado, remove flesh: Cut the avocados in half. Remove the pit. Score the inside of the avocado with a blunt knife and scoop out the flesh with a spoon. (See How to Cut and Peel an Avocado.) Place in a bowl.\n2 Mash with a fork: Using a fork, roughly mash the avocado. (Don't overdo it! The guacamole should be a little chunky.)\n3 Add salt, lime juice, and the rest: Sprinkle with salt and lime (or lemon) juice. The acid in the lime juice will provide some balance to the richness of the avocado and will help delay the avocados from turning brown.\nAdd the chopped onion, cilantro, black pepper, and chiles. Chili peppers vary individually in their hotness. So, start with a half of one chili pepper and add to the guacamole to your desired degree of hotness.\nRemember that much of this is done to taste because of the variability in the fresh ingredients. Start with this recipe and adjust to your taste.\nChilling tomatoes hurts their flavor, so if you want to add chopped tomato to your guacamole, add it just before serving.\n4 Serve: Serve immediately, or if making a few hours ahead, place plastic wrap on the surface of the guacamole and press down to cover it and to prevent air reaching it. (The oxygen in the air causes oxidation which will turn the guacamole brown.) Refrigerate until ready to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nFresh Tomato Salsa (Pico de Gallo) Recipe\nPrep time: 6 minutesYield: Makes 3 to 4 cups of salsa\nWhen using fresh chile peppers always taste first before adding! Some peppers are hotter than others and you really can't tell unless you taste them. Just take a very small taste. You'll be able to gauge the heat of the pepper and will be better able to judge how much you need.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 to 3 medium sized fresh tomatoes (1 to 1 1/2 pounds), stems removed\n1/2 red onion\n2 serrano chiles or 1 jalape\xc3\xb1o chile (stems, ribs, seeds removed), less or more to taste\nJuice of one lime\n1/2 cup chopped cilantro\nSalt and pepper to taste\nPinch dried oregano (crumble in your fingers before adding), more to taste\nPinch ground cumin, more to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Prep the ingredients: Roughly chop the tomatoes, chiles, and onions. Be careful while handling the chile peppers. Use a plastic baggie or disposable gloves to handle them, or wash your hands thoroughly with soap and hot water after handling and avoid touching your eyes for several hours.\nSet aside some of the seeds from the peppers. If the salsa isn't hot enough, you can add a few for more heat.\n2 Make the salsa: Place all of the ingredients in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the blade. Pulse only a few times, just enough to finely dice the ingredients and not enough to pur\xc3\xa9e. If you don't have a food processor, you can finely dice by hand.\n3 Adjust seasonings: Place in a serving bowl. Add salt and pepper to taste. If the chilies make the salsa too hot, add some more chopped tomato. If it's not hot enough, carefully add a few of the seeds from the chilies, or add a little more ground cumin.\nLet the salsa sit for an hour (room temperature or chilled) for the flavors to combine.\n4 Serve: Serve with chips, tortillas, tacos, burritos, tostadas, quesadillas, pinto or black beans. The salsa will keep refrigerated for up to 5 days.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nMozzarella and Basil Stuffed Tomatoes Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Makes 8 stuffed tomato cups, 4 servings\nIf preparing gluten-free, use gluten-free bread or bread crumbs.\nINGREDIENTS\n4 medium tomatoes with firm, fleshy walls, 2 1/2 inches wide\n1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese\n1/3 cup grated parmesan cheese, divided\n1/4 cup packed fresh basil, chopped, plus more for garnish\n1 slice of bread (enough to make 1/4 cup breadcrumbs)\n1 tablespoon melted salted butter\n1 teaspoon minced garlic\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1/8 teaspoon pepper\nOlive oil for drizzling\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Make the soft breadcrumbs: To make the 1/4 cup soft breadcrumbs, remove the crust from 1 slice of bread (preferably stale) and either pulse in a small food processor or shred with a fork until the bread resembles fine, sand-like crumbs.\n3 Prepare the tomatoes: Slice the tomatoes in half horizontally around the equator and use a spoon to scoop out the flesh. Be careful not to puncture the walls of the tomato, but if you do, the filling will plug the hole. Place empty tomato halves in a casserole dish and season with salt and pepper.\nUsing your hands or a spoon, separate the seeds from the scooped out tomato flesh and transfer the flesh to a cutting board. Discard the seeds and the tomato water. Chop the flesh and set aside for the stuffing.\n4 Make the stuffing: In a medium bowl, add the mozzarella cheese, 1/4 cup of the parmesan cheese, basil, breadcrumbs, butter, garlic, salt, and pepper and stir to thoroughly combine.\n5 Bake: Using two spoons, fill the tomato halves with the stuffing. Sprinkle filled tomatoes with the remaining parmesan cheese and drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 15 minutes, or until tomatoes are tender, then broil on high for 1 minute until the filling begins to bubble and brown.\n6 Serve: Garnish with a few torn basil leaves and serve hot.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nBlistered Shishito Peppers Recipe\nPrep time: 3 minutesCook time: 6 minutesYield: serves 2-4\nRecipe is easily doubled, but cook in batches so as not to crowd the pan.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil\n20 or so shishito peppers (about 4 or 5 ounces, 1 small basket)\nSprinkle of kosher salt\n2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Toss peppers with oil: Toss shishito peppers with extra virgin olive oil in a bowl, so the peppers are well coated.\n2 Sear in frying pan: Heat a well seasoned cast iron (or a pan that can take high heat) on high heat. When the pan is hot, add the peppers to the pan in a single layer. Let the peppers sear and blister on one side, then use tongs to turn them over individually to sear on the other side.\n3 Salt: Remove to a bowl and sprinkle the shishito peppers with salt.\n4 Make balsamic glaze (Optional):  Add a couple tablespoons of balsamic vinegar* to the pan. Remove from heat, and let bubble until the vinegar reduces to a glaze, which should be very quickly. Pour over the blistered shishito peppers.\n*Balsamic vinegar can be syrupy and sweet, or thin and acidic. Use the syrupy kind. If what you have is thin and very acidic, stir with a half teaspoon of sugar or honey before adding to the hot pan.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nBaba Ganoush (Eggplant Dip) Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 4-8 as an appetizer\nINGREDIENTS\n1-2 globe eggplants (totaling 2 pounds or 900 g)\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2-3 tablespoons roasted tahini (sesame paste)\n1-2 garlic cloves (more or less depending on how garlicky you want your baba ghanouj to be), finely chopped\n1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\nJuice of one lemon (about 2 1/2 tablespoons)\nSalt and cayenne pepper to taste\n1 tablespoon chopped parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Roast the eggplants: Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F. Poke the eggplants in several places with the tines of a fork. Cut the eggplants in half lengthwise and brush the cut sides lightly with olive oil (about 1 tablespoon).\nPlace on a baking sheet, cut side down, and roast until very tender, about 35-40 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 15 minutes.\nAlternate Grilling Instructions: Preheat grill. Poke the eggplants in a few places with a fork, then rub the eggplants with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.\nGrill over high heat, turning as each side blackens. Put the charred eggplants in a paper bag, close the bag and let the eggplants steam in their skins for 15-20 minutes.\n2 Scoop the eggplant flesh into a large bowl and mash well with a fork.\n3 Add garlic, olive oil, tahini, cumin, lemon juice, salt, cayenne: Combine the eggplant, minced garlic, remaining olive oil (about 2 tablespoons), tahini, cumin, 2 tablespoons of the lemon juice, the salt, and a pinch of cayenne.\nMash well. You want the mixture to be somewhat smooth but still retaining some of the eggplant's texture.\n4 Cool and season to taste: Allow the baba ganoush to cool to room temperature, then season to taste with additional lemon juice, salt, and cayenne.\nIf you want, swirl a little olive oil on the top. Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley.\nServe with pita bread, crackers, toast, sliced baguette, celery, or cucumber slices.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nHow to Make Perfect Guacamole Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 2-4\nBe careful handling chiles if using. Wash your hands thoroughly after handling and do not touch your eyes or the area near your eyes with your hands for several hours.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 ripe avocados\n1/4 teaspoon of salt, more to taste\n1 tablespoon fresh lime juice or lemon juice\n2 tablespoons to 1/4 cup of minced red onion or thinly sliced green onion\n1-2 serrano chiles, stems and seeds removed, minced\n2 tablespoons cilantro (leaves and tender stems), finely chopped\nA dash of freshly grated black pepper\n1/2 ripe tomato, seeds and pulp removed, chopped\nRed radishes or jicama, to garnish\nTortilla chips, to serve\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cut the avocado, remove flesh: Cut the avocados in half. Remove the pit. Score the inside of the avocado with a blunt knife and scoop out the flesh with a spoon. (See How to Cut and Peel an Avocado.) Place in a bowl.\n2 Mash with a fork: Using a fork, roughly mash the avocado. (Don't overdo it! The guacamole should be a little chunky.)\n3 Add salt, lime juice, and the rest: Sprinkle with salt and lime (or lemon) juice. The acid in the lime juice will provide some balance to the richness of the avocado and will help delay the avocados from turning brown.\nAdd the chopped onion, cilantro, black pepper, and chiles. Chili peppers vary individually in their hotness. So, start with a half of one chili pepper and add to the guacamole to your desired degree of hotness.\nRemember that much of this is done to taste because of the variability in the fresh ingredients. Start with this recipe and adjust to your taste.\nChilling tomatoes hurts their flavor, so if you want to add chopped tomato to your guacamole, add it just before serving.\n4 Serve: Serve immediately, or if making a few hours ahead, place plastic wrap on the surface of the guacamole and press down to cover it and to prevent air reaching it. (The oxygen in the air causes oxidation which will turn the guacamole brown.) Refrigerate until ready to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. b"Save It Print\nFresh Tomato Salsa (Pico de Gallo) Recipe\nPrep time: 6 minutesYield: Makes 3 to 4 cups of salsa\nWhen using fresh chile peppers always taste first before adding! You'll be able to gauge the heat of the pepper and will be better able to judge how much you need.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 to 3 medium sized fresh tomatoes (1 to 1 1/2 pounds), stems removed\n1/2 red onion\n2 serrano chiles or 1 jalape\xc3\xb1o chile (stems, ribs, seeds removed), less or more to taste\nJuice of one lime\n1/2 cup chopped cilantro\nSalt and pepper to taste\nPinch dried oregano (crumble in your fingers before adding), more to taste\nPinch ground cumin, more to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Prep the ingredients: Roughly chop the tomatoes, chiles, and onions. Be careful while handling the chile peppers. Use a plastic baggie or disposable gloves to handle them, or wash your hands thoroughly with soap and hot water after handling and avoid touching your eyes for several hours.\nSet aside some of the seeds from the peppers. If the salsa isn't hot enough, you can add a few for more heat.\n2 Make the salsa: Place all of the ingredients in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the blade. Pulse only a few times, just enough to finely dice the ingredients and not enough to pur\xc3\xa9e. If you don't have a food processor, you can finely dice by hand.\n3 Adjust seasonings: Place in a serving bowl. Add salt and pepper to taste. If the chilies make the salsa too hot, add some more chopped tomato. If it's not hot enough, carefully add a few of the seeds from the chilies, or add a little more ground cumin.\nLet the salsa sit for an hour (room temperature or chilled) for the flavors to combine.\n4 Serve: Serve with chips, tortillas, tacos, burritos, tostadas, quesadillas, pinto or black beans. The salsa will keep refrigerated for up to 5 days.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nThe Best Nachos Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 6\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the spice mix:\n2 tablespoons chili powder\n1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt\n1 teaspoon granulated garlic\n1 teaspoon granulated onion\n1 teaspoon ground cumin\n1/2 teaspoon dried oregano\n1/4 teaspoon black pepper\nPinch of cayenne pepper (optional)\nFor the nachos:\n1 teaspoon vegetable oil\n1 pound ground beef (80:20 lean-to-fat ratio)\n16 ounces (2 cups) refried beans, canned or homemade\n1/4 cup water\n1 large bag of tortilla chips\n4 ounces cheddar cheese, grated (about 2 cups), plus more for topping\n4 ounces Colby Jack cheese, grated (about 2 cups), plus more for topping\n1 cup pico de gallo, store-bought or homemade, plus more for topping\n1/4 cup chopped cilantro\n1 sliced jalape\xc3\xb1o (pickled or fresh)\nOptional toppings:\nGuacamole\nSalsa\nSour cream\nCanned black olives\nSliced green onions\nShredded lettuce\nCorn\nHot sauce\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Make the taco spice blend: Combine all of the spices (chili powder through cayenne) together in a small bowl.\n3 Make the beef and bean topping: Heat the vegetable oil on medium high heat until it begins to shimmer. Add the ground beef to the pan and season it with all of the taco spice blend. As the meat cooks, use a spoon to break the meat up into crumbles.\nCook for about 8 minutes until the meat has browned and drain the fat using a colander.\nReturn the meat to the pan and add the refried beans and the water. Heat the mixture until the beans are smooth and warmed through. Reduce the heat to low and keep the beef-bean mixture warm while you prepare the chips.\n4 Toast the chips: On a 13x18-inch oven-safe platter or sheet pan, arrange the tortilla chips in a single layer, overlapping them slightly. Toast the chips in the preheated oven for 5 minutes, or just until you begin to smell their aroma.\n5 Assemble and bake the nachos: Carefully remove the pan from the oven and top with one half of the shredded cheeses. Allow the heat from the chips to melt the cheese slightly before topping the chips with the beef and bean mixture.\nSprinkle the remaining cheese over the beef and return the pan to the oven for 5 minutes, or until the cheese has fully melted.\n6 Top and serve: Top the nachos with the pico de gallo, chopped cilantro, jalape\xc3\xb1o slices, or any of your preferred toppings. Serve hot.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nMozzarella and Basil Stuffed Tomatoes Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Makes 8 stuffed tomato cups, 4 servings\nIf preparing gluten-free, use gluten-free bread or bread crumbs.\nINGREDIENTS\n4 medium tomatoes with firm, fleshy walls, 2 1/2 inches wide\n1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese\n1/3 cup grated parmesan cheese, divided\n1/4 cup packed fresh basil, chopped, plus more for garnish\n1 slice of bread (enough to make 1/4 cup breadcrumbs)\n1 tablespoon melted salted butter\n1 teaspoon minced garlic\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1/8 teaspoon pepper\nOlive oil for drizzling\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Make the soft breadcrumbs: To make the 1/4 cup soft breadcrumbs, remove the crust from 1 slice of bread (preferably stale) and either pulse in a small food processor or shred with a fork until the bread resembles fine, sand-like crumbs.\n3 Prepare the tomatoes: Slice the tomatoes in half horizontally around the equator and use a spoon to scoop out the flesh. Be careful not to puncture the walls of the tomato, but if you do, the filling will plug the hole. Place empty tomato halves in a casserole dish and season with salt and pepper.\nUsing your hands or a spoon, separate the seeds from the scooped out tomato flesh and transfer the flesh to a cutting board. Discard the seeds and the tomato water. Chop the flesh and set aside for the stuffing.\n4 Make the stuffing: In a medium bowl, add the mozzarella cheese, 1/4 cup of the parmesan cheese, basil, breadcrumbs, butter, garlic, salt, and pepper and stir to thoroughly combine.\n5 Bake: Using two spoons, fill the tomato halves with the stuffing. Sprinkle filled tomatoes with the remaining parmesan cheese and drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 15 minutes, or until tomatoes are tender, then broil on high for 1 minute until the filling begins to bubble and brown.\n6 Serve: Garnish with a few torn basil leaves and serve hot.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nBruschetta with Tomato and Basil Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Makes 24 small slices, serves 6-10 as an appetizer\nUse any flavorful, ripe tomato for this recipe. If you use cherry tomatoes, just quarter them, don't bother blanching or peeling them.\nINGREDIENTS\n6 or 7 ripe tomatoes (about 1 1/2 lbs)\n2 cloves garlic, minced (about 2 teaspoons)\n1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar\n6-8 fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced* or chopped\n3/4 teaspoon sea salt, more or less to taste\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, more or less to taste\n1 baguette French bread or similar Italian bread\n1/4 cup (60 ml) olive oil\n*To thinly slice basil leaves, stack the leaves on top of each other and roll up like a cigar. Then make thin slices from one end of the basil cigar to the other.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Blanch and peel the tomatoes: Bring 2 quarts of water to a boil. As the water is heating make shallow cuts in a cross pattern at the tip ends of the tomatoes (this will make the tomatoes easier to peel).\nOnce the water is boiling, remove the pot from the heat. Put the tomatoes in the hot water and blanch for 1 minute.\nRemove with a slotted spoon and let sit until cool enough to handle. Then gently peel off the tomato skins. Cut out the stem base with a paring knife.\nCut the tomatoes into halves or quarters and squeeze out most of the juices and seeds.\n2 Preheat oven to 450\xc2\xb0F (230\xc2\xb0C) with a rack in the top slot of the oven.\n3 Chop tomatoes, toss them with garlic, olive oil, vinegar, basil, salt and pepper: Finely chop the tomatoes and place them in a medium bowl. Mix in the minced garlic, 1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil, and the balsamic vinegar.\nStir in the thinly sliced basil and add salt and freshly ground black pepper, adding more to taste. Note, tomatoes love salt; you may need to add more than you expect.\n4 Toast the baguette slices: Use a bread knife to slice the baguette on the diagonal making half-inch thick slices. Brush one side of each slice with olive oil (a pastry brush helps here) and place olive oil-side down on a baking sheet or roasting pan.\nThe baguette slices will toast best in the top rack of your oven, so you may need to work in batches to toast them all.\nWhen the oven has reached 450\xc2\xb0F (230\xc2\xb0C) place the slices in the oven on the top rack and toast for 5 to 6 minutes until lightly browned around the edges.\nIf you want you can toast the bread slices without coating them first in olive oil. Toast them until lightly browned on both sides. Then cut a clove of garlic in half and rub over one side of the toast. Then brush with olive oil. (See Easiest Ever Garlic Bread.)\n5 Serve toasted bread with tomato mixture: Arrange the toasted bread on a platter, olive oil side facing up (the olive oil will help create a temporary barrier keeping the bread from getting soggy from the chopped tomatoes).\nEither serve the toasts plain with a bowl of the tomato bruschetta mixture on the side for people to top their own, or use a spoon to gently top each toasted bread slice with some of the tomato mixture. If you top each slice individually, do it right before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nEasy Baked Brie in Puff Pastry Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\n1 large sheet of puff pastry dough or 1 tube of refrigerated crescent dinner rolls\n1 round or wedge of Brie cheese (do not remove rind)\n2 tablespoons raspberry jam, or other sweet jam\n1 tablespoon brown sugar\n1/4 cup of maple syrup\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F (175\xc2\xb0C). \n2 Slice the top off the brie: If you want, start with chilled brie and use a sharp knife to carefully cut off the thin top rind of the cheese. This may help the crust stay with the cheese when served. The rind is edible so you don't have to do this step if you don't want to.\n3 Place brie on puff pastry: On a lined baking sheet, lay out the puff pastry or the crescent rolls flat. Place the brie round or wedge on top of the puff pastry.\n4 Spread jam on top, fold dough over brie: Spread jam on brie, fold dough over top, cutting off excess dough. Drizzle maple syrup and sprinkle brown sugar on top.\n5 Bake: Bake at 350\xc2\xbaF (175\xc2\xb0C) for 30 minutes, pastry should be golden brown. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.\nServe with crackers or apple slices.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission.
