b"Print\nGrilled Garlic Shrimp Skewers Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound 16-20 count large prawns, peeled and deveined (can still have tail on for presentation)\nExtra virgin olive oil\nSalt\n3 tablespoons butter\n3 cloves garlic, minced\n1/4 teaspoon kosher salt\n1 teaspoon minced chives for garnish\nSpecial equipment:\nShort bamboo skewers, about 20, soaked for 30 minutes in water before grilling\nMETHOD\n1 Prepare grill: Prepare your grill for direct high heat, with one side of the grill as a cool side with no coals or flame.\n2 Thread shrimp on skewers: While the grill is heating, thread the pre-soaked skewers through the shrimp. Start at the tail and push the skewers through the middle and end of the shrimp. Brush shrimp with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.\n3 Melt butter with garlic: Place butter and garlic in a microwave-safe bowl and heat in microwave until the butter has melted and is hot. (If you don't have a microwave you can also just melt the butter with the garlic in a small saucepan on the stovetop.)\n4 Grill shrimp: Arrange skewers on grill so that the shrimp are over the coals or flame and the exposed bamboo skewer ends are over the cool side of the grill. Grill for about 2 minutes on each side.\n5 Serve basted with garlic butter: As soon as the shrimp are done, remove from grill and place in a serving dish. Baste generously with melted garlic butter. Sprinkle with chives to serve!\nServe immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Save It Print\nTempura Fried Calamari Recipe\nPrep time: 1 hour, 15 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4-6 as an appetizer\nThe squid rings cut from the body are easier to fry than the tentacles, which tend to clump. If you have both, fry the rings first, then the tentacles.\nDo not double the recipe. The batter needs to be kept cold and used immediately after making. So it's better to work with small batches.\nIf you want to make more, mix a second batch together after you've gone through the first batch.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound cleaned squid\n1 egg yolk\n1 cup ice cold sparkling water (the colder the better)\n1/8 teaspoon baking soda\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/4 cup cornstarch\n3/4 cup rice or regular flour plus more for sprinkling on squid\nPeanut oil or canola oil for frying\nSpecial equipment:\nA deep fryer\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Slice the squid tubes into rings: Slice the squid tubes into rings about 1/2-inch to 3/4-inch wide. Leave the tentacles whole.\n2 Heat oil in a deep fryer or large heavy pot: This recipe was designed for a deep-fryer, but you can also fill a large, heavy-bottomed pot (keep a lid nearby, for safety reasons) halfway with oil, about 3 inches deep. Heat the oil to 360-370\xc2\xb0F.\n3 Mix dry ingredients: While the oil is heating, mix all the dry ingredients together well.\n4 Mix sparkling water with egg yolk, then mix with dry ingredients: Once the oil has reached 360\xc2\xb0F, take the sparkling water out of the refrigerator and mix it with the egg yolk. Immediately mix it in with the dry ingredients.\nMix quickly. Do not worry if there are clumps or lumps. Over-mixing may cause the batter to become chewy when cooked.\n5 Sprinkle squid pieces with flour. Use a small sieve to lightly dust the squid pieces with rice flour or regular flour. This will help the batter adhere to the squid.\n6 Dip squid pieces in batter and fry in hot oil: Working in small batches at a time (about 6 pieces), dip the squid pieces in the batter. Pick them up one by one and gently put them in the hot oil. (Note if your fingers are coated with the batter, it will help protect them from splatter.)\nWhen the squid pieces are in the oil, use a chopstick or the handle of a wooden spoon to dislodge any squid pieces that may have become stuck from the bottom of the pot or fryer. Fry for 45 seconds to 1 minute, and remove to paper towels to drain.\nNote that when done, they will NOT be golden brown, but more of a pale yellow or tan.\nRepeat with the rest of the squid. Working in batches will help keep the oil temperature from falling too far while you are frying the squid.\n6 Serve immediately: Serve immediately with lime or lemon wedges, soy sauce, ponzu sauce, Tabasco or another hot sauce.\nOnce the cooking oil has completely cooled (after about 2 hours), strain it through a paper towel-lined sieve, and save it to reuse the next time you want to deep fry seafood.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nShrimp Quesadilla Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves one\nIf you are starting with frozen raw shrimp, put them in a bowl of ice water to defrost.\nIf you are starting with cooked shrimp, just toss them with some salt, pepper, chipotle chile powder and lime juice and let them sit while you heat the tortillas.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/4 pound of medium-small raw shrimp, peeled and deveined\n1/4 teaspoon chipotle powder or chili powder\nPinch of salt\nPinch of pepper\n1 Tbsp of lime or lemon juice\n2 1/2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil (divided, 2 teaspoons and 1/2 teaspoon)\n1 Tbsp chopped red onion\n1 Tbsp chopped fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish\nSalt and pepper\n2 medium-sized flour tortillas\n1/2 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese\n1/4 avocado, sliced\nDollop of sour cream or crema fresca\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Marinate the shrimp: Toss the shrimp in a small bowl with 1/4 teaspoon of chipotle powder or chile powder, a pinch of salt, pinch of pepper, and a tablespoon of lime or lemon juice. Let sit for 10 minutes. Then drain out the juice.\n2 Cook the shrimp: Heat a couple teaspoons of olive oil in a relatively stick-free skillet (a cast iron skillet works well for this) on medium high heat.\nAdd the shrimp and cook for half a minute on each side, and remove to a bowl.\nThe shrimp shouldn't be completely cooked through; they will continue to cook during the next step.\n3 Heat the tortillas: Wipe out the skillet with paper towels. Add a small amount of olive oil (about 1/2 a teaspoon, you could use butter as well) and heat the pan on medium high.\nPlace one flour tortilla on the skillet. Flip the tortilla over a few times, 10 seconds between flips. Air pockets should begin to form within the tortilla.\nRemove the tortilla and repeat with the second tortilla. Leave the second tortilla in the pan and reduce the heat to medium.\n4 Build the quesadilla: Sprinkle the tortilla with the grated cheese. Distribute the shrimp on top of the cheese. Add chopped onion and cilantro. Place the other tortilla on top.\nFlip the quesadilla over when the bottom tortilla is nicely toasted and the cheese has begun to melt. Remove the quesadilla from the pan when the now bottom tortilla has toasted sufficiently.\nYou can also use just one tortilla instead of two, and fold the tortilla over itself like an omelette.\n5 Cut the quesadilla into triangles: Cut like a pie into six pieces (a pizza wheel works well for this). Place on a serving plate. Serve with avocado slices and sour cream. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro. Squeeze a little lime juice over everything.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nArizona Cheese Crisp Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Makes one large Sonoran quesadilla\nIf you want to have green chiles on your quesadilla (they are optional), you can either roast your own (use Anaheims, Hatch, or Poblano) or use canned whole green chiles.\nTo roast your own, blacken them over a gas stove, on a grill, or under a broiler, then put the chiles in a covered bowl for a few minutes, then rub off the blackened skin.\n(See How to Roast Chiles over a Gas Flame video.) Then de-seed them and cut them into strips.\nINGREDIENTS\nOne large, burrito-size (13-inch diameter or larger) flour tortilla\n1 Tbsp butter\n1/2 cup of grated cheddar cheese\n1 or 2 roasted green chiles, peeled, seeded, cut into strips (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat your oven to 350\xc2\xb0F with a rack in the middle.\n2 Butter a flour tortilla all the way to the edges: Place the flour tortilla on a large baking sheet (a dark baking sheet or cookie sheet will work best. Spread the butter all over the top of the tortilla, all the way to the edges. The butter is important for the flavor of a cheese crisp, so don't leave it out!\n3 Bake the tortilla until lightly toasted: Bake the plain buttered tortilla for about 6 minutes or until it begins to get lightly toasted. (Check on the timing for your particular oven.)\n4 Sprinkle with cheese, add green chile strips, return to oven: Remove the tortilla from the oven and sprinkle with the cheddar cheese, leaving about 1/2-inch from the edges. Add strips of green chiles in a star pattern if you want.\nReturn the tortilla to the oven and cook for 2 more minutes, or until all of the cheese has melted. Remove from oven and eat!\nMy mother will use her oven's convection setting when she makes these cheese crisps. For convection, she'll put the buttered tortilla into a cold oven and heat on convection at 375\xc2\xb0F for 7 to 10 minutes. Then she'll sprinkle the cheese and return the quesadilla to the oven for a couple more minutes.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\n7 Layer Bean Dip Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 8\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups refried beans, from one 15-ounce can or homemade\n1 teaspoon (or more) of bacon fat (or 1 strip of bacon, cooked and minced), optional\n1 teaspoon chipotle powder, Tabasco chipotle sauce, or adobo sauce, more to taste (or plain chili powder to taste)\n1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin\nSalt\n1 cup shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese\n1/4 cup chopped green Anaheim chiles (canned) OR 1 tablespoon chopped pickled jalape\xc3\xb1os (more to taste)\n1 avocado, peeled and chopped\n1 hot house tomato, cut in half horizontally, seeds and juice gently squeezed out and discarded, chopped\n1/3 cup sour cream, or if you can get it Crema Mexicana (Mexican sour cream)\n1 cup sliced ripe black olives, from a 15-ounce can\nCorn tortilla chips, to serve\nMETHOD\n1 Prepare the refried beans: Heat the refried beans in a medium saut\xc3\xa9 pan or cast iron skillet. Stir in enough water to get a creamy, easily dip-able consistency, about 1/4 of a cup.\nThe taste of refried beans is greatly enhanced by bacon fat; we'll add a teaspoon to canned beans or a tablespoon or more to taste if we are making the beans from scratch.\nIf you don't have bacon fat, you can cook up a strip of bacon, chop it up fine and add that to the beans.\nIf you are trying to avoid pork, note that most canned refried beans are made with added lard, so check the ingredients. You can use olive oil instead, to help the consistency of the beans.\nMix in the chipotle chili powder (or Tabasco, or adobo, or regular chili powder) and cumin to taste. Note that the avocados and the sour cream will cool down the spiciness of the beans considerably, so you can afford to be a bit more spicy than you might think.\nStir in salt to taste, depending on how salted your refried beans are to begin with, and depending on how salty the tortilla chips are that you are serving with the dip.\n2 Spread on serving dish, top with cheese: Once the beans are hot and bubbly, spread them over the bottom of a warmed serving dish. Immediately add the shredded cheese so that the heat from the beans helps melt the cheese.\n(The cheese doesn't need to be completely melted, but even if it is just a little, it will help the dip stay on the chip.)\n3 Layer on toppings: Layer on the chopped green chilies, chopped avocado, chopped tomato. Spoon on the sour cream (or crema Mexicana, crema fresca, or even cream fraiche).\nTop with sliced green onions and olives.\nServe immediately with tortilla chips.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nScallion Pancakes Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 25 minutesResting time: 30 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings (4 pancakes)\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the scallion pancakes:\n2 cups all-purpose flour\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, optional\n3/4 cup hot (just boiling) water, plus a few more tablespoons, if necessary\n1/4 cup canola oil\n3 to 4 scallions, thinly sliced\nFor the dipping sauce:\n2 tablespoons soy sauce\n2 1/2 tablespoons rice vinegar\n1/2 teaspoon toasted sesame oil\nMETHOD\n1 Mix the dough: Add flour, salt and garlic granules to a medium bowl. Stir to combine. Add 3/4 cups of hot water to the flour and stir with a wooden spoon. Continue stirring until all the water has been absorbed by the flour. Don\xe2\x80\x99t worry if the dough has not formed completely yet.\n2 Knead the dough: Using your hands, knead all the bits of dough together inside the bowl. If your dough is still very dry, add a splash of hot water, about 1 to 2 tablespoons, until it comes together and all the flour is absorbed.\nContinue kneading the dough for about 2 more minutes. The dough will feel moist but it should not stick to your hands too much.\n3 Rest the dough: Shape the dough into a round ball. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let the dough rest for 30 minutes.\n4 Roll out the pancakes: Sprinkle flour on top of a work surface. Divide the dough into 4 pieces of equal size. Work with one piece at a time, leaving the remaining pieces in the bowl.\nShape piece of dough into a small ball. Use a rolling pin to roll out the dough into a thin circle, about 7 to 8 inches in diameter.\n5 Add the scallions: Brush a thin layer of canola oil on top of the dough, making sure not to miss the edges. Sprinkle sliced scallions all over the dough.\n6 Roll and flatten the pancake: Starting on one end, roll the circle of dough into a log. Take one end of the rolled up dough and curl it toward the center, like a snail's shell. Tuck the end of the dough underneath the spiral.\nUse the palm of your hand to flatten the dough into a thick circle. Roll it out again with your rolling pin. Try to roll it out as thinly as possible. A few slices of scallions may pop out during the process, and that\xe2\x80\x99s perfectly normal.\nTransfer rolled out scallion pancake to a plate. Repeat steps 4 through 6 with the remaining dough pieces.\n7 Cook the pancakes: Heat about 2 teaspoons of canola oil a small nonstick or cast iron skillet over medium heat.\nPlace one of the pancakes in the middle of the pan and pan fry each side for about 2 to 3 minutes, until they\xe2\x80\x99re golden brown. Transfer to a plate and repeat with the 3 remaining scallion pancakes, adding more oil to the pan as needed.\n8 Prepare the dipping sauce: Mix all the sauce ingredients in a small bowl. Adjust the seasonings to your liking, adding more soy sauce or vinegar, if you like. Add any leftover scallions to the dipping sauce, and add a pinch of red pepper flakes if you would like a bit of spice.\n9 Serve the hot pancakes: Cut the scallion pancakes into small wedges and serve while hot, with the dipping sauce. (The pancakes are still good when cooled, but will no longer be crispy.)\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Print\nGinger Honey Chicken Wings Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: 2 to 3 dozen wings\nReserve half of the marinade to toss with the chicken wings once they are cooked. Do not let marinade that has touched raw chicken be used with the cooked chicken for food safety reasons.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 pounds chicken wing drummettes\n1 green onion, thinly sliced on the diagonal\n2 Tbsp toasted sesame seeds\nMarinade:\n1/4 cup soy sauce (use gluten-free soy sauce if cooking gluten-free)\n3 Tbsp honey\n1-inch piece of ginger, peeled and grated\n3 cloves garlic, finely minced\n1/8 teaspoon sriracha hot sauce (or other hot sauce)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven, prepare roasting pan: Preheat the oven to 425\xc2\xb0F with a rack on the upper third of the oven. Line a roasting pan or thick baking sheet with foil. Rub some olive oil or canola oil over the foil to keep the wings from sticking.\n2 Prepare marinade sauce: Whisk together the marinade ingredients\xe2\x80\x94soy sauce, honey, grated ginger, garlic, hot sauce\xe2\x80\x94in a bowl. Set aside half of the marinade to be used as a sauce (about 1/4 cup).\n3 Toss wings with marinade, place on pan: Place the chicken wings in a bowl and toss with the remaining marinade. Arrange the wings, skin-side down, on the foil lined roasting pan, taking care not to crowd the pan.\n4 Roast in oven: Roast for 15 minutes, then remove from oven, use tongs to turn the wings over so that they are now skin-side up, and roast for another 10 minutes, until nicely browned. Check while roasting to make sure they aren't getting too dark. If so, place on a lower rack or cover with foil to finish cooking.\n5 Toss with reserved marinade sauce: Place cooked wings in a bowl and toss with the reserved marinade sauce.\n6 Garnish: Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and thinly sliced green onions to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nCranberry Apple Stuffed Pork Loin Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 6 to 8\nChilling the pork roast before cutting will make the roast easier to cut.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 boneless pork loin (about 3 to 4 pounds)\nSea salt and freshly ground pepper\n1/2 cup panko or homemade breadcrumbs\n1/2 cup chicken stock\n1 cup peeled, chopped tart green apples\n1/3 cup dried cranberries\n1/3 cup chopped walnuts, toasted\n1/4 cup minced shallots\n2 Tbsp pure maple syrup\n1 teaspoon minced rosemary\nSpecial equipment:\nKitchen string\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 450\xc2\xb0F.\n2 How to butterfly the pork loin: Place the pork loin roast fat side down on a cutting board. Note that one long side of the pork loin roast will be thicker, and one side thinner.\nUsing a sharp knife, make a long cut an inch or so from the edge from the thinner long side of the roast at about a 45\xc2\xb0 degree angle, stopping a half inch from reaching the bottom of the roast.\nThen angle the knife so that it is flat, parallel to the cutting board, and make slow, shallow cuts into the roast, along the same line.\nAs you cut, you can open up the top part of the roast like a book. Keep making slow, even cuts until you have "rolled" the roast out completely.\n3 Pound the butterflied roast to an even thickness: With the pork roast unfolded, cover with 2 layers of of plastic wrap.\nPound with a meat mallet to flatten to a somewhat even thickness. Remove plastic wrap. Sprinkle the pork with salt and pepper and set aside.\n4 Make the filling: Place the panko and stock in a small bowl and stir to combine.\nStir in the apples, walnuts, cranberries, shallots, maple syrup and rosemary.\n5 Roll up pork roast with filling: Spread the filling over surface of the pork, leaving an inch margin around all sides except for the fat layer side\xe2\x80\x94with that side leave a 2-inch margin.\nStarting with the end of the roast rectangle that does not have the fat layer on the bottom, roll up the roast.\n6 Secure with kitchen string. Tie the roast in 1 to 2 inch intervals with cotton kitchen string.\nAt this point you can wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate if you are making ahead.\n7 Bake: Coat the bottom of a roasting pan with cooking spray or a little olive oil. Place the roast in the pan and cook at 450\xc2\xb0F for 15 minutes to brown the top, then reduce the oven temperature to 325\xc2\xb0F. Cook uncovered, for about 30 to 40 minutes, or until the pork reaches an internal temperature of 140\xc2\xb0F.\n8 Rest and serve: Tent the roast with foil and let it rest for 10 minutes. Remove the kitchen string and slice into 1/2-inch thick slices to serve.\nSave the pan drippings! Serve with pan drippings or use the pan drippings to make gravy. See How to Make Gravy.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nButternut Squash Apple Cranberry Bake Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 55 minutesYield: Serves 8\nINGREDIENTS\n1 large butternut squash, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes\n2 large tart cooking apples (like Granny Smith), peeled and cut into 1/2-inch thick slices\n1/2 cup fresh or frozen cranberries\n1/2 cup brown sugar\n1/4 cup (half a stick) butter\n1 Tbsp flour\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg or mace\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven and prepare baking dish: Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Lightly butter the sides and bottom of a 7x11-inch baking dish.\n2 Mix together the flour, brown sugar, salt, and nutmeg in a small bowl.\n3 Layer squash, apples, cranberries, and topping in baking dish: Put a layer of cut butternut squash on the bottom of the baking dish. Place apples on top and then sprinkle with cranberries. Sprinkle everything with the flour brown sugar mixture. Dot with butter.\n4 Bake: Bake 50-60 minutes at 350\xc2\xb0F until cooked through and lightly browned.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nHomemade Apple Pie Recipe\nPrep time: 1 hour, 15 minutesCook time: 55 minutesYield: Serves 8\nIf the crust looks like it's getting too browned, take a large piece of aluminum foil and place on top of the pie in the oven. No need to wrap it around the pie, just place it on top. That will keep the top from browning further.\nPies always seem to take longer to cook than one expects. (Perhaps it's because we're always opening the oven to check on how the pie is doing?) The filling should be visibly bubbling, which you should be able to see through the steam vents.\nI recommend putting a rimmed baking sheet on a rack beneath the rack of the pie to catch the filling as some of it invariably bubbles up and out over the pie. Makes oven clean-up a lot easier.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 pounds good cooking apples such as Granny Smith, Jonagold, Golden Delicious, Fuji, or Braeburn (about 6 to 8 apples, depending on the size of your apples and the size of your pie dish)\n1 tablespoon lemon juice or apple cider vinegar (to toss with the sliced apples so they don't brown as you slice them)\n1/2 cup to 2/3 cup sugar, depending on how sweet you like your pie\n3 tablespoons all-purpose flour for thickening\n1/2 teaspoon cinnamon\n1/4 teaspoon ground allspice\n1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg\n1 tablespoon brandy (Optional. By the way, if you have Calvados apple brandy, use it!)\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n1 recipe double crust sour cream pie dough, OR all-butter crust, OR your favorite pie crust recipe\nFor the egg wash:\n1 large egg yolk\n1 tablespoon cream\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Peel, core, and slice the apples: Peel, core and slice or roughly chop the apples into 1/4-inch to 1/2-inch slices or chunks.\nAs you cut your apple slices, add them to a large bowl and sprinkle them with a little lemon juice or apple cider vinegar to help keep them from turning brown.\n2 Make the apple pie filling: Combine sugar, flour and spices (allspice, nutmeg, cinnamon) in a bowl. Add the flour mixture to the apple slices and use your hands to distribute the flour through the apples so they are well coated.\nThen sprinkle with brandy and vanilla extract and stir to coat all the apples.\n3 Prepare oven: Place one oven rack in the lowest position and put a large rimmed baking sheet on it (to catch any drippings from the pie.) Position a second rack the next rung up (still in the lower third of the oven) and preheat to 375\xc2\xb0F.\n4 Roll out the dough and line bottom pie plate: Remove one disk of pie dough from the refrigerator. Let sit at room temperature for 5-10 minutes. Place disk on a lightly floured, clean, flat surface. Using a rolling pin, roll out the pie dough to a 12-inch circle, about 1/8 of an inch thick.\nAs you roll out the dough, check to make sure it isn't sticking. If and when it starts to stick, gently lift it up and sprinkle a little more flour on the table surface or on the pie dough to keep the dough from sticking.\nGently place the rolled out dough onto a 9-inch pie plate. Press down to line the pie dish with the dough.\n5 Place apple slices on top of the bottom crust: Arrange the apple slices in the dough-lined pie plate. Mound the apples in the center.\n6 Roll out top crust, place over apples, trim and crimp edges: Roll out the second disk of dough, again to 12-inches. Gently place the second round of pie dough over the apples. Trim excess dough with kitchen shears, leaving a 3/4 inch overhang from the edges of the pie pan.\nFold the dough under itself so that the edge of the fold comes right to the edge of the pan. Press the top and bottom dough rounds together as you flute edges using thumb and forefinger or press with a fork.\n7 Brush with egg wash, cut vents: Place egg yolk and cream in a small bowl and use a fork to stir until well combined. Use a pastry brush to brush the egg wash over the top and fluted edges of the pie. Use a sharp knife to cut slits in the top of the pie crust for steam vents.\n8 Bake: Place pie on oven rack centered over the baking sheet on the rack below it to catch any drippings. Bake the pie at 375\xc2\xb0F until crust begins to lightly brown, about 20 minutes, then reduce heat to 350\xc2\xb0F.\nBake until crust is golden and juices are bubbling, anywhere from an additional 45 minutes to an hour, depending on the type of apples you are using. (About halfway through baking check to make sure the pie isn't browning too much. When it's nicely browned, tent the pie with a large piece of aluminum foil to keep the pie from browning further.)\n9 Let cool: Transfer the apple pie to a rack to cool for at least 1 hour. Serve slightly warm or at room temperature. Great with a side of vanilla ice cream.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nMile High Deep Dish Apple Pie Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 30 minutesMaking homemade crust time: 2 hoursYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\nCrust\n2 cups all-purpose flour, plus extra for rolling\n1/2 cup almond flour or finely ground blanched almonds\n16 tablespoons (2 sticks) unsalted butter, very-cold, cut into 1/2 inch cubes\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 heaping teaspoon brown sugar\n3 to 6 tablespoons nonfat milk, very cold\n1 tablespoon heavy cream\n1 large egg yolk\nFilling\n1/2 cup sugar (white granulated)\n1/4 cup packed light brown sugar\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n1/4 teaspoon ground ginger\n5 pounds of mixed apples (Granny Smith, Golden Delicious, Fuji, Jonagold, Pippin, Braeburn, Cortland, McIntosh), peeled and cut into 1/4 inch slices\n1 tablespoon of lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon of grated lemon zest\n2 tablespoons unsalted butter\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the pie dough for the crust: In a food processor, combine flour, almonds, salt and brown sugar, pulse to mix.\nAdd butter and pulse 6 to 8 times, until mixture resembles coarse meal.\nAdd milk 1 Tablespoon at a time, pulsing until mixture begins to clump together. Remove dough from machine and shape into 2 discs. Wrap each in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour.\n2 Cook the apples: While the pie dough is chilling, start cooking the apples. Mix 1/2 cup white sugar and 1/4 cup brown sugar, salt, ground ginger, and cinnamon into a large mixing bowl. Add the apples and lemon zest and toss to combine.\nTransfer apples to a large, thick-bottomed covered pan or Dutch oven and cook, covered, over medium heat, stirring frequently, until apples are just tender when poked with a fork, but still hold their shape - about 15 to 20 minutes (but not so long for the apples to turn into applesauce.\nPut apples in a colander over a bowl to drain excess liquid. Drain off as much juice as possible.\nSpread out on a sheet pan to cool for 5 to 10 minutes.\n3 Preheat oven to 425\xc2\xb0F with a baking sheet on a rack on the lowest rung of the oven.\n4 Roll out the bottom crust: While the apples are cooling and draining, remove one crust disk from the refrigerator. Let sit at room temperature for 5-10 minutes. Sprinkle some flour on top of the disk.\nRoll out with a rolling pin on a lightly floured surface to a 12 inch circle; about 1/8 of an inch thick. As you roll out the dough, use a metal spatula to check if the dough is sticking to the surface below. Add a few sprinkles of flour if necessary to keep the dough from sticking. Gently fold in half.\nPlace on to a 9-inch pie plate, lining up the fold with the center of the pan. Gently unfold and press down to line the pie dish with the dough.\n5 Add the filling: Add the apple filling to the dough-lined pie pan. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of lemon juice. Dot with butter.\n6 Roll out top crust, place over apples, trim and crimp edges: Roll out second disk of dough, as before. Gently turn over onto the top of the apples in the pie. Pinch top and bottom of dough rounds firmly together. Trim excess dough with kitchen shears, leaving a 3/4 inch overhang.\nFold the dough under itself so that the edge of the fold is flush with the edge of the pan. Flute edges using thumb and forefinger or press with a fork.\n7 Score the top, brush with egg wash: Score the top of the pie with four 2-inch long cuts, so that steam from the cooking pie can escape. Beat egg yolk with cream and brush on the surface of the pie with a pastry brush.\n7 Bake: Set pie on preheated baking sheet (to catch any juices that may escape from the pie while cooking). Bake at 425\xc2\xb0F for 15 minutes. Lower the heat to 375\xc2\xb0F and cook for an additional 50 to 60 minutes or more, until filling bubbles in the center and crust turns golden brown.\n8 Cool: Cool on a wire rack for 1 1/2 hours. Cut into wedges and serve with vanilla ice cream.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nApple Cranberry Pie Recipe\nPrep time: 1 hour, 30 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 30 minutesYield: Serves 8\nAs you peel, core, and slice the apples, put the apple slices in a bowl and sprinkle with a little lemon juice or apple cider vinegar to prevent them from discoloring.\nThe crust recipe given includes ground almonds which give the crust a lovely flavor that works well with the apples and cranberries. You can also use our favorite sour cream pie crust that is easy to put together and makes an especially flaky crust.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the crust:\n2 cups all-purpose flour, plus extra for rolling\n1/3 cup finely ground blanched almonds or almond flour\n16 tablespoons (2 sticks) unsalted butter, very-cold, cut into 1/2 inch cubes\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 heaping teaspoon brown sugar\n3 to 6 tablespoons ice water\nFor the filling:\n1 cup dried sweetened cranberries\n1/2 to 2/3 cup sugar (depending on how sweet you want the filling to be)\n2 tablespoons all purpose flour\n1/4 teaspoon ground allspice or cinnamon\n2 1/4 pounds of an assortment of good cooking apples such as Granny Smith, Pippin, Golden Delicious, peeled, cored, and sliced into 1/4-inch thick slices (about 7 cups of apple slices)\n1 tablespoon brandy\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\nFor the egg wash:\n1 large egg yolk\n1 tablespoon whipping cream\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the pie dough: In a food processor, combine flour, almond flour, salt and brown sugar, pulse to mix. Add butter and pulse 6 to 8 times, until mixture resembles coarse meal, with pea size pieces of butter. Add water 1 Tablespoon at a time, pulsing until mixture just begins to clump together. If you pinch some of the crumbly dough and it holds together, it's ready, if not, add a little more ice water and pulse again.\nRemove dough from machine and place on a clean surface. Carefully shape into 2 discs. Do not over-knead the dough! You should still be able to see little bits of butter in the dough. These bits of butter are what will allow the result crust to be flaky. Wrap each disc in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour.\n2 Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F with a rack in the bottom third of the oven.\n3 Make the apple filling: Whisk together the sugar, flour, and allspice or cinnamon in a large bowl. Add the dried sweetened cranberries and toss to coat with the sugar flour mixture. Add the apples and toss to coat and make sure that the cranberries are well distributed throughout the apples. Sprinkle with the brandy and vanilla extract.\n4 Roll out the bottom crust: Remove one crust disk from the refrigerator. Let sit at room temperature for 5-10 minutes. Sprinkle some flour on top of the disk. Roll out with a rolling pin on a lightly floured surface to a 12 inch circle; about 1/8 of an inch thick.\nAs you roll out the dough, use a metal spatula to check if the dough is sticking to the surface below. Add a few sprinkles of flour if necessary to keep the dough from sticking. Place on a 9-inch pyrex pie dish. Press down to line the pie dish with the dough.\n5 Place the apple cranberry filling in the pie dish.\n6 Roll out top crust, top the pie, crimp edges: Roll out second disk of dough, as before. Gently place on top of the apples in the pie. Pinch top and bottom of dough rounds firmly together. Trim excess dough with kitchen shears, leaving a 3/4 inch overhang.\nFold dough under itself so that the edge of the fold is flush with the edge of the pan. Flute edges using thumb and forefinger or press with a fork.\n7 Brush pie with egg wash: In a small bowl whisk together the egg yolk and cream until well blended. Use a pastry brush to brush over the top of the pie. Use a sharp knife to cut slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape as the pie bakes.\n8 Bake: Bake the pie at 375\xc2\xb0F for 30 minutes. Then place a sheet of aluminum foil over the pie and lower the oven temp to 350\xc2\xb0F. Bake for another 45 to 55 minutes or longer, depending on the type of apples you are using.\nWhen done the crust should be golden brown and the apples soft and cooked through. Remove the pie and let cool on a rack for at least one hour. Serve pie warm or at room temperature.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nSour Cream Apple Pie Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 50 minutesYield: Serves 8\nAs you slice the apples, put them in a bowl and toss them with a little lemon juice or apple cider vinegar. The acidity of the lemon juice or vinegar will help keep the apples from discoloring while you work and will intensify the apple flavor in the pie.\nINGREDIENTS\nFilling:\n1 cup sour cream\n2/3 cup sugar (can easily reduce to 1/2 cup if you like your apple pies a little less sweet)\n2 Tablespoons flour\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon vanilla\n1 egg\n3 cups peeled, sliced tart apples (about 1 1/4 pounds of slices, cut 1/4-inch to a 1/2-inch thick)\n1 Tablespoon lemon juice or apple cider vinegar\nOne 9" unbaked pie shell, frozen or chilled in the freezer for at least 30 minutes (see sour cream pie crust recipe, use a single crust recipe)\nTopping:\n1/2 cup brown sugar, packed\n1/2 cup flour\n1/4 cup butter (1/2 a stick), chilled, cut into cubes\n1/2 teaspoon cinnamon\nMix together all ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Chill until needed in the recipe.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the streusel topping: Place the streusel topping ingredients in a medium bowl and mix with a fork or your hands until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.\nChill in the refrigerator until the topping is needed half-way through the baking.\n2 Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F with a rack in the middle and another rack below it. Place a large rimmed baking sheet on the lower rack to catch any of the drippings from the pie.\n3 Mix sour cream with sugar, flour, salt, vanilla, egg, and coat apple slices with it: In a large bowl put the sour cream, sugar, flour, salt, vanilla, and egg. Use a wooden spoon and beat by hand until smooth. Fold in the apples and stir until all of the apples are coated with the sour cream filling mixture.\n4 Put the filling into a frozen pie shell. For the first stage of baking, bake the pie for 25 minutes at 400\xc2\xb0F.\n5 After the first 25 minutes, remove the pie from the oven and sprinkle the top with the brown sugar butter flour topping mixture. You may also want to put a pie protector or foil around the outer crust edges to keep them from getting too browned. Bake for another 20 minutes at 400\xc2\xb0F.\n6 Cool: Let the pie cool on a rack for one hour before cutting and serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nBisquick Apple Coffee Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\nCake:\n2 cups Bisquick mix\n2/3 cup of milk or water\n2 Tbsp sugar\n1 egg\n1 tart green apple, cored, peeled, sliced\nTopping:\n1/3 cup Bisquick mix\n1/3 cup packed brown sugar\n1/2 tsp ground cinnamon\n4 Tbsp butter\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Grease 8" square pan or 9" round pan. Mix cake ingredients. Spread cake batter in pan. Insert apple slices into the batter evenly throughout the cake.\n3 Mix the topping ingredients of Bisquick, brown sugar and cinnamon. Spread topping mix over top of batter in pan. Add slices of butter all over the top.\n4 Bake 20 minutes or until golden brown, testing with a toothpick.\nHello! b'Save It Print\nApple Coffee Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 6\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups (280 g) all purpose flour\n2 teaspoons baking powder\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/4 cup (50 g) of white granulated sugar plus 2 Tbsp sugar\n1 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n10 Tbsp unsalted butter (140 g), room temperature\n2 eggs, beaten\n1 cup (235 ml) whole milk\n1 medium tart green apple, cored, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch thick slices\nStreusel topping:\n4 Tbsp brown sugar\n4 Tbsp flour\n1/4 teaspoon cinnamon\n1 Tbsp butter, cut into small cubes\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven, prepare pie dish: Preheat the oven to 375\xc2\xb0F (190\xc2\xb0C). Grease a 9-inch pie pan (can use a springform pan or square baking pan)\n2 Whisk flour, baking powder, salt: In a medium bowl, whisk vigorously together the flour, baking powder, and salt.\n3 Make cinnamon sugar: In a separate small bowl, mix 2 Tbsp of the sugar with the cinnamon, set aside.\n4 Beat butter and sugar, add eggs, add flour mixture and milk: Using an electric mixer, beat the butter with the remaining 1/4 cup sugar. Beat in the eggs until blended. Add the flour mixture in three additions, alternating with the milk, beating after each addition until just combined.\n5 Pour batter into baking dish, top with apple slices, cinnamon sugar: Pour half of the batter in the bottom of the baking dish. Lay the apple slices on the batter so they just cover the batter (you may have to overlap some slices). Sprinkle the apples with the cinnamon-sugar mixture. Spread the rest of the batter over the apples.\n6 Top with streusel topping: In a small bowl mix together the brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon for the streusel topping. Sprinkle over the cake and dot with butter.\n7 Bake: Bake the cake at 375\xc2\xb0F (190\xc2\xb0C) for 30-35 minutes or until it is golden brown and a tester inserted into the center comes out clean.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nBest Fresh Apple Bundt Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Serves 12\nYou can also make muffins with this recipe. Standard muffin tins, 24 muffins, 25 minutes bake time.\nINGREDIENTS\nCake:\n1 1/2 cups vegetable oil\n2 cups of sugar\n3 eggs, slightly beaten\n3 cups of white flour\n1 1/2 teaspoon baking soda\n1 teaspoon vanilla\n1 teaspoon salt\n1 teaspoon cinnamon\n3 cups chopped, peeled apples (varieties that are good for baking - i.e. Granny Smith, Gravenstein, Fuji)\n1 cup of sweetened shredded coconut\n1 cup of chopped nuts - walnuts or pecans\nGlaze:\n1/2 stick sweet butter\n1 cup brown sugar\n3 tablespoons milk\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0 F.\n2 Make the cake batter: Beat together the sugar and oil. Add the eggs. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.\nAdd dry ingredients to oil sugar eggs mixture in thirds, beating to incorporate after each addition.\nMix in the vanilla, apples, coconut, and chopped nuts.\n3 Bake: Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F in a greased and floured bundt cake pan about 1 hour.\nTest around the centers with a long thin bamboo skewer or toothpick to make sure the cake is done.\n4 Cool and remove from pan: When cool enough to handle, gently remove from pan. Let sit on a rack to cool completely. If the dough has raised substantially around the middle areas of the bundt ring, you may need to use a bread knife to gently level off the cake so that it sits even.\n5 Glaze the cake: Blend glaze ingredients and cook until melted. Place the cake on its serving dish.\nPrick all around the top of the cake with a fork so that when the glaze is applied it easily seeps into the cake.\nUse a pastry brush to apply the glaze liberally around the surface areas of the cake, or use a spoon to dribble the glaze on the cake.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nGrain-Free Apple Honey Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 30 minutesCooling time: 45 minutesYield: 8 to 10 servings\nThis cake can be made up to a day ahead. Or, if you\xe2\x80\x99re in a big hurry to serve it, you can serve the cake warm, too.\nFor a more rustic cake, use almond meal instead of almond flour, and leave the apple unpeeled.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the cake:\n1 1/2 cups (6 ounces) almond flour\n1 teaspoon ground cinnamon\n1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg\n3/4 teaspoon salt\n3 large eggs\n1/4 cup honey\n2 tablespoons neutral-tasting oil (I use avocado oil)\n1 medium (7-ounce) Granny Smith apple, peeled and cut into thin matchsticks, or grated coarsely\nFor the glaze and topping:\n1/2 cup powdered sugar\n2 tablespoons honey\n1 tablespoon almond milk or water\n1/4 cup sliced almonds\nSpecial equipment:\n8-inch cake pan\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven and prepare a cake pan: Preheat the oven to 325\xc2\xbaF. Grease an 8-inch cake pan and place a round of parchment in the bottom of the pan.\n2 Make the cake batter: In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the almond flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt. Make a well in the center of the flour, then add in the eggs, honey, and oil. Whisk wet ingredients together in the middle, then gradually whisk in the flour from the sides of the bowl. Continue whisking until the batter is smooth. Stir in the julienned or grated apple.\n3 Pour the batter into the pan and bake the cake: Pour the batter into the cake pan, taking care not to move the parchment around. Spread out the batter in an even layer using an offset spatula or butter knife, then tap the cake pan against the countertop to remove any air bubbles.\n4 Bake the cake: Bake the cake for 30 minutes, until it is browned around the edges and a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. You may also use a probe thermometer to test for doneness\xe2\x80\x94the center of the cake should be 210\xc2\xbaF.\n5 While the cake is baking, make the glaze and toast the almonds: In a small bowl, stir together the sugar, honey, and almond milk. Cover the bowl and set it aside until needed.\nToast the sliced almonds in a skillet over medium heat until they are lightly browned, about five minutes. Shake the pan often so that the almonds are browned evenly. When they are done, immediately transfer to bowl to cool.\n6 Transfer the cake to a cooling rack: Allow the finished cake rest for 5 minutes, then run a knife around the edge of the pan to and invert the cake to a cooling rack. Peel the parchment off the bottom of the cake and flip it right side up.\n7 While the cake is still warm, pour the glaze over the top. Spread the glaze so that it drips over the edges of the cake. While the glaze is still wet, sprinkle the almonds on top.\n8 Let the cake cool to room temperature and serve. The cake can also be made and glazed up to a day ahead.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nApple Carrot Cupcakes Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Makes about 2 dozen cupcakes\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the cupcakes:\n2 cups (260 g) all-purpose flour\n1 1/4 (250 g) cups sugar\n2 teaspoons baking soda\n1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder\n1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon\n1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg\n1/8 teaspoon ground cloves\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n1 cup (236 ml) vegetable oil (light olive oil or canola oil)\n4 large eggs, lightly beaten\n1 1/2 cups packed coarsely grated carrots (about 3 medium)\n1 1/2 cups packed coarsely grated tart apples, such as Granny Smith (about 2 medium)\n1 cup (125 g) coarsely chopped pecans (or walnuts)\n1/4 cup (15 g) sweetened shredded coconut\nFor the frosting:\n8 ounces (225 g) cream cheese, at room temperature\n4 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n2 cups (260 g) powdered sugar, sifted\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the oven: Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F and place the rack in the center of the oven.\n2 Make the batter: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, granulated sugar, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt.\nStir in oil and eggs. Stir in carrots, apples, pecans, and coconut.\n3 Bake the cupcakes: Place paper liners in muffin tins. Spoon the batter into the paper cups, three quarters of the way to the top. Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F for 20 to 25 minutes (testing after 20 min), or until a tester inserted in the middle comes out clean. Let cool completely before frosting.\n4 Make the frosting: Beat the cream cheese, butter, and vanilla until smooth and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Gradually add powdered sugar and mix until combined.\nOnce the cupcakes are cool, apply frosting.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nApple Upside Down Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 30 minutesYield: Makes 6 to 8 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n8 Tbsp (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened\n1 1/4 cups white, granulate sugar divided (1/2 cup and 3/4 cup)\n1 1/2 pounds Braeburn, Jonagold, or Golden Delicious apples (about 4 medium), peeled, quartered, cored, each quarter cut into 2 wedges\n3/4 cup flour\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n2 teaspoons baking powder\n1/3 cup cornmeal\n1/2 cup boiling water\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n2 large eggs\n1/3 cup whole milk\nSpecial equipment needed:\n1-9-inch cake pan with 1 1/2-inch high sides\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat the oven and prep the cake pan: Preheat your oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Butter the sides of the cake pan. Line the pan with a 10-inch round of parchment paper. The paper will come up 1/2-inch up the sides of the pan. Butter the parchment paper.\n2 Make the caramel sauce base: Melt 2 Tbsp butter in a non-stick skillet on medium heat. Add 1/2 cup sugar and cook until sugar dissolves and mixture turns golden brown, stirring occasionally (use a wooden spoon), about 6 minutes.\n3 Add the apple wedges and cook in the caramel sauce: Add apple wedges to the pan and gently stir to distribute the caramel evenly across the apples. Cover the pan and cook until apples release their juices, about 5 minutes. Uncover and cook until apples are tender and caramel thickens and coats the apples, stirring occasionally, about 13 minutes more.\n4 Remove apples and caramel sauce and spread evenly in the prepared cake pan.\n5 Make the batter: Whisk together the flour, salt, and baking powder in a small bowl and set aside. Place cornmeal in a large mixing bowl. Pour 1/2 cup boiling water over the cornmeal and stir to blend.\nAdd 3/4 cup sugar and 6 Tbsps (3/4 stick) butter to the cornmeal mixture. Beat until well blended. Beat in vanilla and eggs.\nBeat in the flour, salt, baking powder mixture alternating with the milk. Pour the batter over the apples in the cake pan.\n6 Bake: Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F until top is golden and a tester inserted into the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes.\nCool cake in the pan for 5 minutes. Then run a knife around the edges of the cake to loosen it from the sides of the pan. Carefully invert the cake onto a serving plate or dish, and remove the parchment paper. Cool for 15 minutes.\nServe with vanilla ice cream.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nButtery Apple Torte Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Makes 8 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup (8 Tbsp, 1 stick, 4 oz or 125 g) plus 1 Tbsp of unsalted butter\n3 Fuji, Jonagold, or Golden Delicious apples, peeled, cored, and cut into slices 1/4 inch (6 mm) thick\n2/3 cup (3 1/2 oz or 105 g) all-purpose flour\n1/2 teaspoon baking powder (See How to Tell if Your Baking Powder is Still Good)\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n2 large eggs, plus 1 egg yolk\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n3/4 cup (6 oz or 185 g) granulated sugar\n1/2 teaspoon grated lemon zest\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven and prep cake pan: Preheat an oven to 375\xc2\xb0F (190\xc2\xb0C). Generously butter an 8 or 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan with 2 inch (5 cm) sides. Line the bottom of the pan with parchment paper and butter the top of it as well.\n2 Cook the apple slices: Melt the butter in the microwave or on the stovetop. Pour 6 Tbsp (3 fl oz or 90 ml) of it into a small bowl or cup and set aside.\nAdd the apple slices and the remaining butter to a large frying pan and cook on medium low heat, stirring occasionally, until the apples are tender, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat.\n3 Make the batter: In a small bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder, and salt. In a large bowl, beat the whole eggs and egg yolk until blended.\nAdd the 6 Tbsp of melted butter, the vanilla, the granulated sugar, and the lemon zest.\nStir in the flour mixture and the apples.\n4 Spoon batter into the prepared pan, smoothing the top.\n5 Bake: Bake at 375\xc2\xb0F 30-35 minutes. The cake is done when it is browned, and when you press into the top, it bounces back. After about 20 minutes of baking or so, if the top is getting well browned, tent the cake with aluminum foil.\nTransfer to a wire rack and let cool in the pan for 5 minutes.\nInvert the cake onto a plate and lift off the pan, then invert the cake again onto the rack and let cool completely.\nHello!
