Steam for 20 minutes (less or more, depending on the size of the artichokes), until you can easily pull off the outer leaves, and you can pierce the heart easily with a knife.\nThe artichokes can be just a tiny bit less cooked than would be typically perfect for steamed artichokes, as you will be cooking them further on the grill.\n4 Grill the artichokes: Prepare your grill for direct, high heat. Use a pastry brush to brush the artichoke all over with the herb infused oil. Sprinkle all over with salt.\nPlace the artichoke halves cut-side-down on the grill grates. Cover, and grill for 5 to 10 minutes, until you have nice grill mark on the cut sides of the artichokes.\nTo serve, sprinkle the cut sides with more lemon juice. Serve alone or with mayonnaise, remoulade, or aioli.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nSpinach and Artichoke Quiche Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 40 minutesMaking Homemade Crust time: 2 hoursYield: Serves 6 to 8\nWe give instructions for making your own crust from scratch. You can also easily use a frozen pie shell, just keep it frozen, do not defrost.\nWe use goat cheese in this recipe. You could easily sub with grated Gruyere or Monterey jack.\nINGREDIENTS\nCrust:\n1 cup all purpose flour\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 cup (1 stick, 4 ounces, 8 Tbsp) butter\n2 to 2 1/2 Tbsp of water\nOne 9-inch pie dish\nQuiche: \n1/2 cup, packed, finely chopped artichoke hearts (cooked fresh or canned artichoke hearts packed in water)\n6 ounces cooked spinach (if using frozen, thaw first), squeezed to remove excess water (wrap in clean tea towel or several layers of paper towels and squeeze), finely chopped\n1 Tbsp butter\n1/2 cup minced shallots\n2 teaspoons grated lemon zest\n4 eggs (large)\n1 cup milk\n1/2 cup heavy whipping cream\n4 ounces goat cheese\n1 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon black pepper\n2 Tbsp minced chives or green onion greens\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1a Make the dough for the quiche crust: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour and salt.\nCut the butter into cubes and use your (clean) hands to work the butter into the flour until you have a mixture that looks like a coarse meal with pieces of butter no bigger than a pea.\nSprinkle water onto the flour mixture a little at a time, and work the dough with your hands until the dough can be formed into a ball.\nFlatten the ball into a disk and wrap with plastic wrap. Chill for at least 1 hour.\n1b Roll out the dough: When you are ready to roll out the dough, remove the disk from the refrigerator and let come to room temp for 10 minutes.\nRoll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to a diameter 2 inches wider than your pie or tart pan. Drape the rolled out dough over the pie or tart pan and press the dough into the sides of the pan. Trim and crimp the edges.\nPlace in freezer for 30 minutes to an hour.\n2 (Optional) Pre-bake the crust: At this point, if you want, you can "blind bake" or pre-bake the crust. Pre-baking the crust will ensure that the bottom crust is browned and won\'t get soggy. I often skip this step and find that although the bottom crust might not get browned, it\'s usually perfectly palatable.\nTo pre-bake a store-bought crust, just follow the directions on the crust package.\nTo pre-bake the homemade crust in this recipe, line the inside with aluminum foil and fill it with pie weights such as beans. The foil and the pie weights will help keep the sides of the crust from sliding down as it bakes.\nBake for 15 minutes at 375\xc2\xb0F, then remove the foil and weights, prick the bottom of the crust with the tines of a fork , and bake for another 10 minutes. Let cool down a bit before filling with the quiche custard filling.\n3 Cook the shallots: Melt butter in a small saucepan on medium heat. Add the minced shallots and cook 3 to 4 minutes until translucent. Remove from heat.\n4 Prepare the filling: Preheat oven to 375\xc2\xb0F. Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Add the goat cheese and whisk until smooth. Whisk in the milk, cream, salt, pepper, chopped spinach, chopped artichokes, the cooked shallots, lemon zest, and the chives.\n5 Bake the quiche: Pour filling into the frozen pie crust. (If you are using a tart pan with a removable bottom, you may want to put the pan on a foil lined or rimmed sheet pan.)\nPlace in oven. Bake at 375\xc2\xb0F for 10 minutes, then reduce the heat to 350\xc2\xb0F and cook for 30 minutes, or until the center of the quiche has set.\n6 Let cool before serving: Remove from oven and let sit and cool to room temperature before slicing and serving.\n  Hello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nSpinach Artichoke Dip with Bacon Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: 3 cups\nMy Italian cheese blend used mozzarella, Parmesan, Asiago, Provolone, and Romano cheeses, but any blend of Italian cheeses is fine.\nINGREDIENTS\n6 slices bacon (about 1/3 pound), chopped\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n1 14-ounce can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped\n1 10-ounce package frozen spinach, thawed, drained, and chopped, or 1 12-ounce bunch fresh spinach, finely chopped\n1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes\n1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (or slightly less table salt)\n1 8-ounce package cream cheese, at room temperature\n8 ounces shredded Italian cheese blend\n1/2 cup sour cream\nPita chips, tortilla chips, crackers, or celery sticks, for serving\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 400\xcb\x9aF.\n2 Cook the bacon: Place the chopped bacon in a skillet and cook over medium heat until crispy, 7 to 10 minutes. Transfer the bacon to a plate lined with paper towels to drain, leaving the rendered bacon fat in the skillet. Set some of the bacon aside for sprinkling over top the dip.\n3 Cook the vegetables: Add the garlic to the pan and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the artichoke hearts, spinach, red pepper flakes, and salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until artichokes are warmed through and the spinach has wilted, about 5 minutes.\n4 Combine with the cheeses: In a medium bowl, mix the cream cheese, shredded Italian cheese blend, sour cream, reserved bacon, and spinach-artichoke mixture until thoroughly combined.\n5 Bake and serve: Transfer the mixture to a 1- to 2-quart baking dish and bake until bubbling around the edges, about 20 minutes. Let cool slightly, then sprinkle with reserved bacon and serve with pita chips.\nThis dip is best eaten right away while hot. If it cools a bit and starts to firm up, microwave it for a minute or two to melt the cheese again.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nArtichoke Leek Frittata Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n2 Tbsp butter\n2 cups sliced, cleaned leeks, white and light green parts only  (sliced in half lengthwise, then sliced crosswise, about 1/4-inch thick slices) (see How to Clean Leeks)\n4 ounces frozen artichoke hearts, thawed, sliced into 1/2-inch slices\n1/2 teaspoon dried tarragon (can sub 2 teaspoons of chopped fresh tarragon, or dried herbes de Provence or dried thyme)\n1/4 teaspoon Kosher salt\n5 eggs\n8 ounces (1 cup) small curd cottage cheese (can use ricotta if you prefer)\n2 Tbsp all purpose flour (omit for gluten-free version)\n1/2 teaspoon baking powder\n1 cup grated Parmesan cheese\nFresh chopped chives or parsley for garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the leeks in butter: In an 8 to 9-inch oven-proof stick-free pan (like hard anodized aluminum with stainless handle) or well seasoned cast-iron pan, melt butter on medium heat. Add the sliced leeks and gently cook until softened, about 10 minutes.\n2 Add artichoke hearts, tarragon, salt: Once the leeks are cooked through and softened, add the artichoke hearts, tarragon, and salt. Cook until the artichoke hearts are warmed through, then remove from pan to a bowl and set aside.\n3 Make the egg batter: In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs and the cottage cheese.\nIn a small bowl, whisk together the flour, Parmesan, and baking powder.\nAdd the flour mixture to the egg mixture and whisk.\nStir the artichokes and leeks into the egg  mixture. Note that the color of the mixture may change, don't worry if this happens, it will go back to normal when cooked.\n4 Pour egg mixture into pan and gently cook: Wipe out the pan with a paper towel. Then melt another tablespoon of butter into the pan on medium heat, and swirl along the bottom and sides to coat well. Pour the egg mixture into the pan, swirling to make sure the artichokes and leeks are evenly distributed.\nLower the heat. Cover the pan, slowly cook on the stove top for 12 to 15 minutes, until all but the center has set. You'll need to check every few minutes.\nThe heat should be high enough to set the mixture, but low enough so that the edges don't brown. This frittata benefits from slow, gentle cooking.\n5 Finish in the broiler: Place rack in upper third of oven. Preheat the broiler. When the frittata is mostly set, except for the center which is still wiggly, place the pan in the oven. Broil for 3 to 4 minutes until the top is lightly browned and the center has set.\n6 Serve: Remove pan from oven. (Be careful about the hot handle! Use a pot holder. I like to run an ice cube over the handle to to be extra safe.) Use a blunt knife or a metal spatula to loosen the edges of the frittata from the pan. Gently insert the spatula under the frittata to loosen it from the bottom of the pan. Then gently slide the frittata onto a serving plate.\nGarnish with chives or parsley to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nSauteed Baby Artichokes Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n2 pounds baby artichokes\n4 cups of water, divided 3 cups and 1 cup\n4 Tbsp lemon juice (from 1 to 2 lemons) divided\n1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil\n1 medium yellow onion, chopped\n2 green onions (scallions), thinly sliced, including the green ends\n3 cloves garlic, finely chopped\n1 pinch of Herbes de Provence\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1 pinch black pepper\n1/4 to 1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan, or to taste\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley (for garnish)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the artichokes: Rinse the baby artichokes. Fill a bowl with 3 cups of water and add 3 tablespoons of the lemon juice to it.\nCut off the stem of each artichoke to 1/4-inch from the base. Peel back and remove the petals until only the top third of the cone tip is pale green. Cut off the pale green tips.\nTrim off any remaining green from base of artichoke. Halve or quarter the artichokes, depending on their size and drop them into the bowl of acidified water (to prevent discoloration).\n2 Steam the artichokes: Drain artichokes in a colander. In a large skillet, bring one cup of the water to a boil. Add the artichokes, cover and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes, depending on the size of the artichokes. Drain well.\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 the artichokes: Wipe out the skillet to remove excess water. Heat to medium high and add the olive oil. Add the artichokes, onions, garlic, and herbes de Provence. Cook, stirring occasionally, for five minutes.\nStir in the remaining 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, the salt and pepper.\n4 Serve: Transfer to a serving bowl and sprinkle with freshly grated Parmesan and parsley on top.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nAsparagus Artichoke Breakfast Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\n6 cups of 1 to 1 1/2-inch cubed rustic bread (about half a loaf), or 6 slices of bread\n2 ounces bacon (2 to 3 thick-cut slices), roughly chopped\n1 medium onion, chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)\n1 pound of asparagus, trimmed of tough bottoms, spears sliced on the diagonal, in 1-inch long pieces\n1 15-ounce can of artichoke hearts (packed in water), drained, chopped\n2 Tbsp minced chives or green onion greens\n6 eggs\n2 cups milk\n8 ounces cheddar cheese, grated\n1 1/2 teaspoons salt\n1/4 teaspoon black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Dry cubed bread in oven: Place cubed bread on a baking sheet, put in a 200\xc2\xb0F for 10 to 15 minutes, until somewhat dry. OR you can use stale bread that is no longer soft. Drying the bread in the oven will help keep it from falling apart when you add the egg mixture later.\n2 Cook the chopped bacon: Place bacon in medium skillet on medium high heat. Cook until bacon is lightly browned and much of the fat rendered. Remove bacon from pan with a slotted spoon, place on a paper towel lined plate to drain. Pour off all but enough bacon fat to coat the bottom of the pan (do not put down the drain, it will clog your pipes).\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions: Add chopped onions to the pan with bacon fat. Cook on medium high heat until lightly browned, about 5 to 6 minutes. Add the bacon back to the pan with the onions, stir, remove from heat.\n4 Blanch the asparagus: While the onions are cooking, bring a small pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the asparagus and blanch for 2 minutes. Drain and shock the asparagus in ice water to stop the cooking.\n5 Mix eggs, milk, cheese: In a large bowl, beat the eggs with a fork or whisk. Whisk in the milk. Stir in the 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Stir in the grated cheddar cheese.\n6 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n7 Place bread in egg milk mixture, fold in bacon and vegetables: Place the cubed bread in the egg milk mixture and press down with your hands so that the bread cubes absorb most of the egg milk mixture. Gently fold in the onions, bacon, asparagus, chopped artichoke hearts, and chives. (Be gentle as to not break up the bread.)\n8 Assemble the casserole: Generously butter the inside of a 2 1/2 to 3 quart (8 x 13 inch) casserole dish. Gently pour the bread egg milk vegetable mixture into the casserole dish and spread out in an even layer.\nAt this point you can make up to a day ahead. Cover and refrigerate until ready to cook.\n9 Bake: Bake uncovered at 350\xc2\xb0F for 4o minutes. If the casserole starts to get too browned while cooking, cover with foil. Remove from oven and let rest for 5 minutes before serving.\n  Hello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nEggs Mimosa with Artichoke Tapenade Recipe\nPrep time: 40 minutesYield: Makes 12 stuffed egg halves\nWe are using canned artichoke hearts that have been packed in water. You could also use freshly cooked artichoke hearts. Just avoid the artichoke hearts that are packed in a marinade; those would overwhelm this dish.\nBest way to make easy-to-peel hard boiled eggs? Steam them!\nINGREDIENTS\n6 eggs, hard boiled (see How to Steam Hard Boiled Eggs)\n3/4 cup chopped artichoke hearts (from about 1/2 14-ounce can artichokes hearts in water, drained)\n1/2 teaspoon capers, drained\n4 pitted green olives, chopped\n1 teaspoon minced chives or green onion greens, packed\n1 teaspoon chopped fresh tarragon and/or parsley, packed\n2 Tbsp mayonnaise\n2 Tbsp grated Parmesan cheese, packed\n1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper\nSprigs of m\xc3\xa2che lettuce or baby spinach for garnish\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cut the eggs in half lengthwise, remove the yolks and place in a bowl.  Place the whites on a serving platter.\n2 In a food processor, chop the artichokes, green olives, capers,  chives, tarragon, and parsley, by pulsing a few times.\n3 In a medium bowl, break up one of the egg yolks with a fork. Stir in the mayonnaise until smooth. Stir in the chopped artichoke mixture, the Parmesan cheese, and black pepper.\n4 Use a spoon to carefully stuff each egg white half with the artichoke tapenade.\n5 Using the fine holes of a box grater, a microplane grater, or (preferably) a rotary cheese grater, gently grate the egg yolks over the entire platter.\nGarnish with m\xc3\xa2che or baby lettuce to serve.\n  Hello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nBraised Marinated Artichokes Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 4\nChoose globe artichokes whose petals are closed. They'll be fresher than artichokes whose petals have started to open wide. Frost-kissed artichokes are especially delicious, so even though they may look a little blemished, they'll taste great.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 large globe artichokes\n1 lemon\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n3/4 cup sliced shallots\n3 cloves garlic, minced, about 1 Tbsp\n3 bay leaves\n1 cup dry white wine (such as a Sauvignon blanc)\n3/4 cup water\n1 teaspoon salt\n3 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley leaves\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh mint leaves\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the artichokes: Prepare a large bowl with cold water. Squeeze half a lemon into the water. Using a serrated knife (bread knife works well for this), cut off the top inch of the artichokes. Squeeze a little lemon over the cut areas to keep the artichokes from turning brown.\nUse kitchen shears to snip off the thorny tips of the artichoke leaves.\nUse the serrated knife to cut the artichokes into quarters.\nUse a metal teaspoon to scrape away the hairy choke above the artichoke heart. Remove the small, papery, purplish leaves close to the choke. Rub the cut areas again with lemon.\nPlace the quartered artichoke hearts into the bowl of acidulated water as you finish prepping them.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 shallots and garlic: Heat olive oil on medium heat in a thick-bottomed pot that will hold all of the artichokes tightly in a single layer. (Choose a pot with a tight-fitting lid.)\nWhen the oil is hot, add the shallots and saut\xc3\xa9 for 3 to 5 minutes, until softened.\nAdd the garlic and cook an additional minute.\n3 Add wine, water, bay leaves, salt, then simmer: Add the white wine, water, bay leaves, and salt to the pot. Make sure there is enough liquid to cover the bottom of the pan by 1/4-inch. If not, add more water until there is. Bring to a simmer, and simmer for a minute.\n4 Add quartered artichokes, simmer: Place the quartered artichokes, cut side down in a single layer, in the pot. Bring to a boil on high heat.\nCover the pot with a tight fitting lid and lower the heat to medium. Simmer for 20 minutes. (If it looks like the pot is at risk of running out of liquid, add more hot water to the pot.)\n5 Toss with parsley, mint, continue to simmer: Then toss with the parsley and mint, turning the artichokes over to coat them with the sauce, cover again, and cook for an additional 5 to 15 minutes, until the leaves are tender and are easy to pull off the artichoke.\nNote that older artichokes may take a longer cooking time (and therefore more water/wine in the pot) to get tender.\nLet cool to slightly warm or room temperature. Serve with some of the pan juices and shallots from the braising liquid. Especially good if you make a day ahead, giving the cooked artichokes more time to marinate. Just chill, and return to room temperature before serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nSpinach & Artichoke Sheet Pan Pizza Recipe\nPrep time: 30 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nOne pound of dough is perfect for making a thin-crust pizza, but use 2 pounds of dough if you'd like a thicker, breadier crust.\nIf your artichoke hearts seem like they'd be a large mouthful, cut them into smaller, more bite-sized pieces. Smaller pieces tend to be better for this pizza.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 tablespoons olive oil, divided\n1 pound pizza dough (store-bought or homemade)\n1 teaspoon Italian seasoning\n4 cloves garlic, chopped\n1 (6-ounce) bag baby spinach\n1 (12- to 14-ounce) jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained thoroughly (and sliced if needed; see Recipe Note)\n1 1/2 cups (6 ounces) shredded mozzarella cheese\nCrushed red pepper flakes (optional)\nSpecial equipment:\n13x18 baking sheet\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 450\xc2\xbaF. Position an oven rack in the lower half of the oven. Grease an 13x18-inch baking sheet with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.\n2 Roll out the dough: If your pizza dough has been in the refrigerator, remove it and set it on the counter at room temperature for 20 minutes.\nGenerously flour a pastry board, then turn the dough out onto the board. Use a rolling pin to roll the dough into a large rectangle.\n3 Transfer the dough to the pan: Transfer the dough to the oiled sheet pan, stretching it out to the corners of the pan. If it springs back, wait a few minutes and then try again.\nDrizzle 1 tablespoon of the olive oil onto the dough. Use a pastry brush or your fingers to gently spread the oil all over the dough, taking care not to create any tears. Sprinkle the Italian seasoning evenly over the dough.\n4 Wilt the spinach: Heat the remaining tablespoon of oil and the garlic in a large skillet over medium heat. When the garlic begins to bubble, add the spinach. Saut\xc3\xa9 until the spinach has wilted, about 2 minutes, then turn off the heat.\n5 Top the pizza: If the dough has shrunk away from the corners, give it a final stretch to reach the sides of pan. Sprinkle on half of the mozzarella over the pizza, followed by the saut\xc3\xa9ed spinach and then the artichokes. Sprinkle with the rest of the mozzarella.\n6 Bake the pizza: Bake the pizza until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes.\n7 Slice and serve: Use two spatulas to lift the pizza from the pan and transfer it to a large cutting board to slice into squares, or use a pizza wheel to slice it right in the pan. Serve the pizza piping hot, sprinkled with crushed red pepper flakes (optional).\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nShrimp and Artichoke Pasta Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound linguine, fettuccine, spaghetti, or other pasta\n1/4 cup prepared basil pesto (or spinach, arugula, or kale pesto)\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 clove garlic, finely minced\n1 pound raw shrimp (21 to 30 count), peeled, deveined\n1 cup frozen peas\n8 ounces frozen artichoke heart quarters, thawed, cut in half lengthwise\n1/3 cup thinly sliced green onions, including the greens\n1/3 cup minced fresh parsley\nSalt and freshly ground black pepper to taste\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Boil the pasta: Heat a large pot of salted water (4 quarts of water, 2 tablespoons salt) on high heat until boiling.\nAdd the pasta. Cook uncovered on high heat with a vigorous boil until al dente (cooked but still a little firm), about 10 minutes or whatever your pasta package says is appropriate for al dente.\n2 Reserve some pasta cooking liquid, drain pasta. Once the pasta is done, and before draining the pasta, scoop out one cup of the pasta cooking liquid and reserve. Drain the pasta.\n3 Toss the pasta with the pesto and keep it warm.\n4 Saut\xc3\xa9 the shrimp and garlic: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and shrimp and cook, stirring, for 1 minute, until the shrimp is pink but not quite cooked through.\n5 Add the peas and artichokes, lower the heat to medium, cover and cook for an additional minute.\n6 Add green onions, parsley, pasta: Add the green onions and parsley, reduce the heat to low. Add the pasta and about a third of a cup of the reserved cooking water.\nToss to coat evenly. Add more cooking water if the pasta is still a little too dry.\nSeason with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nAsparagus Artichoke Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 12 minutesYield: Serve 6-8 as a side dish\nThick asparagus spears are easier than thin to roast or grill without becoming too dry or over-cooked.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 large shallot, sliced thin (can sub a few thin slices of red onion or some sliced spring onion)\n2-3 tablespoons lemon juice\n2 pounds thick asparagus, rinsed, tough ends broken off and discarded (or saved for stock)\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided\nSalt\n1 teaspoon garlic powder\n1 pint grape or cherry tomatoes, sliced in half\n1 15-ounce jar of good quality marinated artichoke hearts, quartered or cut in half (depending on the size of the artichokes)\nMETHOD\n1 Soak the sliced shallots in the lemon juice as you get ready to make the rest of the salad.\n2 Roast or Grill the asparagus:\nTo roast the asparagus, preheat the oven to 400\xc2\xb0F. Coat the asparagus spears with 1 Tbsp of olive oil, and salt them well. Lay in a single layer in a foil-lined roasting pan, and cook for 8-10 minutes until lightly browned and fork tender.\nTo grill the asparagus, prepare your charcoal or gas grill for high direct heat. Coat the asparagus with 1 Tbsp of olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Grill them until nicely charred and fork tender, between 5 to 10 minutes.\nRemove the asparagus from the oven or grill and cut into bite-sized pieces.\n3 Put the asparagus and all the remaining ingredients into a large bowl and mix to combine. Add as much of the marinating liquid from the jarred artichokes as you like. Serve chilled or at room temperature.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Print\nHow to Trim an Artichoke\nYou'll need a sharp paring knife, a large empty bowl for leaves, and a large bowl filled two-thirds with ice water.\nINGREDIENTS\nArtichokes\nA fresh lemon cut in half\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Squeeze half a lemon into a large bowl of water: If you are trimming more than one artichoke, squeeze half a lemon into a large bowl of ice water. You will be dropping trimmed artichokes into this bowl to keep them from browning while you work others.\n2 Snap off outer green leaves, then pull off yellow petals: Start by snapping off the artichoke leaves and tossing them into a large empty bowl. When you get to the yellow petals, just pull them off. Wipe the exposed surface with the other half of the lemon you cut.\n3 Pull out the pink tipped leaves: Take care when you get to the pink center of the artichoke leaves. There are sharp spines on the end of the inner leaves. Pull them out.\n4 Use a paring knife to dig out the fuzzy choke. You will want to slice off the narrowest layer of the heart to get all of the choke without cutting away too much of the delicious heart.\nA note on this whole process. Don\xe2\x80\x99t do it if there are distractions. You need to focus. You will be using a sharp knife close to your hands. Since artichokes are tough when raw, you can easily cut yourself if you take your eye off what you are doing.\n5 Rub cut lemon over exposed artichoke heart: Once the fuzzy choke is out, smear the cut lemon all over the exposed heart.\nThis prevents the heart from oxidizing and turning brown. An artichoke is still perfectly edible when oxidized, it just is not particularly attractive.\n6 Slice off all but the last inch or so of the stem. Rub lemon juice on the cut end.\n7 Trim the hard green exterior of the rest of the heart. Cut away from you as you rotate the artichoke, slicing off just the hard green part and leaving the light green underneath. Rub this with lemon.\n8 To finish, slice the outside layer off the stem and then coat the whole heart one more time with lemon. Drop into the lemon-water bath and go on to the next one.\nHere's a tip: as your cut lemon gets used up, put it in the water bath, which will help keep the bath\xe2\x80\x99s citric acid content high, and help keep the artichokes from browning.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b'Save It Print\nArtichoke and Shrimp Risotto Recipe\nPrep time: 7 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Serves 3 to 4\nIf starting with frozen shrimp, thaw by placing in a bowl of cold water with a teaspoon of salt stirred in. Peel and devein once thawed.\nWe are using artichokes canned in water for this recipe and we suggest including the artichoke water in with the risotto. Taste the artichoke water first. If it tastes good to you, then include. If not, then don\'t.\nYou can also use frozen or fresh cooked artichoke hearts instead of canned. For frozen you\'ll probably need about 8 ounces. For fresh, you\'ll probably need the hearts from 2 globe artichokes, cooked and finely chopped.\nSee How to Cook and Eat an Artichoke for instructions on cooking artichokes.\nINGREDIENTS\n12 ounces raw shrimp (26-30 size), about 18 pieces\n1/2 teaspoon paprika\nSalt\n1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 Tbsp butter + 2 Tbsp butter\n1/3 cup minced shallots\n1 Tbsp minced garlic\n1 1/2 cup risotto rice (recommend carnaroli, can also use arborio)\n1/2 cup dry white wine (like a Sauvignon Blanc)\n8 ounces clam juice\n1 14-ounce can artichoke hearts packed in water, drained (reserve the water!), and finely chopped\n2-3 cups water\n2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Toss shrimp with paprika, salt, pepper: Pat dry the peeled and deveined shrimp and place them in a medium bowl, toss to coat with 1/2 teaspoon salt, the paprika, and pepper.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 shrimp: Heat 1 Tbsp butter in a small saut\xc3\xa9 pan on high heat. Add the shrimp and saut\xc3\xa9 for 1 to 2 minutes on each side, until they are cooked on the outside, but not quite cooked through (they\'ll continue to cook as they sit outside of the pan). Then remove to a bowl and set aside.\n3 Simmer salted water: Put 3 cups of water with about a teaspoon of salt in a small saucepan. Heat until simmering and keep warm while you start the risotto.\n4 Saut\xc3\xa9 shallots, garlic: Heat 2 Tbsp butter in a 3 to 4-quart thick-bottomed pot on medium heat. Add the minced shallots and cook until translucent, about 3 to 4 minutes.\nAdd the garlic and cook a minute more.\n5 Add risotto rice: Add the risotto rice to the pot, stir to coat. Let cook for a minute or two for the rice to just barely begin to brown.\n6 Add 1/2 cup dry white wine. Let come to a low simmer and slowly stir until the wine has been absorbed by the rice.\n7 Add clam juice, artichoke can water: Add the clam juice and the reserved water from the can of artichokes, a half cup at a time, slowly stirring and allowing the rice to absorb the liquid before adding more liquid.\n8 Start adding hot salted water, 1/2 cup at a time: Once the rice as absorbed the wine, clam juice, and artichoke water, you can start adding the hot, lightly salted water from step one.\nAdd it 1/2 cup at a time, again stirring slowly allowing the rice to absorb it for a minute or two before adding any more. You\'ll need between 2 and 3 cups of water.\nYou\'ll want to stop adding water when the rice is cooked through, but still a little firm to the bite, "al dente".\n9 Stir in the chopped artichoke hearts. Fold in the shrimp and chopped parsley. Serve immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nPasta with Artichoke Hearts, Sun Dried Tomatoes, and Toasted Almonds Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound fusilli pasta (use gluten-free pasta for gluten-free version)\nSalt\n1 14-ounce jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained, hearts cut into eighths, about 1 1/2 cups\n1/2 cup sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, removed from oil (reserve oil), chopped\n1 cup chopped toasted almonds\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1 tablespoon lemon juice\n1/4 teaspoon black pepper\n1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley leaves, loosely packed, more or less to taste\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the pasta, al dente: Bring a large pot of well salted water to a vigorous boil. Add the pasta to the boiling water and let cook, uncovered, at a full boil, for the amount of time specified on the pasta package, minus about 2 minutes. Test, the pasta should be cooked through, but still firm to the bite, al dente.\nWhile the pasta is cooking, prep the other ingredients.\n2 Place the cut marinated artichoke hearts, the chopped sun-dried tomatoes, the toasted almonds, and lemon zest in a large bowl.\n3 Drain pasta, add to artichoke hearts: When the pasta is done, drain it, and add the pasta into the bowl with the artichoke hearts and sun-dried tomatoes. Toss gently to mix.\n4 Season with lemon juice, pepper, parsley, oil: Sprinkle lemon juice, parsley, and black pepper over the pasta, toss to mix.\nAdd 1 to 2 tablespoons of the sun-dried tomato oil to the pasta, and 1-2 tablespoons of olive oil. Toss to mix. Taste and adjust seasonings.\nAt this point you can make ahead and reheat to serve.\nServe warm.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nSweet and Sour Glazed Artichokes with Caramelized Onions Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 4\nYou can use either standard large globe artichokes for this recipe, or if you can find them, Roman artichokes.\nThink of artichoke leaves as the petals of a flower (which indeed they are). Choose artichokes where the leaves haven't opened much. If they've begun to open, the artichoke is probably not as fresh and good as one where the leaves are still closed and tight.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 large globe artichokes (or 4 Roman artichokes)\n1 large onion, cut in half and thinly sliced cross-wise\n2 1/2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 teaspoon Kosher salt\n1 tablespoon sugar\n3 tablespoons white vinegar\nLemon for the acidulated water\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the artichokes: Prepare a large bowl of water, squeeze half a lemon into the water. Working with the artichokes one at a time, pull off the outer leaves of the artichoke until they easily snap off.\nPeel the stem, and cut off all but 1 to 1 1/2 inches of the stem. Cut off the top half of the artichokes.\nUse a paring knife to cut around the edge of the artichoke, removing any green parts. Angle the knife toward the center of the artichoke while you do this so the result is more cone-shaped.\nUse a melon baller to scoop out and discard the fuzzy choke in the center of the artichoke.\nCut the artichoke into quarters, and cut each quarter into 3 or 4 slices. Place in the acidified water.\n2 Cook artichokes with sliced onions in olive oil: Heat olive oil in a 3 to 4 quart, thick-bottomed pot on medium heat. Add the sliced onions and artichoke hearts. Toss to coat with the olive oil.\nCook on medium low to low heat for 40 minutes or so, stirring occasionally, until the artichokes are completely cooked through and tender, and the onions are caramelized.\n3 Sprinkle with salt, sugar, and vinegar and cook for a few minutes more.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Print\nOil-Poached Artichoke Heart Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 4\nThe seasonings are a guide here: If you\xe2\x80\x99d rather toss the \xe2\x80\x98chokes with something else, go for it.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 large artichoke hearts\nSalt\nLots of extra virgin olive oil\n2 smashed garlic cloves\nJuice of 2 lemons\n1 tablespoon minced parsley\n1 tablespoon minced chives\nBlack pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Trim your artichokes: (see How to Trim an Artichoke). Once they are trimmed, slice lengthwise into pieces roughly \xc2\xbc inch thick. You want them to look like silhouettes of an artichoke heart.\n2 Bathe the slices in a bowl of lemon juice.\n3 Heat garlic in olive oil: Get a large, heavy pot with a lid and pour in a layer of olive oil. Add the smashed garlic cloves and turn the heat to low.\n4 Add salted artichoke heart slices to the oil: Take some artichoke heart slices out of the lemon juice and salt them well. Slip them into the olive oil in layers, adding more olive oil to cover. You will probably need about a pint or so of olive oil \xe2\x80\x93 it is very important they are completely covered.\nDo not use cheap vegetable oil (corn, canola, etc) as a substitute because you will definitely taste the olive oil in the final dish. You could use melted butter, though\xe2\x80\xa6\n5 Heat on low: Cover the pot and cook on the lowest heat of your weakest burner for 45 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the oil cool for another 20-30 minutes.\n6 Remove from oil and toss with remaining ingredients: To make the salad, just remove the artichokes from the oil and toss with the remaining ingredients. You can eat the garlic or not, but it is just there to flavor the oil.\nServe at room temperature. It keeps for several days in the fridge.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nCreamy Basil Artichoke Mac and Cheese Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 6\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the mac and cheese:\nSalt for the pasta water\n3/4 pound pasta, such as elbows or cavatappi\n1/3 cup packed fresh basil leaves\n2 cups heavy cream\n1/2 cup whole milk\n4 ounces cream cheese, softened at room temperature and cut into chunks\n1 cup grated Fontina (about 3 ounces)\n3/4 cup grated sharp cheddar (about 3 ounces)\n1/2 cup grated Parmesan (about 2 ounces)\n1 (8-ounce) jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained and cut into bite size pieces\nPinch cayenne pepper\nFor the toasted breadcrumbs (optional):\n1 cup soft, fresh breadcrumbs\n2 to 3 tablespoons olive oil\nPinch of salt\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook for 6 to 8 minutes, or until al dente. Drain the pasta in a colander and reserve the pot. You are going to return the pot to the stove after making the basil cream.\n2 Make the basil cream: Combine basil, heavy cream, milk, and cream cheese in the blender. Puree until smooth. Return the pot used to boil the pasta to the stove, and set it over medium heat. Add the basil cream to the pot, and bring it to a low simmer.\n3 Make the sauce: Add the Fontina, cheddar, Parmesan, and cayenne pepper to the basil cream sauce, stirring until melted. Stir in the cooked pasta and artichokes. Continue to cook and stir until the mixture is heated all the way through.\n4 Toast the breadcrumbs (optional): In a skillet over medium heat, combine the breadcrumbs, oil, and salt. Stir for 2 to 3 minutes, or until browned and crisp.\n5 Serve the mac and cheese: Transfer the pasta to bowls and sprinkle with the toasted breadcrumbs, or don\xe2\x80\x99t. It\xe2\x80\x99s your call.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nArugula Salad with Beets and Goat Cheese Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCooking the Beets time: 1 hourYield: Makes enough for 2 salads\nThe amount of ingredients shown is just a guideline for two servings. The actual amounts depend on how much salad per serving you want.\nINGREDIENTS\nSalad Ingredients:\n2 medium beets, cooked (roasted* or boiled**) until a fork easily goes in one (about an hour), peeled, diced into bite-sized pieces\n2 handfuls (about 2.5 ounces) fresh baby arugula\n4 Tbsp goat cheese (about 1.5 ounces)\n1/4 cup roughly chopped toasted walnuts\nDressing ingredients:\n3 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n1 1/2 Tbsp lemon juice\n1/4 teaspoon dry powdered mustard\n1/2 teaspoon sugar\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon pepper\n* To roast beets, scrub raw beets clean, coat with a little olive oil, wrap in aluminum foil, and roast in 400\xc2\xb0F oven for 1 to 2 hours, until fork tender\n** To boil beets, scrub raw beets clean, put in small pot, cover with water, bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook for 45 min to an hour, until fork tender\nMETHOD\n1 Make the vinaigrette: Place dressing ingredients in a jar and shake to emulsify. Adjust ingredients to taste.\n2 Assemble the salad according to how much you want. Compose each dish with a handful of arugula leaves, a few cooked chopped beets, some crumbled goat cheese, and some chopped toasted walnuts.\n3 Drizzle the salad with vinaigrette. (You may have a little extra vinaigrette.)\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b"Save It Print\nAngel Hair Pasta with Salmon, Arugula, and Creamy Lemon-Parmesan Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: 6 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, separated\n6 salmon fillets (2 1/2 to 3 ounces each, about 1 to 1 1/4 pounds total), preferably wild-caught King or Sockeye salmon\n2 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, divided\n1 teaspoon ground black pepper, divided\n1 pound angel hair pasta\n4 tablespoons unsalted butter, separated\n1 tablespoon minced shallot\n4 garlic cloves, minced\n1 cup dry white wine or seafood stock\nJuice and rinds of 2 lemons (1/3 to 1/2 cup juice)\n2 cups heavy cream\n5 ounces arugula (4 packed cups)\n1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Warm your oven: Set the oven to its lowest setting (mine is 150\xc2\xb0F) to keep the salmon warm once it's cooked.\n2 Start the water for pasta. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil.\n3 Season the salmon fillets: Rub both sides of the fillets with 1 teaspoon of the kosher salt and a 1/2 teaspoon of the black pepper.\n4 Sear the salmon: Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over medium-high heat in a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan (preferably nonstick). Once the oil starts to ripple in the pan, place the salmon fillets into the pan, skin-side up.\nPress the fillets down gently to make sure the entire surface makes contact with the pan. Sear the salmon fillets for 3 minutes, or until the flesh turns an opaque pink 1/4 of the way up the sides of the fillets.\n5 Flip the salmon and keep it hot: Use a spatula to flip the salmon and sear it, skin-side down, for an additional 3 minutes.\nTransfer the fillets to a sheet pan and place them in the heated oven while you finish the dish. It\xe2\x80\x99s okay if the salmon is not cooked completely through just yet\xe2\x80\x94it will continue to cook in the oven.\n6 Cook the shallot and deglaze the pan: In the same pan you used to sear the salmon, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and 2 tablespoons of the butter over medium-high heat. Add the shallot and the garlic to the pan and saut\xc3\xa9 for 3 minutes, or until glossy and fragrant.\nPour the white wine and lemon juice into the pan and use a wooden spoon to scrape up any bits of food that have stuck to the bottom of the pan. Add the lemon halves and bring the mixture to a boil.\n7 Reduce the sauce and cook the pasta: Reduce the sauce in the pan by half by maintaining a boil. This should take 3 to 4 minutes.\n8 Cook the pasta: By now, your pasta water should be at a rolling boil. Add generous tablespoon of salt to the boiling water and drop the pasta into the middle of the pot. Stir the pasta immediately to separate the noodles.\nLower the temperature slightly to prevent the water from boiling over and cook the pasta for 4 to 5 minutes, until al dente (or according to package directions). Drain the pasta.\n9 Finish the sauce:  Once the liquid in the pan has reduced by half, reduce the heat to medium-low. Remove the lemon halves. Slowly stir in the heavy cream and the remaining butter.\nAllow the sauce to come to a simmer, then add the arugula. Stir to coat the arugula in the sauce and allow it to wilt slightly\xe2\x80\x94this should only take a minute or so. Add the Parmesan, along with the remaining salt and pepper. Taste and adjust the seasoning, if necessary, by adding a bit more salt or pepper.\n10 Combine the pasta and sauce: Add the pasta to the pan with the sauce. Using tongs, toss in the pasta in the sauce until it is evenly coated.\n11 Serve the pasta with the salmon: Remove the warm salmon fillets from the oven and arrange on top of the pasta. Serve immediately. While this dish is best enjoyed the same day it\xe2\x80\x99s made, we have had success with reheating the leftovers in the microwave the next day.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nPasta with Tuna and Arugula Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nWhile you are heating the pasta water, prep the ingredients.\nThis recipe requires tuna canned in olive oil. Tuna canned in water just doesn't work well with this recipe. If water canned tuna is your only option, drain it, and soak it in half a cup of good quality olive oil for an hour first.\nINGREDIENTS\n3/4 pound (12 ounces) dried fettuccine, spaghetti or linguine\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 cloves garlic, minced\n1/8 teaspoon hot red pepper flakes (more to taste)\n2 6-ounce cans tuna packed in olive oil, drained\nSalt\n5 to 8 ounces baby arugula\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water (1 Tbsp salt for every 2 quarts of water) to a rolling boil. Add the pasta, return to a rolling boil, and boil uncovered until the pasta is al dente, cooked, but still a little firm to the bite.\n2 Cook garlic and red pepper flakes in olive oil; add tuna, salt: While the pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet on medium-low heat. Add the garlic and hot pepper flakes and cook until garlic is fragrant.\nAdd the tuna and shred it into fine flakes with a fork. Season with salt. Keep warm over low heat.\n3 Set aside a cup of pasta water: Just before the pasta is ready, set aside 1 cup of boiling water. You'll need this to add back to the pasta dish to keep it from getting too dry.\n4 Combine pasta with tuna mixture, arugula, and some pasta water: Drain the pasta and depending on the size of your pan, either add it to the skillet with the tuna, or return the pasta to the pasta pot and add the tuna mixture to the pasta.\nAdd the arugula and use tongs to toss together with the pasta and tuna. Add some of the hot reserved pasta water to help loosen the pasta.\nThe arugula will wilt as you toss the pasta and tuna with it. Add more pasta water as needed.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nOrange and Beet Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 bunch of beets, leaves removed (save them for beet greens!) - about 4 or 5 medium sized, scrubbed clean\n2 large navel oranges, peels cut off with a small small knife and sliced\n1 bunch of arugula leaves, cleaned, and any thick stems removed\nSeveral thin slices of red onion\noptional 1/4 cup chopped walnuts\nVinaigrette Dressing:\n3 Tbsp white wine vinegar\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n1/4 teaspoon dried mustard\nSalt and pepper to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the beets: You can either boil or roast the beets. To boil the beets, cover the unpeeled beets with water, bring to a boil, and simmer for 30 minutes or until beets can easily be pierced through with a fork.\nIf you prefer to roast the beets instead of boiling them, wrap the unpeeled beets in aluminum foil and bake them in the oven at 400\xc2\xb0F for an hour or until done. (See our Roasted Beets recipe.)\nAfter cooking, allow the beets to come to room temperature and remove their peels. Slice or quarter them.\nIf you have time, place them in a small bowl and marinate them in half of the oil and vinegar dressing.\n2 Make the dressing: While the beets are cooking, make the dressing by putting all of the dressing ingredients into a jar. Seal and shake until the dressing is well blended.\n3 Compose the salad: Compose individual salad plates with arugula, a few slices of orange, a few beets, a few slices of red onion and a few chopped walnuts.\nIf you want some added color, gently add a few slices of the orange to the beet juice from your bowl of beets. Let the oranges absorb the beet color and use in your salad.\nSprinkle dressing over the individual salads.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nEasy Steak Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nNo need to bring the steak to room temp before cooking. You sear on such high heat, and the steaks are so thin, it's actually better to cook the steak while it is still relatively chilled, if you want the centers to be rare.\nINGREDIENTS\nExtra virgin olive oil\n1 pound flank steak or skirt steak\nSalt and freshly ground pepper\n1/2 head lettuce greens\n1 bunch arugula (young leaves), tough stems removed\n1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced lengthwise and cut into 1-inch long pieces\n4 scallions, thinly sliced\n1 avocado, cut into bite-sized pieces\n4 ounces goat cheese, crumbled\nPomegranate seeds or thinly sliced kumquats (optional)\nFor the dressing:\n2 tablespoons lemon juice\n6 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 teaspoon Dijon mustard (smooth), or 1/2 teaspoon dry mustard\nSalt and pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the steak: Heat a couple teaspoons of oil in a cast iron pan on high heat. Pat the steaks dry. Sprinkle the steaks on both sides with a little salt.\nSear the steaks in the pan on both sides, just until nicely browned. Remove pan from heat and cover. Let cook for a few minutes more, until the steak is done to your liking.\nYou can test with a meat thermometer. Remove steak from pan at 125\xc2\xb0F to 130\xc2\xb0F for rare, 140\xc2\xb0F for medium rare, 150\xc2\xb0 for medium. Or use your fingers to test the meat for doneness (see The Finger Test to Check the Doneness of Meat).\n2 Let the steak rest before cutting, then cut thin slices: Remove from pan to a cutting board. Let rest for a few minutes before cutting. Cut thin slices, on a diagonal so you slice wide pieces, across the grain of the meat.\n3 Make the salads: Toss together the lettuce greens, arugula, bell pepper, goat cheese, and scallions. Arrange on individual plates. Sprinkle with avocado. Lay on top several slices of chilled sliced steak. Sprinkle with pomegranate seeds or sliced kumquats if using.\n4 Make dressing: Mix together the lemon juice, olive oil, mustard, and salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle on salad.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Print\nGrilled Italian Sausage with Peppers, Onions and Arugula Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nIf you don't have a grill, sear the onions and bell peppers in a little oil on high heat in a large, preferable cast iron, frying pan. Then lower the heat to medium low, add the sausages, and cook, turning the sausages occasionally, until the sausages are cooked through.\nTowards the end of cooking, baste with the honey balsamic mixture.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 large red onion, cut into wedges*\n2 large red bell peppers, seeded and cut into thirds\n1 pound sweet Italian sausage links\nExtra virgin olive oil\nSalt\n3 Tbsp honey\n3 Tbsp balsamic vinegar\n2 to 3 handfuls of baby arugula\n*Cut the onion wedges so that the root end is still intact on each wedge. It will make the onion wedges easier to grill and help keep them from falling apart on the grill.\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the grill.\n2 Mix together the balsamic vinegar and honey in a small bowl and set aside.\n3 Grill the onions: Coat the onions with a little olive oil, and sprinkle with salt. Coat the grill grates with a little olive oil. Put the onion wedges on the grill and cover the grill.\nLet the onions roast for 5 minutes, or until they are a little charred. Turn the onions and move them to a cooler part of the grill to finish.\n4 Grill the sausages and peppers: Coat the sausages and peppers with olive oil. Sprinkle salt on the peppers. If your grill has two levels, place the sausages on the top part of the grill and the peppers directly below them.\nDone this way, as the sausages drip juice and fat, it will fall on the peppers, flavoring them while simultaneously preventing flare-ups.\nIf your grill does not have two levels, put the peppers on the hottest part of the grill and the sausages on the coolest.\nCover and grill everything for 15 to 20 minutes or so, periodically checking and turning the sausages and peppers as needed.\n5 Baste with honey balsamic mixture: Towards the end of cooking, baste the sausages, peppers and onions with the honey and balsamic mixture.\n6 Remove from grill, cut sausages, cut peppers and onions: When the sausages are cooked through and the peppers and onions cooked, remove them from the grill to a sheet pan or large bowl.\nIf you want, pick off some or all of the charred skin on the peppers. Cut the peppers into long strips, and slice the root end off the onions to separate the pieces.\nCut the sausages into thirds. Mix everything well in the pan or bowl.\n7 Serve: To serve, place a bed of baby arugula on the serving plates and top with the sausage, peppers and onion.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint"
b"Save It Print\nShrimp, Arugula, White Bean, Cherry Tomato Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nIt always helps to brine the shrimp before cooking. An extra step, but worth it if you have the time!\nTo brine the shrimp, mix together 4 cups water, 1/4 cup kosher salt (or 3 Tbsp table or sea salt), 1/4 cup white sugar until the salt and sugar have dissolved. Add one cup of ice and the shrimp. After 30 minutes (time it!) remove the shrimp and give them a quick rinse.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound 16-20 count shelled and deveined shrimp\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 15-ounce cans cannellini white beans, rinsed and drained\n1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved or quartered\n1/2 cup finely diced red onion\n3/4 teaspoon grated lemon zest\n3 handfuls baby arugula leaves\nDressing:\n3 tablespoons red wine vinegar\n1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil\n2 cloves minced garlic\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the shrimp: Heat a large cast iron skillet or griddle on high heat. Add 2 Tbsp of olive oil to coat the pan. When the oil is hot, working in batches of half of the shrimp at a time, add the shrimp and saut\xc3\xa9 a minute on each side to sear. (You can also grill the shrimp if you prefer.)\nWhen the shrimp are barely cooked through, remove from the pan and set aside to cool. (The shrimp will continue to cook for a little bit after you remove them from the pan, and you don't want overcooked rubbery shrimp.)\n2 Assemble the salad: Put the drained beans, cut cherry tomatoes, diced onion, lemon zest, and arugula leaves into a large bowl. Fold in the shrimp.\n3 Make the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk together the red wine vinegar, olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper.\nGently fold the dressing into the salad and serve!\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nGolden Beet and Pomegranate Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nIf you want to boil the beets instead of roasting them, put the beets in a small saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 45 minutes or until tender.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 golden beets (about 1 pound)\n1 cup diced red onion\n1/4 cup red wine vinegar\n1/4 cup water\n1/4 cup orange juice ( can sub with 3 Tbsp Triple Sec)\n1 tablespoon sugar\n1 teaspoon orange zest\n1 cup pomegranate seeds\n1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil for the salad, plus 1/2 teaspoon more for roasting the beets\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/8 teaspoon black or white pepper\n2 cups arugula and/or butter lettuce leaves\n1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese\nMETHOD\n1 Roast the beets: Rub the beets with a little olive oil, wrap them together in foil, place them in a roasting pan, and roast them at 400\xc2\xb0F for an hour or until tender when poked with the tines of a fork.\nRemove from oven. Remove the peels from the beets. Dice the beets into bite-sized pieces.\n2 Make the glaze: Put the diced cooked beets, onions, vinegar, water, orange juice, orange zest, sugar, salt, and pepper, in a skillet on high heat.\nHeat the mixture to a boil, and continue to boil, stirring often, until the liquid is reduced to a glaze, about 2 tablespoons (5 minutes or so). Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature.\n3 Assemble the salad: Stir pomegranate seeds and olive oil into the beet mixture and add more salt and pepper to taste.\nServe on top of salad greens and sprinkle with feta cheese.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nQuinoa, Arugula, and Feta Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup (165 g) red quinoa\nScant 1 cup water (1 cup minus 1 tablespoon)\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n3 tablespoons olive oil\n5 ounces (8 loosely packed cups, 165 g) baby arugula\n2 tablespoons (30 ml) lemon juice, or more to taste\n8 ounces (110 g) firm feta, cut into 1/2-inch cubes\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Toast the quinoa: In a dry sauce pan over low heat, toast the quinoa, shaking the pan often, for 5 minutes, or until some of the grains start to turn a darker color.\n2 Cook the quinoa: Add the water and salt to the pan with the quinoa. Turn the heat to high and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cover the pan. Simmer for 15 minutes, or until the quinoa is tender when tasted and all the water is absorbed. If there\xe2\x80\x99s water in the pan, let the quinoa cook 2 minutes more.\n3 Cool the quinoa: Tip the quinoa into a large bowl and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Stir well and leave to cool, stirring occasionally. (Once cooled, the quinoa can be refrigerated for a few days before using.)\n4 Dress the arugula: In another bowl, toss the arugula with the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons of the lemon juice, and pepper.\n5 Toss the salad: Add the cooled quinoa and feta cubes to the bowl with the greens. Toss well and taste for seasoning. Add more salt or lemon juice, if you like. Serve immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nChicken with Goat Cheese and Arugula Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n4 chicken breasts (about 1 1/2 lbs total), tenders removed, breasts pounded thin\nSalt\nGround black pepper\n1 large bunch arugula (about 4 ounces, trimmed)\n4 oz of soft goat cheese (chevre) broken into small pieces\n1-2 tablespoons butter or extra virgin olive oil\nWooden Toothpicks\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Pound chicken breasts thin: Preheat oven to 425\xc2\xb0F. Pound the breasts thin to make them thin enough for rolling. To do this place a piece of plastic wrap over the chicken breast. Use the smooth side of the meat pounder to pound the piece thin.\n2 Layer arugula and cheese on cutlets: Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper. On a clean work surface lay cutlets flat, smooth side down. Layer with arugula leaves and pieces of goat cheese in the center.\n3 Roll up and secure with toothpicks: Starting with the narrowest ends, roll up the chicken cutlets into a tight roulade and seal with toothpicks to keep from unrolling.\n4 Brown chicken roulades on all sides Heat the oil on medium high in a large cast iron pan (or other non-stick oven-proof skillet). Place the chicken roulades in the pan and brown on all sides.\n5 Finish in oven: Place the skillet in the oven and cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes. Remove pan from oven (take care to not touch pan handle with bare hands!) and remove the chicken from the pan.\n6 Cover with foil and let rest for 5 minutes. Remove the toothpicks from the chicken and slice the roulades into rounds to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nLentil Salad with Arugula and Feta Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCooling and assembly time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4 to 6\nWhen buying lentils for this recipe, smaller varieties, like French green lentils, are the best choice. They hold their shape without becoming mushy, look pretty, and have a slightly chewy texture.\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the dressing:\n2 tablespoons sherry vinegar\n1 teaspoon coriander seeds, coarsely crushed in a mortar or with a rolling pin (or 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander)\n1 teaspoon ground sumac (optional), plus more for garnish\n1/8 teaspoon salt\nFresh black pepper\n5 tablespoons olive oil\nSalt and pepper to taste\nFor the salad:\n1 cup small dried lentils, such as French green lentils\nSalt and pepper to taste\n1/4 cup pine nuts\n1/4 red onion, thinly sliced\n1/4 cup dried currants\n1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro\n2 bunches (about 6 cups) arugula\n12 cherry tomatoes, halved\n3 ounces (about 2/3 cup) feta cheese, crumbled\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the dressing:  In a bowl, whisk the vinegar, coriander and sumac (if using) with 1/8 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of fresh black pepper. Gradually whisk in the oil. Taste, and add more salt and pepper, if you like.\n2 Cook the lentils: Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil. Add the lentils. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 18 to 20 minutes, or until the lentils are tender but still hold their shape.\n3 While the lentils cook, toast the pine nuts: In a dry skillet over medium heat, stir the pine nuts constantly for 2 to 3 minutes, or until they are lightly browned. Transfer them immediately to a plate to keep them from burning.\n4 Season the lentils and tame the onions:  When the lentils are done cooking, drain them into a colander and transfer to a small bowl. While the lentils are still hot, stir in the onions and 2 tablespoons of the vinaigrette. Let cool until it's a warm room temperature (no longer piping hot).\n(To speed up the cooling, you can spread the lentils and onions out on a plate.)\n5 Assemble the salad: In a salad bowl, toss the arugula with the currants, cilantro, and remaining vinaigrette. Pile the lentils over the salad and top with the cherry tomatoes, feta, and toasted pine nuts. Sprinkle with more sumac, if you like.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBowtie Pasta with Peas, Prosciutto, and Arugula Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 3 to 4\nPrep the ingredients while the pasta water is heating to save time.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound (8 ounces) farfalle bowtie pasta\n3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil (divided, 1 Tbsp and 2 Tbsp)\n2 ounces prosciutto, thin slices separated and roughly chopped\n1/2 cup fresh or frozen peas\n1/2 cup shredded Parmesan cheese\n1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1 cup reserved pasta water\n1 large handful baby arugula (about a cup and a half, packed)\n2 tablespoons thinly sliced fresh mint leaves\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Add pasta to boiling water to cook: Put 3 quarts of salted water (1/2 Tbsp of salt for every quart of water) onto a boil. Add the farfalle bowtie pasta and cook until al dente.\n2 Gently cook prosciutto: Coat the bottom of a stick-free pan with 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Lay out the pieces of prosciutto in the pan in a single layer. Put the heat on medium and gently cook while the pasta is cooking.\nTurn the pieces over after a few minutes.\nThe intension is not to crisp, but to render some of the fat and firm up the prosciutto a little. When this has been accomplished, remove the pan from heat.\n3 Set aside some pasta cooking water, add peas to pasta and cook an additional minute: Once the pasta has been cooking for the correct timing for al dente, remove one cup of pasta cooking water from the pan and set aside.\nAdd the peas and cook a minute more.\n4 Add pasta, peas, Parmesan, black pepper to prosciutto, then add mint and arugula: Strain the pasta and peas and add to the pan with the prosciutto. Add the Parmesan cheese and toss to coat. Add the black pepper.\nAdd 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water. Add the fresh baby arugula and mint and toss with the hot pasta to wilt the arugula.\nAdd more of the pasta water if the pasta seems dry.\n5 Drizzle with olive oil: Drizzle and toss with 2 Tbsp of olive oil to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nSteak Salad with Arugula and Parmesan Cheese Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 11 minutesYield: 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\nFor the salad\n5 ounces (about 6 cups) baby arugula\n2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for serving\nSalt and pepper, to taste\n1/2 cup (1 ounce) shaved Parmesan Cheese\nFor the steak\nVegetable oil (for the grill)\n2 (1 1/2-inch thick) sirloin steaks (about 1 3/4 pounds)\n2 lemons, cut into wedges (for serving)\nOlive oil (for serving)\nMETHOD\n1 Make the salad: In a bowl, toss the arugula with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper and toss again. Mix in the Parmesan Cheese. Divide among four plates.\n2 Prepare the grill: For charcoal grills, fill a grill chimney with charcoal and light it. When the coals are hot (they should be covered with a layer of fine gray ash) empty the coals into the grill and push them to one side of the grill to make higher heat and lower heat cooking zones. Set the grate in place and cover the grill. Preheat the grate for 5 minutes.\nFor gas grills, heat one burner to high and one to low (225F).\nFold a small piece of paper towel to make a 2-inch square, and pour a few tablespoons of oil into a shallow bowl. With tongs, dip the square into the oil, and brush the grates.\n3 Cook the steaks: Brush the steaks with olive oil and sprinkle them on both sides with salt and pepper. Place them on the hot side of the grill and cook until browned and slightly charred on one side, 3 to 4 minutes. Turn the steaks over and continue to grill 3 minutes longer, or until well browned.\nIf the steaks aren't quite cooked to your desired doneness at this point, move them to the cooler side of the grill to finish cooking. Cook to an internal temperature of 135F for medium-rare, 140F for medium, or 150F for well done.\nTransfer the steaks to a cutting board or platter, tent loosely with foil and let rest 5 minutes before slicing.\n4 To serve: Slice the steaks and divide the slices between the plates, placing them on top of the arugula. Drizzle with olive oil and squeeze lemon juice over the top. Sprinkle with more salt and pepper, if you like.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b"Save It Print\nArugula Corn Salad with Bacon Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n4 large ears of corn\n2 cups of chopped arugula (about one bunch)\n4 strips of bacon, cooked, chopped\n1/3 cup chopped green onions\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1 tablespoon white wine vinegar\n1/8 teaspoon ground cumin\nSalt and freshly ground black pepper to taste\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the corn: Cook the corn ears, in their husks, either on the grill for a smoky flavor, or by steaming in a large covered stock pot with an inch of boiling water at the bottom of the pot, for 12-15 minutes, or by cooking in a microwave.\nLet the corn cool (can run under cold water to speed up the cooling), remove the husks and silk.\nI recommend cooking the corn in the husks for the added flavor that the husks impart. If you boil or steam the corn ears after you've already husked them, or if you cook them in the microwave, reduce the cooking time by a few minutes.\n2 Remove the corn kernels from the cobs: To remove the kernels from the cobs, stand a corn cob vertically with the tip on a small bowl that is inverted inside a larger, shallow bowl.\nUse a sharp knife to make long, downward strokes, removing the kernels from the cob, as you work your way around the cob.\nNote: it may help to work over a low table, to be in a better ergonomic position to cut the cobs this way.\n3 Make the dressing: In a separate bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, salt and pepper, and cumin.\n4 Assemble the salad: In a medium sized bowl, mix together the corn, chopped arugula, bacon, and onions.\nMix dressing into salad just before serving. Taste and add more vinegar if necessary to balance the sweetness of the corn.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nChicken Apple Arugula Goat Cheese Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus more for dressing\n1 large shallot, peeled and sliced\n1 1/2 lb skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut into 1 inch cubes\nSalt\n1 tart green apple, thinly sliced and roughly chopped\nBaby arugula leaves - enough for a salad for four\n1/4 cup toasted walnuts, roughly chopped\n1/4 cup goat cheese - broken up into little pieces\nLemon juice\nSalt and pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 shallots: Heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a stick-free frying pan on medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the shallot slices and lightly saut\xc3\xa9 them until translucent. Remove shallots from pan and set aside.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 chicken pieces: Heat another tablespoon of olive oil in the pan and when the oil is hot, add the chicken breast pieces. Cook, stirring occasionally, until just cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes. Sprinkle some salt on the chicken while you are cooking it. Remove from pan and chill.\n3 Assemble salad: When chicken has cooled, toss together in a serving bowl the shallots, chicken, sliced green apple, arugula, toasted walnuts and goat cheese.\n4 Dress with olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste.\nHello! b'Save It Print\nBLT with Arugula Recipe\nCook time: 15 minutesYield: Makes one BLT sandwich\nINGREDIENTS\n2-3 slices thick smoked bacon\n1-2 thin slices of a fresh, large tomato\n1-2 ounces (a couple handfuls) fresh baby arugula (can substitute watercress)\n2 slices of bread\nMayonnaise\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook the bacon: Heat a large saut\xc3\xa9 pan or cast iron pan on medium low heat. Lay the strips of bacon in a single layer on the pan. Slowly cook the bacon, rendering out the fat, until lightly browned on one side. Using a fork or tongs, turn the strips of bacon over to cook the other side.\nWhen the bacon strips are sufficiently cooked remove from pan and place on a plate lined with a paper towel to absorb the excess fat.\nPour out excess fat from the pan (leaving about half a teaspoon in the pan) into a jar or a container to either dispose of or to store. (Never pour bacon grease down the sink, it will clog your pipes.)\n2 Wilt the arugula: In the same pan, add handfuls of fresh baby arugula or watercress. Toss in the remaining remaining fat. As soon as the greens start to wilt, remove from heat and remove from the pan to stop the cooking.\n3 Toast bread, build sandwich: Toast bread slices in a toaster. Spread mayonnaise (or your favorite spread, butter will do too) over the slices. Layer the sandwich with bacon, sliced tomato, and lightly wilted arugula. Cut on the diagonal.\nEat immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nPasta with Roasted Cauliflower and Prosciutto Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Serves 4\nIf cherry tomatoes aren't available, you can skip them and add a few chopped sun dried tomatoes to the dish at the end.\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 medium cauliflower, cored and broken up into 3/4-inch florets (4+ cups) (see How to Cut and Core Cauliflower)\n1 pint cherry tomatoes\nExtra virgin olive oil\nSalt\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1 1/2 teaspoons dried sage\n4 large cloves garlic\n4 ounces of prosciutto\n8 ounces orecchiette pasta\n5 ounces baby arugula or spinach, cleaned and coarsely chopped\n1 cup grated Parmesan cheese\nMETHOD\n1 Roast cauliflower and tomatoes: Preheat oven to 425\xc2\xb0F. Lay out cauliflower and tomatoes in a roasting pan, coat with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until just lightly browned and cooked through, about 15 minutes.\n2 Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil (1 teaspoon salt for every quart of water).\n3 Add prosciutto mixture to cauliflower, return to oven: While water is heating, pulse garlic, sage, and prosciutto together in a food processor until coarsely chopped. Once cauliflower has browned lightly, remove from oven, toss cauliflower with garlic prosciutto mixture, and return to oven to cook for 5-7 minutes more.\n4 Boil pasta uncovered (rolling boil) for 9-10 minutes until firm, but done (al dente). Reserve one cup of pasta liquid. Drain water from pot.\n5 Add cauliflower, tomatoes, arugula (or spinach), and Parmesan to the pasta. Stir in enough cooking water to moisten. Add salt and pepper to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nStrawberry Arugula Quinoa Salad Recipe\nCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup uncooked quinoa\n2 cups water\n10 strawberries, cored and quartered\n1/4 cup slivered almonds, toasted\n2-3 green onions, thinly sliced\n2 tablespoons thinly sliced fresh mint\n2 cups of baby arugula greens\nVinaigrette ingredients:\n1 Tbsp orange zest\n3 tablespoons orange juice\n1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar\nPinch of salt\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the quinoa: Cook the quinoa according to the package instructions. Remove from heat, let sit for 5 minutes covered, then fluff with a fork.)\n2 Make vinaigrette: Place the vinaigrette ingredients into a jar and shake to emulsify.\n3 Cool the quinoa: When the quinoa is cooked, spread it out on a baking sheet to cool quickly.\n4 Toss quinoa with vinaigrette, add remaining ingredients: When the quinoa has cooled, place into a large bowl and toss with the vinaigrette. Then toss with the strawberries, almonds, green onions, mint, and arugula.\nServe immediately. b'Print\nToasted Turkey Cranberry Arugula Sandwich Recipe\nINGREDIENTS\n2 slices French or Italian loaf bread, lightly toasted\n1 1/2 teaspoons mayonnaise\n1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard\nSeveral slices of cooked turkey breast\n2 tablespoons prepared cranberry sauce or cranberry relish\n1 handful of baby arugula leaves or watercress\nMETHOD\nToast 2 slices of bread.\nSpread mustard on one slice, mayo on the other.\nTo the slice with mustard, add the turkey breast, then the cranberry sauce, then the arugula leaves.\nTop with the other slice of bread.\nCut in half.\nHello! b'Save It Print\nArugula, Mozzarella, Tomato on Focaccia Recipe\nYield: Makes 4 sandwiches\nINGREDIENTS\n3 large ripe tomatoes, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices\n1 red onion, thinly sliced\n3 tablespoons red-wine vinegar\nFreshly ground black pepper\n3 cups packed trimmed arugula, coarsely chopped\nFocaccia bread, halved horizontally (enough for 4 sandwiches)\n1/2 pound mozzarella, sliced thin (fresh is best)\n1 Tbsp mayonnaise (optional)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 In a large bowl or baking dish combine tomatoes, onion, and vinegar and season with pepper and salt. Marinate 30 minutes.\n2 Layer mozzarella, tomatoes, onions and arugula on the focaccia half. Spread some mayonnaise on the top half of the focaccia if desired.
