b'Save It Print\nEasy Breakfast Casserole with Prosciutto Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: 6 to 8\nYou can make and bake this savory strata all in one fell swoop, or assemble and refrigerate it the night before (but leave the cheese off until morning). Pull it out of the fridge 30 minutes before baking; add the cheese, and pop it into the oven.\nIf you have vegetarians at your table, feel free to skip the prosciutto and add one teaspoon of smoked paprika instead.\nThe strata holds up well as a leftover, so enjoy it for breakfast the next day, or pack up a slice for your desk lunch.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil\n1 medium yellow onion, chopped\n2 big handfuls tender greens, such as arugula, dandelion greens, baby kale, or spinach (tough stems removed)\n1 1/2 cups asparagus, cut into 3/4-inch pieces\n1 teaspoon kosher salt, divided\n3 ounces thinly sliced prosciutto\n2 packed cups cubed crusty bread, such as levain, baguette, or Italian bread (slightly stale is ok)\n8 large eggs\n1 cup low fat cottage cheese\n1 cup 2% milk (or whatever kind you have in the fridge)\nFreshly ground black pepper\n1 1/2 cups (3 oz) grated cheddar, divided\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 the vegetables: Add oil to a 12-inch ovenproof skillet set over medium heat. I use cast iron, but any ovenproof skillet will do.\nAdd the onion and saut\xc3\xa9 until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the greens, asparagus, and 1/2 teaspoon salt and saut\xc3\xa9 until the greens wilt, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.\n3 Add the prosciutto and bread: Tear the prosciutto slices into smaller pieces and distribute over the vegetables. Add the bread and stir everything together. Leave that to cool while you whisk the eggs.\n4 Whisk the eggs: In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, cottage cheese, milk, the remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt, and several generous grinds of black pepper. Add 1/2 cup of the cheese and stir again. Pour the eggs over the vegetables and scatter the remaining cheese on top.\n5 Bake the casserole: Place the casserole in the oven and bake until it is just set with no obvious liquid remaining, about 35 minutes. It should be a little jiggly. Keep in mind that it will continue to cook a bit once it\xe2\x80\x99s out of the oven.\n6 Serve: Cool for 10 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nRadicchio Salad with Citrus Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 4-6 servings\nFor this recipe, any variety of citrus will work\xe2\x80\x94you just need about two cups total of whatever you have on hand. It\xe2\x80\x99s best to supreme the citrus, which means to trim the peel off the citrus, then cut the individual segments of fruit from the inner membrane.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 slices (about 2 cups) sourdough bread, torn into bite-sized pieces\n1/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided\n3/4 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\n1/2 cup chopped walnuts\n2 citrus fruits, like orange, lemon, and/or grapefruit\n1 small head radicchio (about 4 cups), cored and cut into bite-sized pieces\n2 cups arugula\n1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Make the croutons: Heat the oven to 350\xcb\x9aF. Place the bread pieces on a rimmed baking sheet and toss with 1/4 cup olive oil. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt and bake, tossing the bread on the baking sheet partway through, until golden and crunchy, about 15 minutes; let cool.\n2 Toast the nuts: While the croutons are in the oven, toast the nuts in a medium-sized skillet set over medium heat on the stovetop until fragrant and toasted, about 8-10 minutes. Stay near the pan, and stir the nuts occasionally. They can go from toasted to burnt in a matter of seconds. Let cool.\n3 Peel and segment (a.k.a. supreme) the citrus : For each fruit, cut about an inch off the top and bottom just so some of the flesh is exposed. Set the fruit with the cut-side down on a cutting board.\nStart at the top, and slice down the side of the fruit with a sharp knife, cutting away the peel and the pith, exposing the flesh. Then carefully cut out the citrus segments over a bowl to collect the juice. You should have about 1 cup of citrus segments.\n4 Squeeze the juice: Once all of the segments have been removed, squeeze the juice from what's left of the fruit into the same bowl. Drain the juice from the segments and keep separate.\n5 Make the citrus vinaigrette: In a mason jar or small bowl, combine 3 tablespoons of the reserved citrus juice with the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil. Add pepper and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Secure the lid if using a jar, and shake vigorously for a few seconds until emulsified. If using a bowl, whisk the ingredients together.\n6 Assemble the salad: Add the radicchio and arugula to a large bowl. Drizzle with the vinaigrette and toss until evenly coated. Taste and season with additional salt and pepper to suit your preferences. Add the croutons, walnuts, citrus segments, and feta cheese, and toss until evenly combined.\n7 To serve: Transfer to a large serving bowl for family-style eating, or divide among individual bowls for serving.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nMozzarella Grilled Cheese Sandwich Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 4 sandwiches\nINGREDIENTS\n8 slices sourdough bread\nButter, soft and at room temperature\nDijon mustard, to taste\nMayonnaise, to taste\nSalt\nPepper\n18 ounces jarred roasted peppers (oil- or water-packed), patted dry of excess moisture\n12 ounces low-moisture mozzarella, cut into 1/4-inch slices (or shredded, if that\xe2\x80\x99s how you roll)\n2 cups arugula\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare the sandwiches: Butter one side of each slice of bread. On the unbuttered sides, spread Dijon mustard, mayonnaise, and a sprinkling of salt and pepper. Place two slices of bread (or as many as you can fit), buttered side down, in a skillet over medium-low heat.\nAdd about 4 ounces of the peppers, 3 ounces of mozzarella, and a good handful of arugula. Press down to keep slightly together, then place slices of bread on top, buttered side out.\n2 Grill that cheese: Let the sandwiches cook over medium-low heat for about 3 to 4 minutes per side, flipping halfway through, making sure they don\xe2\x80\x99t get too browned. After about 6 to 8 minutes total, the cheese in the sandwich should be well melted and the bread toasted. Repeat with remaining sandwiches.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nArugula Salad with Beets and Goat Cheese Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCooking the Beets time: 1 hourYield: Makes enough for 2 salads\nThe amount of ingredients shown is just a guideline for two servings. The actual amounts depend on how much salad per serving you want.\nINGREDIENTS\nSalad Ingredients:\n2 medium beets, cooked (roasted* or boiled**) until a fork easily goes in one (about an hour), peeled, diced into bite-sized pieces\n2 handfuls (about 2.5 ounces) fresh baby arugula\n4 Tbsp goat cheese (about 1.5 ounces)\n1/4 cup roughly chopped toasted walnuts\nDressing ingredients:\n3 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil\n1 1/2 Tbsp lemon juice\n1/4 teaspoon dry powdered mustard\n1/2 teaspoon sugar\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 teaspoon pepper\n* To roast beets, scrub raw beets clean, coat with a little olive oil, wrap in aluminum foil, and roast in 400\xc2\xb0F oven for 1 to 2 hours, until fork tender\n** To boil beets, scrub raw beets clean, put in small pot, cover with water, bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook for 45 min to an hour, until fork tender\nMETHOD\n1 Make the vinaigrette: Place dressing ingredients in a jar and shake to emulsify. Adjust ingredients to taste.\n2 Assemble the salad according to how much you want. Compose each dish with a handful of arugula leaves, a few cooked chopped beets, some crumbled goat cheese, and some chopped toasted walnuts.\n3 Drizzle the salad with vinaigrette. (You may have a little extra vinaigrette.)\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nOrange and Beet Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 45 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 bunch of beets, leaves removed (save them for beet greens!) - about 4 or 5 medium sized, scrubbed clean\n2 large navel oranges, peels cut off with a small small knife and sliced\n1 bunch of arugula leaves, cleaned, and any thick stems removed\nSeveral thin slices of red onion\noptional 1/4 cup chopped walnuts\nVinaigrette Dressing:\n3 Tbsp white wine vinegar\n1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil\n1/4 teaspoon dried mustard\nSalt and pepper to taste\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the beets: You can either boil or roast the beets. To boil the beets, cover the unpeeled beets with water, bring to a boil, and simmer for 30 minutes or until beets can easily be pierced through with a fork.\nIf you prefer to roast the beets instead of boiling them, wrap the unpeeled beets in aluminum foil and bake them in the oven at 400\xc2\xb0F for an hour or until done. (See our Roasted Beets recipe.)\nAfter cooking, allow the beets to come to room temperature and remove their peels. Slice or quarter them.\nIf you have time, place them in a small bowl and marinate them in half of the oil and vinegar dressing.\n2 Make the dressing: While the beets are cooking, make the dressing by putting all of the dressing ingredients into a jar. Seal and shake until the dressing is well blended.\n3 Compose the salad: Compose individual salad plates with arugula, a few slices of orange, a few beets, a few slices of red onion and a few chopped walnuts.\nIf you want some added color, gently add a few slices of the orange to the beet juice from your bowl of beets. Let the oranges absorb the beet color and use in your salad.\nSprinkle dressing over the individual salads.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nEasy Steak Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 4\nNo need to bring the steak to room temp before cooking. You sear on such high heat, and the steaks are so thin, it's actually better to cook the steak while it is still relatively chilled, if you want the centers to be rare.\nINGREDIENTS\nExtra virgin olive oil\n1 pound flank steak or skirt steak\nSalt and freshly ground pepper\n1/2 head lettuce greens\n1 bunch arugula (young leaves), tough stems removed\n1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced lengthwise and cut into 1-inch long pieces\n4 scallions, thinly sliced\n1 avocado, cut into bite-sized pieces\n4 ounces goat cheese, crumbled\nPomegranate seeds or thinly sliced kumquats (optional)\nFor the dressing:\n2 tablespoons lemon juice\n6 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1 teaspoon Dijon mustard (smooth), or 1/2 teaspoon dry mustard\nSalt and pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Cook the steak: Heat a couple teaspoons of oil in a cast iron pan on high heat. Pat the steaks dry. Sprinkle the steaks on both sides with a little salt.\nSear the steaks in the pan on both sides, just until nicely browned. Remove pan from heat and cover. Let cook for a few minutes more, until the steak is done to your liking.\nYou can test with a meat thermometer. Remove steak from pan at 125\xc2\xb0F to 130\xc2\xb0F for rare, 140\xc2\xb0F for medium rare, 150\xc2\xb0 for medium. Or use your fingers to test the meat for doneness (see The Finger Test to Check the Doneness of Meat).\n2 Let the steak rest before cutting, then cut thin slices: Remove from pan to a cutting board. Let rest for a few minutes before cutting. Cut thin slices, on a diagonal so you slice wide pieces, across the grain of the meat.\n3 Make the salads: Toss together the lettuce greens, arugula, bell pepper, goat cheese, and scallions. Arrange on individual plates. Sprinkle with avocado. Lay on top several slices of chilled sliced steak. Sprinkle with pomegranate seeds or sliced kumquats if using.\n4 Make dressing: Mix together the lemon juice, olive oil, mustard, and salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle on salad.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nGolden Beet and Pomegranate Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nIf you want to boil the beets instead of roasting them, put the beets in a small saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 45 minutes or until tender.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 golden beets (about 1 pound)\n1 cup diced red onion\n1/4 cup red wine vinegar\n1/4 cup water\n1/4 cup orange juice ( can sub with 3 Tbsp Triple Sec)\n1 tablespoon sugar\n1 teaspoon orange zest\n1 cup pomegranate seeds\n1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil for the salad, plus 1/2 teaspoon more for roasting the beets\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/8 teaspoon black or white pepper\n2 cups arugula and/or butter lettuce leaves\n1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese\nMETHOD\n1 Roast the beets: Rub the beets with a little olive oil, wrap them together in foil, place them in a roasting pan, and roast them at 400\xc2\xb0F for an hour or until tender when poked with the tines of a fork.\nRemove from oven. Remove the peels from the beets. Dice the beets into bite-sized pieces.\n2 Make the glaze: Put the diced cooked beets, onions, vinegar, water, orange juice, orange zest, sugar, salt, and pepper, in a skillet on high heat.\nHeat the mixture to a boil, and continue to boil, stirring often, until the liquid is reduced to a glaze, about 2 tablespoons (5 minutes or so). Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature.\n3 Assemble the salad: Stir pomegranate seeds and olive oil into the beet mixture and add more salt and pepper to taste.\nServe on top of salad greens and sprinkle with feta cheese.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nQuinoa, Arugula, and Feta Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 cup (165 g) red quinoa\nScant 1 cup water (1 cup minus 1 tablespoon)\n1/4 teaspoon salt\n3 tablespoons olive oil\n5 ounces (8 loosely packed cups, 165 g) baby arugula\n2 tablespoons (30 ml) lemon juice, or more to taste\n8 ounces (110 g) firm feta, cut into 1/2-inch cubes\n1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper\nMETHOD\n1 Toast the quinoa: In a dry sauce pan over low heat, toast the quinoa, shaking the pan often, for 5 minutes, or until some of the grains start to turn a darker color.\n2 Cook the quinoa: Add the water and salt to the pan with the quinoa. Turn the heat to high and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cover the pan. Simmer for 15 minutes, or until the quinoa is tender when tasted and all the water is absorbed. If there\xe2\x80\x99s water in the pan, let the quinoa cook 2 minutes more.\n3 Cool the quinoa: Tip the quinoa into a large bowl and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Stir well and leave to cool, stirring occasionally. (Once cooled, the quinoa can be refrigerated for a few days before using.)\n4 Dress the arugula: In another bowl, toss the arugula with the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons of the lemon juice, and pepper.\n5 Toss the salad: Add the cooled quinoa and feta cubes to the bowl with the greens. Toss well and taste for seasoning. Add more salt or lemon juice, if you like. Serve immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'

Break or cut off the woody ends of the asparagus spears. b'Print\nGrilled Asparagus Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 7 minutesYield: Serves 4\nThick asparagus work best for grilling, get the chubbiest spears you can. Thin spears will dry out before they get a good char.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound asparagus (estimate 1/4 pound per person), thick spears\n1-2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\nKosher salt\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat your grill for high, direct heat.\n2 Prep asparagus, coat with olive oil, sprinkle with salt: Prepare the asparagus by breaking or cutting off any tough bottom ends (can save for stock, or discard).\nPlace the asparagus in a pan (to contain the spears while you put them on and take them off the grill).\nCoat them with olive oil and sprinkle salt over them.\n3 Grill on high, direct heat: Brush the grill grates lightly with olive oil. Place the asparagus spears on the grill so that the thickest ends are aimed toward the hottest part of the grill.\nAlternatively, you can use a grill pan, heat on high.\nGrill the asparagus spears for 2-4 minutes, until lightly charred and just fork tender, turning them often so that they brown on all sides.\nRemove from grill and serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nRoasted Asparagus Recipe\nPrep time: 6 minutesCook time: 12 minutesYield: Serves 4\nFor best results for roasting asparagus, use thick asparagus spears, not skinny ones. The thin ones will dry out too quickly and will end up tough and stringy.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound asparagus spears (thick spears are best for roasting)\n1-2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 cloves garlic, minced\nKosher Salt\nFreshly grated black pepper\nLemon juice (or balsamic vinegar)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven and prep asparagus: Preheat your oven to 400\xc2\xb0F (205\xc2\xb0C). Rinse the asparagus spears. If the ends are tough, break them off and either discard or save for stock. You can also use a vegetable peeler to peel away the tough outer skin of the fatter ends of the asparagus if you want.\n2 Drizzle asparagus with olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic: Line a roasting pan with foil. Arrange the asparagus spears in a single layer on the lined roasting pan.\nDrizzle with olive oil and rub the spears all over with the olive oil to coat. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and minced garlic, and rub over the asparagus spears to evenly distribute.\n3 Roast in oven: Roast at 400\xc2\xb0F (205\xc2\xb0C) for 10 minutes, more or less, depending on your particular oven and how thick the spears are, until the asparagus are just lightly browned and tender when you pierce them with a fork.\n4 Drizzle with lemon juice or balsamic to serve: To serve, drizzle with fresh lemon juice or balsamic vinegar, and if you want, a sprinkling of grated Parmesan cheese (skip if cooking vegan).\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nProsciutto-Wrapped Asparagus Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: 4 to 6 servings\nProsciutto is naturally salty, so you shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t need to add any more salt to the asparagus.\nIf you want to make a bigger batch, just double up the ingredients in the recipe and use 2 large baking sheets for roasting.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound asparagus, preferably thick spears\n3 to 3 1/2 ounces sliced prosciutto\n1 to 2 tablespoons olive oil\nGround black pepper\nLemon zest, optional\nFreshly grated Parmesan cheese, optional\nMETHOD\n1 Heat the oven to 400F. Line a large sheet pan with parchment paper and set aside.\n2 Prepare the asparagus: Rinse and pat dry the asparagus. Snap off the tough ends of the asparagus. Set asparagus spears aside. (Reserve the snapped ends for another meal, if you like.)\n3 Wrap the asparagus with prosciutto: Cut prosciutto slices in half down their length. Wrap each spear of asparagus with one strip of sliced prosciutto. Tug the prosciutto a little as you wrap it around the asparagus to give it tension. This helps to ensure that the prosciutto wraps around the asparagus tightly.\nLay the wrapped asparagus spears on the lined sheet pan.\n4 Drizzle the asparagus with 1 to 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Sprinkle a pinch of black pepper on top.\n5 Bake the asparagus for 8 to 10 minutes. When done, the asparagus will be bright green and easily pierced with a fork, and the prosciutto will be crisped around the edges.\n6 Serve the asparagus. Transfer the asparagus to a serving platter. Top with lemon zest and freshly grated parmesan cheese, if using. Serve immediately while hot.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nThe Best Way to Boil Asparagus\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 5 minutesYield: Serves 2 to 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 pound asparagus (or up to a pound), thin, medium, or large\n1/4 teaspoon of salt\n1 garlic clove, cut in half (optional)\n1 strip of lemon peel (optional)\nMETHOD\n1 Prep the asparagus: Snap or cut off any woody bottoms of the asparagus spears. If working with medium sized or large asparagus, if you want (for a fancy presentation) you can use a vegetable peeler to peel the outside of the lower inch or two of the asparagus.\n2 Heat water in a large skillet: Fill a large, wide skillet with about 3/4-inch of water. Add salt. Add the cut garlic and lemon peel if using. Bring the water to a boil on high heat.\n3 Boil the asparagus: Add the asparagus in an even layer. If the water doesn't cover the asparagus, cover the pan. If using thin asparagus, cook only for 1 to 2 minutes. Medium asparagus, 5 minutes. Large asparagus 6 to 7 minutes.\n4 Rinse with cool water: Rinse briefly with cold water to stop the cooking and then transfer to a serving dish.\nSprinkle with salt and pepper, lemon juice and extra virgin olive oil or butter to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nAsparagus Frittata Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 20 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n2 tablespoons unsalted butter\n1/2 cup sliced shallots\n1 pound thin spear asparagus, tough ends snapped off, spears cut diagonally into 1-inch lengths\n6 large eggs\n3/4 cup ricotta cheese (can sub cottage cheese)\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1 Tbsp minced fresh chives\n1/4 teaspoon dried tarragon\n1 cup shredded Gruyere or Swiss cheese (can sub an Italian blend)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cook shallots in butter: Heat butter into a 10-inch oven-proof frying pan over medium heat.\nAdd shallots and cook, stirring occasionally, until they soften and turn translucent, about 3 minutes.\n2 Add asparagus and cook for an additional 3 minutes.\n3 Add egg mixture: Beat the eggs, ricotta cheese together, and salt, stir in the chives and tarragon.\nPour the egg mixture into the pan and cook until almost set, but still runny on top, about 4 to 5 minutes. While cooking, pre-heat oven broiler.\n4 Top with cheese and broil: Sprinkle Gruyere cheese over the eggs and put in oven to broil until cheese is melted and browned, and the center is set, about 6 to 8 minutes.\nRemove pan from oven with oven mitts and slide frittata onto a serving plate. Cut into wedges. (Be very careful with the hot pan handle! I usually ice down the handle of any long handled pan I take out of the oven so that no one mistakenly tries to pick up the pan by the hot handle.)\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nFlank Steak Stir Fry with Asparagus and Red Pepper Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 25 minutesYield: Serves 4\nIf you are planning to serve this dish with rice, in a separate pan, prepare 2 cups of white rice, following the instructions on the rice package.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 Tbsp canola or peanut oil\n1/2 lb asparagus, trimmed, cut on the diagonal into 1 1/2 inch lengths (about 1 1/2 cups)\n1 lb of flank steak, sliced in half lengthwise (along the grain) and then cut into thin strips (across the grain), 2 inches long and 1/4 inch wide (put the steak in the freezer for 15 minutes before slicing to make it easier to slice)\n1 red bell pepper, seeded, de-ribbed, and cut into thin strips 2 inches long and 1/4 inch wide\n2 teaspoons of cornstarch dissolved into 3 Tablespoons of water\nStir Fry Sauce\n3 Tbsp soy sauce (use gluten-free soy sauce for gluten-free version)\n1 teaspoon finely chopped, peeled, fresh ginger\n1 small clove garlic, minced\n1 green onion, including green tops, chopped\n1/2 teaspoon chili oil\nMETHOD\n1 Blanch the asparagus: Fill a medium sized saucepan halfway with water and bring to a boil. Blanch the cut asparagus for 2 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water to stop the cooking, and set aside.\n2 Assemble stir fry sauce: In a small dish, stir together the stir fry sauce ingredients\xe2\x80\x94soy sauce, chopped ginger, minced garlic, chopped green onion, chili oil\xe2\x80\x94and set aside.\n3 Stir fry asparagus: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a wok (or a thick-bottomed pot that can handle high heat) on high heat until shimmery. Add the asparagus and fry, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove the asparagus from the pan and set aside.\n4 Stir fry beef strips: Heat another tablespoon of oil in the pan on high heat until shimmery. Stir fry the beef strips in batches, for 2 to 3 minutes per batch, until they are browned but still a little pink inside.\n5 Stir fry bell pepper: Return the first batches of beef strips to the pan along with the bell pepper strips. Stir and toss over high heat until the bell pepper strips are just beginning to wilt, 1-2 minutes.\n6 Add cornstarch slurry and stir fry sauce: Quickly stir the cornstarch liquid and add it to the pan along with the stir fry sauce. Cook until sauce thickens, 1-2 minutes.\nReturn the asparagus to the pan, toss to evenly coat and serve with steamed white rice (unless you are going low-carb, in which case, leave out the rice).\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nAsparagus Risotto Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 35 minutesYield: Serves 2-3 as a main course, or 4 as a side\nIf you want to make this a vegetarian dish, use vegetable stock or water instead of the chicken stock.\nINGREDIENTS\nAbout 4 cups chicken stock (or vegetable stock for vegetarian option)\n2 Tbsp unsalted butter, divided\n1/2 cup chopped shallots\n1 cup arborio rice\n1/4 cup dry white wine (or 1 Tbsp lemon juice and 3 Tbsp water)\n1/2 pound asparagus, trimmed, tips cut off, tough skins of the spears peeled (if working with thick apparatus spears), and the spears cut into thin disks\n1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese\nSalt and pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Heat the stock: Heat the stock in a small saucepan until it comes to a low simmer.\n2 Cook shallots in butter to soften, then add rice: In a separate 3 or 4 quart saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon butter on medium heat. Add the shallots and cook for a minute or two, until translucent. Add the arborio rice and cook for 2 minutes more, stirring until nicely coated.\n3 Add the white wine: Add the white wine. Slowly stir, allowing the rice to absorb the wine.\n4 Add the stock, 1/2 cup at a time, adding only after the previous addition has been absorbed by the rice: Once the wine is almost completely absorbed, add 1/2 cup of hot stock to the rice. Continue to stir until the liquid is almost completely absorbed, adding more stock in 1/2 cup increments. Stir often to prevent the rice from sticking to the bottom of the pan.\nContinue cooking and stirring rice, adding a little bit of broth at a time, cooking and stirring until it is absorbed, until the rice is tender, but still firm to the bite, about 20-25 minutes.\n5 Add the asparagus: With the last ladle of stock, add the asparagus. Stir and cook for a couple of minutes, until the risotto has absorbed the stock, but is still loose, and the asparagus are just cooked through.\nNote the stock amount given is approximate. You may need a little more or less. If you end up needing more stock and you find yourself without, just use water.\n6 Stir in the Parmesan, remaining butter, add salt, pepper: Turn off the heat. Gently stir in the Parmesan cheese and the remaining 1 tablespoon butter. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nOven-Roasted Salmon, Asparagus and New Potatoes Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 32 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound (450 g) small new potatoes, scrubbed clean and halved\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/2 pound (225 g) medium asparagus, trimmed and sliced on the diagonal, 1-inch long pieces\n1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill\n1 strip of lemon zest\n1 small garlic clove, coarsely chopped\nFreshly ground pepper\n1 1/2 pounds (680 g) of salmon fillets or salmon steaks cut about 1-inch thick\n1 lemon, cut into large wedges\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Roast the potatoes: Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F (205\xc2\xb0C). In a sheet pan, or a large, shallow roasting pan (not glass, as it might break in an oven that hot) toss the potatoes with olive oil and sprinkle all over with salt.\nPlace the potatoes cut side down in the roasting pan and cook for 10-12 minutes, until the potatoes begin to brown on the bottom.\nTurn the potatoes over and roast another 10 minutes until browned on top. Remove the roasting pan from the oven.\n2 Toss asparagus with dill, zest, garlic, salt, olive oil, and mix with potatoes: In a medium bowl, toss the asparagus with the chopped dill, lemon zest, garlic, about 1/2 teaspoon of salt and a little olive oil. Add the asparagus mixture to the potatoes and stir to combine.\n3 Make room for salmon fillets in the pan, and roast: Push the vegetables to the side of the dish to make room for the salmon. If you are using fillets, put them skin side down. Salt the salmon well and return the baking dish to the oven.\nRoast the salmon and asparagus for 10 minutes, or until the fish is just cooked through.\nIf you want, remove the skin and center bones (if you are using steaks), and arrange on individual plates before serving. Garnish with fresh dill and lemon wedges.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b"Save It Print\nCreamy Asparagus Soup Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 4-6\nWant more vibrant green in the soup? Stir in a handful of chopped baby spinach in step 5 with the parsley.\nMake sure to use heavy cream or full-fat sour cream, or the soup may curdle. Cooking light? Skip the cream all together.\nThe vermouth really makes this soup shine. If you don't have any, try adding a 1/4 cup of white wine to the pot after you saut\xc3\xa9 the onions and garlic. Let it bubble up and reduce by half before adding the asparagus. Otherwise skip.\nINGREDIENTS\n2 lbs asparagus, trimmed of woody stem bottoms\n1 large yellow onion, chopped (1 1/2 to 2 cups chopped)\n1 teaspoon minced garlic, or 1 Tbsp minced green garlic\n3 Tbsp butter\n4 cups chicken broth or vegetable broth (vegetarian option)\n1 cup water\n2 sprigs of fresh thyme\n1 bay leaf\n1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley\n1/4 cup heavy cream or full-fat sour cream\n1 Tbsp dry vermouth\n1 teaspoon lemon juice\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper (more to taste)\n1 teaspoon salt (more to taste)\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Cut asparagus tips and reserve, cut the rest of asparagus into 1/4-inch rounds: Cut tips from the asparagus 1 1/2 inches from top and reserve. Chop the rest of the asparagus stalks into 1/4-inch rounds.\n2 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions, garlic: Melt the butter in a 4 to 5 quart pot on medium heat. Add the onions and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.\nAdd the garlic (or green garlic) and cook a minute more.\n3 Add asparagus: Add the chopped asparagus (not the spear tips) to the onions. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Cook another 5 minutes.\n4 Add the broth, water, thyme sprigs and bay leaf to the pot. Increase the heat to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Simmer, covered, until the asparagus are tender, about 10 minutes.\n5 At the end of cooking, stir in the chopped parsley.\n6 Blanch asparagus tips: While the soup is cooking, blanche the asparagus tips in a small pot of boiling, salted water, until the tips are just tender, about 2-4 minutes, depending on the size of the asparagus.\nDrain. Rinse with cool water to stop the cooking. Set aside.\n7 Pur\xc3\xa9e the soup: Remove bay leaf and thyme sprigs. Use either an immersion blender or an upright blender (working in batches) to pur\xc3\xa9e the soup. If you use an upright blender, work in small batches, fill no more than a third the blender bowl at a time, and hold down the lid while blending.\nFor a creamy texture, if you want, press the pur\xc3\xa9ed soup through a sieve or food mill.\n8 Stir in cream, vermouth, lemon juice: Stir in the cream (or full-fat sour cream). Stir in the vermouth and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.\nGarnish with asparagus tips.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nHam and Asparagus Quiche Recipe\nPrep time: 1 hour, 30 minutesCook time: 30 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\n1 recipe pie dough, enough for one bottom crust (see P\xc3\xa2te Bris\xc3\xa9e recipe)\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n2 medium shallots, thinly sliced\n10 ounces asparagus spears, cut on the diagonal into 1-inch long pieces\n1/2 pound ham, cut into 1/4-inch cubes\nFreshly ground pepper\n1/2 cup milk\n1/2 cup heavy cream\n3 large eggs\n6 ounces Gruy\xc3\xa8re cheese, grated (1 1/2 cups)\nSpecial equipment:\n10-inch tart pan\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Roll out dough and fit into tart pan, then freeze: On a lightly floured surface, roll out dough into a 12-inch circle. Fit into a 10-by-1 1/2-inch round tart pan (with or without a removable bottom), pressing dough into corners. Transfer to freezer to chill for 30 minutes.\n2 Pre-bake tart crust: Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Line pastry with aluminum foil, pressing into the corners and edges. Fill to the top with baking weights \xe2\x80\x94 sugar, dried beans, or rice.\nBake for 45 minutes. Lift sides of aluminum foil to remove pie weights from tart pan. Move pre-baked crust to a wire rack to cool while making filling. (See How to Blind Bake a Pie Crust for more details on this step.)\n3 Cook shallots and asparagus: Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add shallots, and cook, stirring, until translucent but not brown, about 1 minute.\nAdd asparagus. Cook, stirring frequently, until asparagus are just cooked (al dente), slightly browned, firm, not mushy, 8 to 10 minutes.\n4 Assemble quiche: Increase oven temperature to 375\xc2\xb0F. Place tart pan on a baking sheet to catch any run-off there might be (especially if you are using a pan with a removable bottom.)\nSprinkle half the cheese evenly over the bottom of the crust. Spread asparagus and ham over the cheese and then top with remaining cheese.\nIn a medium bowl, whisk together milk, cream, and eggs. Season with fresh ground pepper. Pour over cheese.\n5 Bake: Transfer to oven, and bake at 375\xc2\xb0F until just set in the center, 30 to 35 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for about 10 minutes before slicing.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nHow to Cook Asparagus Sous Vide Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: 4 servings\nINGREDIENTS\n1 bunch asparagus, about 1 pound\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper\n2 tablespoons olive oil or unsalted butter\nZest and juice of one lemon\nSea salt for garnish\nSpecial equipment:\nSous vide immersion circulator\nGallon-sized zip-top freezer bags\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Heat the water: Fill a pot with water and place your immersion circulator inside. Set your immersion circulator to 180\xc2\xb0F and let the water come up to temperature.\n2 Prep the asparagus: Wash the asparagus and, like a bunch of flowers, make a fresh cut on the bottom, eliminating any of the tough, woody ends.\nAdd the asparagus to a zip-top, gallon-sized plastic freezer bag. Add the black pepper and olive oil; save the salt for after it\xe2\x80\x99s cooked, as the salt will turn this green veggie a little grey. Toss together in the bag to distribute the ingredients.\nAdd a few heavy soup spoons to the bag to help weigh it down. This will help keep the asparagus submerged, which will ensure that it cooks evenly.\n  3 Seal the bag: Seal the bag as tightly as possible by using water-displacement method to help press out all the air. Just put the food in the bag and slowly lower it into the water, letting the pressure of the water press the air through the top of the bag. Once the air is out of the bag, seal it just above the water line. (Read more here.)\nYou can do this in the pot of water as it heats\xe2\x80\x94just be careful if the water is already steaming!\n4 Cook the asparagus: Once the water has come up to temperature, submerge the bag of asparagus in the pot of water. Make sure the bag is completely submerged (if it floats, remove it from the water and add a few more spoons to weigh it down).\n* Check the asparagus after 6 to 7 minutes if it\xe2\x80\x99s pencil thin.\n* Check average or thick asparagus after 8 to 10 minutes.\nIf you\xe2\x80\x99re at all in doubt, pull them out after 8 minutes, open the bag carefully, and use a fork to determine how tender the spears are. If the fork is getting stuck in the asparagus, it\xe2\x80\x99s not ready; reseal the bag and return it to the water for another minute or two.\n5 Serve: Remove from the water, turn off the circulator and serve immediately. Sprinkle some lemon juice and zest over the top of the asparagus, along with some of the cooking oil or butter (if desired) and some flaky sea salt, such as Maldon.\nLeftover asparagus will keep refrigerated for about 5 days.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nSteamed Asparagus with Hollandaise Sauce Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 bunch of asparagus (about 1 lb)\n10 Tbsp unsalted butter (1 stick plus 2 Tbsp)\n3 egg yolks\n1 Tbsp lemon juice\n1/2 teaspoon salt (skip if using salted butter)\nPinch of cayenne\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the asparagus: Break off the tough ends with your fingers. Bend the asparagus spears near the end and they will break naturally where the spear is no longer tough.\nFor an elegant presentation of the spears, use a vegetable peeler to peel off a very thin layer of the outer skin of the lower two to three inches of the asparagus spears.\nPrepare a large, shallow pan (with a cover) with a half inch of water and a steamer rack.\n2 Prepare the Hollandaise sauce: Melt the butter in a small pot. Put the egg yolks, lemon juice, salt and cayenne into a blender.\nBlend the eggs for 20-30 seconds at medium to medium high speed until lighter in color.\nTurn blender down to lowest setting and slowly drizzle in the hot melted butter while the blender is going. Continue to blend for a few seconds after all of the butter is incorporated.\nTaste the sauce and add more salt or lemon juice if needed. Keep warm while you are steaming the asparagus.\n3 Steam the asparagus: Bring the water in your steaming pan to a boil. Place the asparagus on the steaming rack. Cover.\nSteam for 3 to 5 minutes, until tender, but still a little crisp, definitely not mushy. The timing depends on how thick the asparagus spears are.\n4 Serve: To serve, plate the asparagus. Pour Hollandaise sauce over them.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Print\nAsparagus Artichoke Breakfast Casserole Recipe\nPrep time: 25 minutesCook time: 40 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nINGREDIENTS\n6 cups of 1 to 1 1/2-inch cubed rustic bread (about half a loaf), or 6 slices of bread\n2 ounces bacon (2 to 3 thick-cut slices), roughly chopped\n1 medium onion, chopped (about 1 1/2 cups)\n1 pound of asparagus, trimmed of tough bottoms, spears sliced on the diagonal, in 1-inch long pieces\n1 15-ounce can of artichoke hearts (packed in water), drained, chopped\n2 Tbsp minced chives or green onion greens\n6 eggs\n2 cups milk\n8 ounces cheddar cheese, grated\n1 1/2 teaspoons salt\n1/4 teaspoon black pepper\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Dry cubed bread in oven: Place cubed bread on a baking sheet, put in a 200\xc2\xb0F for 10 to 15 minutes, until somewhat dry. OR you can use stale bread that is no longer soft. Drying the bread in the oven will help keep it from falling apart when you add the egg mixture later.\n2 Cook the chopped bacon: Place bacon in medium skillet on medium high heat. Cook until bacon is lightly browned and much of the fat rendered. Remove bacon from pan with a slotted spoon, place on a paper towel lined plate to drain. Pour off all but enough bacon fat to coat the bottom of the pan (do not put down the drain, it will clog your pipes).\n3 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions: Add chopped onions to the pan with bacon fat. Cook on medium high heat until lightly browned, about 5 to 6 minutes. Add the bacon back to the pan with the onions, stir, remove from heat.\n4 Blanch the asparagus: While the onions are cooking, bring a small pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the asparagus and blanch for 2 minutes. Drain and shock the asparagus in ice water to stop the cooking.\n5 Mix eggs, milk, cheese: In a large bowl, beat the eggs with a fork or whisk. Whisk in the milk. Stir in the 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Stir in the grated cheddar cheese.\n6 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F.\n7 Place bread in egg milk mixture, fold in bacon and vegetables: Place the cubed bread in the egg milk mixture and press down with your hands so that the bread cubes absorb most of the egg milk mixture. Gently fold in the onions, bacon, asparagus, chopped artichoke hearts, and chives. (Be gentle as to not break up the bread.)\n8 Assemble the casserole: Generously butter the inside of a 2 1/2 to 3 quart (8 x 13 inch) casserole dish. Gently pour the bread egg milk vegetable mixture into the casserole dish and spread out in an even layer.\nAt this point you can make up to a day ahead. Cover and refrigerate until ready to cook.\n9 Bake: Bake uncovered at 350\xc2\xb0F for 4o minutes. If the casserole starts to get too browned while cooking, cover with foil. Remove from oven and let rest for 5 minutes before serving.\n  Hello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nSkillet Shrimp and Asparagus Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 4\nINGREDIENTS\n1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil\n1 tablespoon butter\n1 medium onion, quartered, thinly sliced (about 1 1/2 cups)\n4 cloves garlic, minced (about 4 teaspoons)\n1/2 pound small red skinned new potatoes, cut into 1/4-inch slices or small dice\nSalt (to taste)\nPinch of black pepper\n1/2 cup water\n3/4 pound of asparagus, woody ends discarded, spears thinly sliced on the diagonal\n1 pound peeled and deveined shrimp (can leave tails on for presentation if you want), 16-20 count\n1 teaspoon lemon zest\n1 tablespoon lemon juice\n2 tablespoons minced chives or green onion greens\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Saut\xc3\xa9 onions and garlic:  Heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet on medium high heat. Add the sliced onions and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the garlic, cook a minute more.\n2 Add potatoes, water, cover and cook: Add the potatoes and 1/2 cup water. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and cook for 5 minutes, until the potatoes are almost cooked through.\n3 Add asparagus: Add the thinly sliced asparagus, toss with the potato mixture, cover and cook for one minute.\n4 Add the shrimp, lemon juice, lemon zest, chives: Add the shrimp, lemon juice, lemon zest, and chives. Toss and cover and cook until shrimp is just cooked through, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add more salt or pepper to taste.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. b"Save It Print\nSheet Pan Chicken with Asparagus and Potatoes Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 30 minutesYield: 4 servings\nIf you can't find the chicken parts called for in this recipe, you can buy a whole chicken and cut it into parts yourself (or ask a butcher to do it for you).\nIf you don't have fresh herbs, you can substitute dried thyme. Use 1/2 teaspoon of dried thyme with the vegetables and 1/2 teaspoon sprinkled over the chicken.\nINGREDIENTS\n16 small new potatoes (red or golden), halved\n3 small sweet onions (such as Vidalia or Walla Walla), quartered through the roots; or 1 large super sweet onion, cut into thin wedges\n1 medium lemon, very thinly sliced\nLarge handful fresh lemon thyme or other fresh herb (oregano, marjoram, or thyme).\n5 tablespoons olive oil\n1 teaspoon salt, or more to taste\n1/2 teaspoon black pepper, or more to taste\n2 large bone-in chicken breast halves (1 1/2 pounds, 680 g)\n2 whole chicken legs, thighs and drumsticks attached; or 2 legs and 2 drumsticks (1/2 pounds, 227 g)\n1 bunch (1 pound) fresh asparagus\nSpecial equipment:\nSheet pan, at least 11-by-17 inches or larger\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prepare the vegetables for roasting: Heat the oven to 375F. In a bowl, combine the new potatoes, onions, lemon, a few of the herb sprigs, 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, and half the salt and pepper. Toss well and spread on a rimmed baking sheet.\n2 Roast the vegetables for 40 minutes, or until the potatoes are almost tender when pierced with a skewer.\n3 Prepare the chicken: While the vegetables roast, sprinkle the chicken with 2 tablespoons of the remaining olive oil, and the remaining salt and pepper. Remove the leaves from several thyme springs and scatter them on the chicken.\n4 Add the chicken to the vegetables and roast: Move the vegetables in the pan aside to make room for the chicken. Set the chicken in the pan, skin side up, so it isn\xe2\x80\x99t sitting on vegetables. Continue cooking for 30 minutes.\n5 Prepare the asparagus: Snap the spears near the base, where they break without much effort. Cut the spears in half to make shorter lengths. In a bowl, toss the asparagus with the remaining 1 tablespoon oil.\n6 Add the asparagus and roast: After the chicken has been roasting for 30 minutes, pull out the sheet pan and scatter the asparagus around the chicken.\n7 Continue roasting for 10 to 20 minutes, or until the chicken pieces all register at least 165\xc2\xb0F in the thickest part of the meat on an instant-read thermometer (the thighs will cook slightly faster than the breasts; you can pull them off the sheet pan as they reach temperature and keep them on a plate covered with foil, if you like).\nAll of the vegetables should also be cooked through. (Total cooking time is roughly 1 1/2 hours.)\nIf your chicken isn\xe2\x80\x99t brown enough, slide the pan under the broiler for 2 minutes, watching it carefully to avoid burning.\n8 To serve the chicken: Discard the cooked thyme sprigs. Use kitchen shears to separate the legs to form 2 drumsticks and 2 thighs. Snip the breasts in half horizontally.\nArrange the chicken and vegetables on a platter. Remove the thyme from the remaining fresh sprigs and sprinkle it over the chicken.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBreakfast Casserole with Leeks and Asparagus Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 30 minutesYield: Serves 6 to 8\nPro tip: raw bacon is much easier to slice if it is frozen. So keep your bacon chilled until you are ready to cut it, or put it in the freezer for several minutes before slicing.\nINGREDIENTS\n3 slices thick-sliced bacon (about 3 ounces), cut into 1/2-inch pieces\n1 pound of asparagus, trimmed of woody ends, cut into 1/2-inch diagonal pieces\n6 slices of bread, cut into 1 1/2 inch wide square pieces, including crusts\n2 leeks, cleaned, cut in half lengthwise, sliced crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces, white and light green parts only, about 2 cups total\n2 Tbsp butter, divided 1 Tbsp and 1 Tbsp\n1/2 cup of crumbled feta cheese\n8 eggs\n2 cups milk\n1/2 teaspoon of dried herbes de provence (can sub dried tarragon or thyme)\n1 teaspoon kosher salt\n1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper\n1/4 cup of freshly grated Parmesan cheese\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Place bacon in a medium skillet on medium heat. Gently cook, turning occasionally, until the bacon pieces are lightly browned and much of the bacon fat has been rendered, about 10-12 minutes. Remove cooked bacon from the pan with a slotted spoon, leaving the rendered bacon fat in the pan.\n2 While the bacon is cooking, cut up the bread. If the bread is a little stale, great. If it is fresh, then spread it out on a baking sheet and heat it in a 200\xc2\xb0F oven for about 10-15 minutes to help it dry out a bit. This will help the keep the bread from disintegrating when mixed with the eggs later.\n3 Bring a small pot of water to a boil. Add the cut asparagus and blanch for 1 minute. Remove the asparagus from the pot to a bowl of ice water. Let cool in the ice water and then drain.\n4 Once the bacon is done and removed from the pan add a tablespoon of butter to the pan with the remaining bacon fat. Add the leeks and gently cook on medium to medium low heat for 10-12 minutes until the leeks are softened, but not browned. Do not let brown.\n5 In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, crumbled feta cheese, herbes de provence, salt, and pepper.\n6 Place the bread pieces into the egg milk mixture and press down so that the bread becomes completely saturated with the mixture. Add the asparagus and leeks and gently mix to combine, taking care to not break up the bread.\n7 Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. With the remaining tablespoon of butter, butter the insides of a 9x13-inch casserole dish. Sprinkle the bacon over the bottom of the dish. Gently pour the filling mixture into the casserole. Top with Parmesan cheese. Push the grated Parmesan down a bit into to the top of the casserole so that it gets moistened. (At this point you can make the night before, refrigerate and bake the next morning.)\n8 Bake, uncovered, for 45 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and the custard is cooked through. If the top is getting too brown before the custard is done, you can tent it with foil. Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes before cutting to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nBaked Asparagus with Parmesan Recipe\nPrep time: 10 minutesCook time: 10 minutesYield: Serves 2 to 4 as a side dish\nINGREDIENTS\n1 pound asparagus\n2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil\n1/2 teaspoon salt, less or more\n1/8 teaspoon black pepper, less or more taste\n1/2 cup loosely packed (about 1.5 ounces or 40g) shredded or grated parmesan cheese,  or to taste\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Prep the asparagus: Preheat oven to 400\xc2\xb0F (205\xc2\xb0C). Break or cut off the woody ends of the asparagus spears. For an added touch, if you want you can use a vegetable peeler to peel the skins off the base of the asparagus spears for a more elegant presentation.\n2 Toss with olive oil, salt, pepper, Parm: Arrange the asparagus spears on a foil-lined baking sheet and coat with the olive oil. Sprinkle with salt, pepper and the Parmesan.\n3 Bake: Bake at 400\xc2\xb0F until the cheese begins to brown, about 8-10 minutes.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected.
