b"Save It Print\nLemon Blueberry Ricotta Pound Cake Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 5 minutesYield: Serves 10 to 12\nTo quickly bring eggs to room temperature, place them in a bowl of warm water for a few minutes.\nMake sure your baking powder is fresh! Baking powder older than 6 months tends to go flat.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 3/4 cups (250 g) all purpose flour\n2 teaspoons baking powder\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature\n1 cup (8 ounces, 230 g) ricotta cheese, left to stand at room temperature for a few minutes to take the chill off\n1 1/2 cups sugar (300 g)\n3 large eggs, room temperature\n1 teaspoon vanilla extract\n1 tablespoon lemon zest\n1 1/2 cups (140 g) blueberries\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat oven to 325\xc2\xb0F (160\xc2\xb0C). Prepare a 9x5-inch loaf pan, smearing the inside with butter.\n2 Whisk the dry ingredients: In a medium bowl, vigorously whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt.\n2 Toss blueberries with flour: Rinse the blueberries and toss them with a little flour to lightly coat them (this will help keep them from sinking to the bottom of the cake).\n3 Mix wet ingredients and sugar for batter: Use an electric mixer (you can mix by hand but will get better results if you use an electric mixer) to beat together the butter, ricotta, and sugar, on high speed, for 3 minutes, until pale and fluffy.\nAdd the eggs one at a time, mixing on medium speed for one minute after each addition.\nMix in the lemon zest and vanilla extract. Don't worry if the batter looks a little curdled at this point. It isn't curdled; it just looks that way.\n4 Add dry ingredients, then blueberries: Remove the bowl from the mixer and stir in the dry ingredients in 3 or 4 additions, until just incorporated. Do not over mix. Stir in the blueberries.\n5 Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan, smoothing out the top with a rubber spatula. Place on a baking sheet on the middle oven rack of the oven. (This will help moderate the temperature at the bottom of the pan.)\n6 Bake: Bake at 325\xc2\xb0F (160\xc2\xb0C) for 1 hour 10 minutes to 1 hour 20 minutes, or until a tester inserted into the center comes out mostly clean, or if you press on the center with your fingers and lift up, the cake surface gently bounces back.\nAfter the first 40 minutes of baking you may want to put a sheet of aluminum foil over the top of the pan to keep it from browning further.\n7 Cool: Remove from oven and let cool for 15 minutes in the pan. Then run a dull knife around the edge of the cake to make sure it is separated from the pan.\nGently remove the cake from the pan and let cool completely on a wire rack. Let cook completely before slicing.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print"
b'Save It Print\nBerry and Banana Terrine Recipe\nPrep time: 20 minutesChilling time: 3 hoursYield: Serves 6-8\nINGREDIENTS\n2 envelopes (1/4 ounce each) unflavored gelatin\n2 cups white grape juice, divided\n1/2 cup white granulated sugar\n6 cups of mixed fresh berries and slices of banana (berries can include blueberries, raspberries, blackberries, and sliced or quartered strawberries)\nMETHOD\n1 Soften the gelatin: Put 1/4 cup of the white grape juice into a small bowl. Sprinkle the gelatin over the grape juice and let sit for 2 to 3 minutes while the gelatin softens.\n2 Make grape juice gelatin base: Put another 1/4 cup of the white grape juice and a 1/2 cup of sugar into a saucepan and heat on medium high heat until the sugar has dissolved.\nRemove from heat and stir in the gelatin mixture until it has dissolved. Stir in the remaining 1 1/2 cups of grape juice.\n3 Put fruit in loaf pan, cover with grape juice gelatin mixture: Put the berries and banana slices in a 4x8 loaf pan. Pour the grape juice mixture over the berries, and press down on the berries to submerge them into the juice/gelatin mixture.\n4 Chill: Cover with plastic wrap. Chill in the refrigerator until firm, 3 hours.\n5 Un-mold: To un-mold, fill a basin half-way with hot water. Carefully lower the bottom of the loaf pan into the hot water and hold for 5 to 8 seconds. This will melt the gelatin at the edge of the pan, helping it to release.\nRun a dull knife around the edge of the pan as well.\nPlace a serving platter topside down on top of the loaf pan and turn the whole thing over. Shake gently to release the mold.\nSlice to serve.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
b'Save It Print\nBerries and Banana Fruit Salad Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesYield: Serves 6-8\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups hulled, roughly chopped strawberries\nA handful of raspberries\n1 cup blueberries\n1 apple, peeled, cored, roughly chopped\n2 bananas, peeled and thickly sliced\n1/2 teaspoon lemon zest\n2 teaspoons lemon juice\n1 teaspoon honey\nMETHOD\nPrep the berries before the bananas and apples, and add them to a large bowl.\nAs soon as you add the bananas and apples, sprinkle lemon juice over them to keep them from getting brown.\nAdd the zest and the honey and gently toss to combine.\nServe immediately. b'Print\nBlueberry Buckle Recipe\nPrep time: 5 minutesCook time: 1 hour, 10 minutesYield: Makes 8 servings\nMake sure your baking powder is fresh and still active. To test, put a teaspoon of baking powder in a small bowl. Sprinkle with a little warm water. If the baking powder is still good it will bubble up. (See The Difference Between Baking Soda and Baking Powder for more info.)\nINGREDIENTS\nCake ingredients:\n2 cups (260 g) all purpose flour (plus 1-2 Tbsp of flour for dusting the blueberries)\n2 teaspoons baking powder\n1/2 teaspoon salt\n1/4 cup (1/2 stick, 57 g) unsalted butter, softened\n3/4 cup (150 g) sugar\n1 large egg\n1/2 cup (120 ml) milk\n1 pint (550 ml) blueberries\nTopping ingredients:\n1/4 cup (57 g) unsalted butter, softened\n1/2 cup (100 g) sugar\n1/3 cup (45 g) all purpose flour\n1/2 teaspoon cinnamon\nMETHODHIDE PHOTOS\n1 Preheat the oven to 375\xc2\xb0F (190\xc2\xb0C). Butter the inside of an 8-inch springform pan. Set aside.\n2 Whisk together the 2 cups of flour, the baking powder and the salt in a medium bowl.\n3 Using a stand mixer (or by hand with a wooden spoon) beat together the butter and sugar until fluffy, about 3 minutes. Beat in the egg.\n4 Add the flour mixture in 3 parts, alternating with the milk. Toss the berries with the remaining 1 to 2 tablespoons of flour (to separate and scatter evenly throughout the batter) and fold in. Pour batter into the prepared pan. Set aside.\n5 Combine ingredients (butter, sugar, flour, cinnamon) for topping with a fork (or by hand) to make crumbly mixture. Sprinkle this over the batter.\n6 Bake for one hour, then test for doneness by gently inserting a fork. If it does not come out clean, give the cake another 5 to 10 minutes to bake.\n7 When the cake has cooled, run a knife around the edges and lift the cake out of the pan.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nPrint'
b'Save It Print\nBlueberry Maple Breakfast Bake Recipe\nPrep time: 15 minutesCook time: 1 hourYield: Makes 9 servings\nCan be prepared the night before, and baked before serving.\nRecipe barely adapted from US Highbush Blueberry Council.\nINGREDIENTS\n1 loaf of rustic white bread, crusts removed, bread cut into 1-inch cubes (about 10 cups)\n4 oz cream cheese, cut into small cubes (about 1 cup)\n2 cups fresh or frozen blueberries, divided (if using frozen berries, defrost and drain them first)\n8 eggs, beaten\n1 1/2 cups milk\n1/4 cup melted butter\n1/4 cup maple syrup plus more for serving\nMETHOD\n1 Preheat oven, prep baking dish: Preheat oven to 350\xc2\xb0F. Grease an 8 or 9-inch square baking dish.\n2 Layer cubed bread, cream cheese, and blueberries in baking dish: Place half of the bread cubes in the dish. Sprinkle cream cheese cubes and half of the blueberries over the bread. Top with remaining bread cubes and blueberries.\n3 Combine eggs, milk, maple syrup, and melted butter in a large bowl and pour over bread mixture.\nTo make ahead, cover and chill overnight, and proceed the next morning to bake.\n3 Bake: Bake at 350\xc2\xb0F until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 1 hour to 1 hr 20 min. Cover with aluminum foil if you notice the edges browning too much during baking.\n4 Serve: Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Cut into squares to serve. Serve with additional maple syrup.\nHello! All photos and content are copyright protected. Please do not use our photos without prior written permission. Thank you!\nSave It Print'
